original: @13b * // sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa bzhugs /
analyzed: @13b * // sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa bzhugs /
translated: Commentary on the Essence of the Eight Branches of Medical Science

original: * // sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: * // sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Commentary on the Essence of the Eight Branches of Medical Science

original: sman gyi ming gi rnam grangs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sman gyi ming gi rnam grangs zhes bya ba /
translated: The chapter called The Synonyms of Medicines

original: bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Master of Medicine.

original: chags la mngon par dga' ba'i bu //
analyzed: chags la mngon par dga' ba'i bu //
translated: Son of one who delights in attachment,

original: zla ba dga' ba zhes bya ba //
analyzed: zla ba dga' ba zhes bya ba //
translated: The one called Moon Delight,

original: thams cad mkhyen la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Having paid homage to the Omniscient One,

original: yan lag brgyad pa las bstan pa'i //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa las bstan pa'i //
translated: The medicines taught in the Eight Branches,

original: sman sde po son cha la sogs //
analyzed: sman sde po son cha la sogs //
translated: Such as the group of five roots and so forth,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sman rnams dang // gzhung gzhan las bshad sman gyi ming //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sman rnams dang // gzhung gzhan las bshad sman gyi ming //
translated: The other medicines, and the names of medicines explained in other texts,

original: spra sbyor nges par bshad par bya //
analyzed: spra sbyor nges par bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain their compounds and synonyms.

original: ma dha na dang / shva sa na dang / r'a tha dang / pandi dang / ta ka ra dang / ga ta ga dang / ga l'a pha la dang / ga ga la dang / tsa la dang / sha l'ardu dang / de dag ni po son cha'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: ma dha na dang / shva sa na dang / r'a tha dang / pandi dang / ta ka ra dang / ga ta ga dang / ga l'a pha la dang / ga ga la dang / tsa la dang / sha l'ardu dang / de dag ni po son cha'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
translated: Madana, Śvetanā, Rāthā, Paṇḍī, Takara, Gatāga, Galāphala, Gagala, Cala, Śālarḍuva—these are the different names of the pomegranate.

original: ma du ya sha dang / ya shi ma du dang / ma du dhu ka dang / aashta h'a dang / ma dhu yashti ga dang / g'i ti ka ta dang / sta la dza ma dang / de dag ni shing mngar gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: ma du ya sha dang / ya shi ma du dang / ma du dhu ka dang / aashta h'a dang / ma dhu yashti ga dang / g'i ti ka ta dang / sta la dza ma dang / de dag ni shing mngar gyi ming gi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: Madūyaśa, Yaśimādu, Madudhūka, Aṣṭahā, Madhūyaṣṭi, Gātika, Stavajāma—these are the synonyms of the sweet flag.

original: ka dhya ka l'an bu ni dang / lam ca dang / tu ma byi dang / a'ishk'a ku dang / mah'a tsa l'a dang / r'a dza pu ti dang / pandi pha la dang / pha tig ta lambu dang / bri had pha l'a dang /
analyzed: ka dhya ka l'an bu ni dang / lam ca dang / tu ma byi dang / a'ishk'a ku dang / mah'a tsa l'a dang / r'a dza pu ti dang / pandi pha la dang / pha tig ta lambu dang / bri had pha l'a dang /
translated: Kadhakalā, Bunī, Lamca, Tumvi, Īṣakū, Mahācalā, Rājapūtī, Paṇḍiphaṭa, Phaṭigtalamba, Bṛhatphala—

original: de dag ni ku pa kha bo'i ming yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni ku pa kha bo'i ming yin no //
translated: these are the names of the kupakava.

original: nimpa dang / aa ri sha dang / subha ttra dang / pi tsu marda dang / sha kha pri ya dang / su tig ta dang / sarba to bhattra dang / pa bhutta dang / ba ri tig ta ka dang de rnams ni nimpa'i ming yin no //🔽ma h'a nimpa dang / go ri ka dang / shu ka ma l'a ka dang / bri had nimpa ka dang / nim ka ra dang // ra mu ka dang / bri shva mu shvi ka dang / de dag ni nimpa chen po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: nimpa dang / aa ri sha dang / subha ttra dang / pi tsu marda dang / sha kha pri ya dang / su tig ta dang / sarba to bhattra dang / pa bhutta dang / ba ri tig ta ka dang de rnams ni nimpa'i ming yin no // ma h'a nimpa dang / go ri ka dang / shu ka ma l'a ka dang / bri had nimpa ka dang / nim ka ra dang // ra mu ka dang / bri shva mu shvi ka dang / de dag ni nimpa chen po'i ming yin no //
translated: nimba, ariṣṭa, subhadra, picumarda, śaṅkhapriya, sutikta, sarvatobhadra, pavitra, varatiktaka—these are the names of nimba.🔽mahānimba, gorika, śukamālāka, bṛhatnimbaka, nimbaka, ramuka, bṛśa, muśvīka—these are the names of mahānimba.

original: byim byi dang / rakta pa ta pha l'a dang / go ha dang / tundi gi ri dang / tundi dang / ao sha pa pha l'a dang / dandi dang / rakta pa tra la dang / da dag ni cim pa'i ming yin no //
analyzed: byim byi dang / rakta pa ta pha l'a dang / go ha dang / tundi gi ri dang / tundi dang / ao sha pa pha l'a dang / dandi dang / rakta pa tra la dang / da dag ni cim pa'i ming yin no //
translated: bimbī, raktapallava, gohā, tuṇḍigiri, tuṇḍi, oṣa, pallava, daṇḍi, raktapallava—these are the names of bimbī.

original: ci sh'al'a dang / mri ge ra cu ru dang / ga baksha dang / ga tsa tsar bhi tri dang / gha ba da ni dang / stu la hp'a l'a dang / mri ga cag kshi dang / aitra ba ru ni dang / de dag ni byi sha la'i ming yin no //🔽tsitra pa la dang / tum pa si dang / ma dhu sab bha b'a dang / aintre ba ru dang / ha ti danti dang / tsi tra de bri dang / ma h'a pha la dang / de dag kyang byi sha la gcig gi ming gi @14a * //🔽bye brag yin no //
analyzed: ci sh'al'a dang / mri ge ra cu ru dang / ga baksha dang / ga tsa tsar bhi tri dang / gha ba da ni dang / stu la hp'a l'a dang / mri ga cag kshi dang / aitra ba ru ni dang / de dag ni byi sha la'i ming yin no // tsitra pa la dang / tum pa si dang / ma dhu sab bha b'a dang / aintre ba ru dang / ha ti danti dang / tsi tra de bri dang / ma h'a pha la dang / de dag kyang byi sha la gcig gi ming gi @14a * // bye brag yin no //
translated: Śālī, Merukacchu, Gabhasti, Kacchavacchibhītri, Gabhīraṇī, Tulasthāpāla, Merukaccha, Itrāvaruni, these are the names of the Bīṣas.🔽Citrapāṭa, Tumbapāṭa, Madhusambhava, Itrāvarupa, Hatidantī, Citradeva, Mahāphala, these are the names of one of the Bīṣas.🔽🔽

original: pra pu sa dang / ku tu ka dang / tig ta dang / mu tra la dang / ha ti pa rni dang / tshar dang parni dang / mutr'a pha la dang / pan du pa tra dang / mu kha phri yang dang / de dag ni ga gon gyi ming yin no //
analyzed: pra pu sa dang / ku tu ka dang / tig ta dang / mu tra la dang / ha ti pa rni dang / tshar dang parni dang / mutr'a pha la dang / pan du pa tra dang / mu kha phri yang dang / de dag ni ga gon gyi ming yin no //
translated: Śālā, Migī, Caru, Gabhakṣa, Gabhaṭa, Gabhaṇī, Gabhastimān, Gabhasti, Gabhastihasta, Gabhastimat, Gabhastipa, Gabhastibhūṣa, Gabhastibhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣita, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgī, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgī, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣaṇa, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅga, Gabhastibhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣitāṅgībhūṣa

original: kuta dza dang / tsad tsa ka dang / tud tsha dang / briksha ka dang / ga rim la li ka dang / ba ri tig ta dang / shang ka briksha dang / ku ta tsi dang / ni la yashti ka dang / de dag ni dug mo nyung gi shing gi ming ngo //🔽bad tsha ka dang / ko ta dza dang / ka li ga ka dang / sha ku p'a hva dang / aindra ya ba dang / aa b'a hva ya dang / de dag ni dug mo nyung gi sa bon gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: kuta dza dang / tsad tsa ka dang / tud tsha dang / briksha ka dang / ga rim la li ka dang / ba ri tig ta dang / shang ka briksha dang / ku ta tsi dang / ni la yashti ka dang / de dag ni dug mo nyung gi shing gi ming ngo // bad tsha ka dang / ko ta dza dang / ka li ga ka dang / sha ku p'a hva dang / aindra ya ba dang / aa b'a hva ya dang / de dag ni dug mo nyung gi sa bon gyi ming ngo //
translated: kutaja, tsadaka, tudtsa, brikṣaka, garimālikā, baritikta, śaṅkhabrikṣa, kutaci, nilāśtikā. These are the names of the kutaja tree.🔽badhtsa, koṭaja, kāligaka, śakūpāhava, indrayava, avāhava. These are the names of the kutaja seed.

original: murba dang / ma dhu ra sa dang / de bi dang / p'i lu parni dang / ma dhu pra ba dang / sashto na dang / ma dhu pa ti dang / la ku parna dang / prithag tva tsa dang / de dag ni mur ba'i ming du bshad do //
analyzed: murba dang / ma dhu ra sa dang / de bi dang / p'i lu parni dang / ma dhu pra ba dang / sashto na dang / ma dhu pa ti dang / la ku parna dang / prithag tva tsa dang / de dag ni mur ba'i ming du bshad do //
translated: murva, madhurasā, devī, pīluparṇi, madhuparvā, śatāvarī, madhuphālī, lakuparṇī, prithaktāvacā. These are explained as the names of murvā.

original: dzi mu ta ka dang / de bar li dang / brid tra ko sha dang / gha rva ga ri dang / ce ni dang / lo ma sha pa tra dang / karko ti dang / aa ku bi sha pa ha dang / de dag ni dzimu ta ka'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dzi mu ta ka dang / de bar li dang / brid tra ko sha dang / gha rva ga ri dang / ce ni dang / lo ma sha pa tra dang / karko ti dang / aa ku bi sha pa ha dang / de dag ni dzimu ta ka'i ming ngo //
translated: Alamba,🔽Cittadūla,🔽Krimīhara,🔽Jandugana,🔽Krimīśana,

original: byi dang ga dang / kra ming dzid dang / ce la ka dang / aa lamba dang / tsitta tan du la dang / kri mi har dang / dzan dug na dang / kri min sha na dang / de dag ni bying da ga'i ming yin no //
analyzed: byi dang ga dang / kra ming dzid dang / ce la ka dang / aa lamba dang / tsitta tan du la dang / kri mi har dang / dzan dug na dang / kri min sha na dang / de dag ni bying da ga'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of Bīja.🔽Pehasaka,🔽Bīdula,🔽Tāmamra,🔽Banyula,🔽Dīrgapatraka,🔽Natiya,🔽Ghanapuspa,🔽Jālokasāmatrīḍa,

original: pe ha sa dang / byi du la dang / t'a ma mra dang / banydzu la dang / dirgha pa tra ka dang / nati ya dang / ganbha pushpa dang / dza lo k'a s'a ma tri t'a dang / de dag ni lcang ma'i ming yin no //
analyzed: pe ha sa dang / byi du la dang / t'a ma mra dang / banydzu la dang / dirgha pa tra ka dang / nati ya dang / ganbha pushpa dang / dza lo k'a s'a ma tri t'a dang / de dag ni lcang ma'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of bamboo.

original: na di gu la pri ya dang / su shi ta dang / me gha pushpa dang / dza le dze tu dang / to ya ka ma dang / ni tsu la dang / dza le pe ta pa dang / de dag ni chu lcang gi ming gi rnam grangs so //🔽tsi tra ka dang / da ha na dang / can ni dang / p'a ca ka dang / aa na la dang / dzo ti dang / bya ma dang / dvi pa dang / p'a thin dang / da ru na dang / de dag rnams ni kru trug tres kyi ming yin no //
analyzed: na di gu la pri ya dang / su shi ta dang / me gha pushpa dang / dza le dze tu dang / to ya ka ma dang / ni tsu la dang / dza le pe ta pa dang / de dag ni chu lcang gi ming gi rnam grangs so // tsi tra ka dang / da ha na dang / can ni dang / p'a ca ka dang / aa na la dang / dzo ti dang / bya ma dang / dvi pa dang / p'a thin dang / da ru na dang / de dag rnams ni kru trug tres kyi ming yin no //
translated: Nāḍigupriya, Suśīta, Meghapuṣpa, Jalejetu, Toyakāma, Nicula, Jalepetapā, these are the names of the water cane.🔽Citraka, Dahanaka, Canika, Pācaka, Anala, Jyoti, Byaṃa, Dvipa, Pāṭhina, Daruna, these are the names of the krutukaka.

original: danti dang / bu ka la ka dang / tsittra dang / ni kumpa dang / au pa tsa tra ka dang ; ku la dang / au du mb'ar pa rni dang / byi sha li dang / ghu na pri ya dang / de dag ni danti'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: danti dang / bu ka la ka dang / tsittra dang / ni kumpa dang / au pa tsa tra ka dang ; ku la dang / au du mb'ar pa rni dang / byi sha li dang / ghu na pri ya dang / de dag ni danti'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Danta, Bukalakaka, Citra, Nikumbha, Upajātika, Kula, Udumbara, Viśāla, Ghuṇapri, these are the names of the danta.

original: tra banti na dang / shampa ri dang / tsittra dang / ni kun pa dang / nya gro kro tra badha na dang / mu sh'i k'a y'a dang / pra tyan shri ni dang / bre she randa dang / su ta shri ni dang / aa ku karni ka dang /
analyzed: tra banti na dang / shampa ri dang / tsittra dang / ni kun pa dang / nya gro kro tra badha na dang / mu sh'i k'a y'a dang / pra tyan shri ni dang / bre she randa dang / su ta shri ni dang / aa ku karni ka dang /
translated: Travanti, Sampada, Citra, Nikunja, Nagaropabhana, Mushikaya, Pratyashini, Dreshernanda, Sutasini, and Akunakarika.

original: @14b de dag ni tra ban ti'i ming gi rnam grangs so //🔽ko sha ta ki dang / kri ta tsittra dang / dza la ni dang / kri ta ba dha na dang / kshve dam dang / sba tig dang / ha ghando lid dang / ming dang ga pi ka dang de dang ni ko sha ta ta ki'i ming yin no //
analyzed: @14b de dag ni tra ban ti'i ming gi rnam grangs so // ko sha ta ki dang / kri ta tsittra dang / dza la ni dang / kri ta ba dha na dang / kshve dam dang / sba tig dang / ha ghando lid dang / ming dang ga pi ka dang de dang ni ko sha ta ta ki'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the synonyms of Travanti.🔽Koshataki, Kritacitra, Jalanika, Kritabhana, Kshavedam, Batigha, Haganadoli, Minga, and Gipika. These are the names of Koshataki.

original: r'a dza ko shat ki dang / kar ki ti dang / has ti bkra dang / dva marka dang ; ko sha ta pha l'a dang / mah'a dza li ni dang / de dag ni r'a dza ko sha taki'i ming yin no //
analyzed: r'a dza ko shat ki dang / kar ki ti dang / has ti bkra dang / dva marka dang ; ko sha ta pha l'a dang / mah'a dza li ni dang / de dag ni r'a dza ko sha taki'i ming yin no //
translated: Rajakoshataki, Karkiti, Hastibhadra, Dvamarka, Koshatapala, and Mahajalini. These are the names of Rajakoshataki.

original: ka ranydza dang / nag ta ma la bra dang / pra kir tya dang / pus shu manydza r'i dang / gri pa tapu ra dang / gud tsha pushpa dang / snig dha ka ranydza ka dang / de dag ni shve ta ka ranydza'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ka ranydza dang / nag ta ma la bra dang / pra kir tya dang / pus shu manydza r'i dang / gri pa tapu ra dang / gud tsha pushpa dang / snig dha ka ranydza ka dang / de dag ni shve ta ka ranydza'i ming yin no //
translated: Karnaja, Nagatamalapra, Prakrittya, Pushumanjara, Grihapatpura, Gudashapushpa, Snigdhakarnaka, these are the names of Shvetakarnika.

original: aud ki rya dang / ke ri mya dang / mi tri nanda na dang / tsi ri byil ba dang / pu ti sa h'a dang / pu ti ka dang / danta dha ba na dang / de dag ni pu ka ranydza zhes bya ba srin sman me ru'i ming yin no //
analyzed: aud ki rya dang / ke ri mya dang / mi tri nanda na dang / tsi ri byil ba dang / pu ti sa h'a dang / pu ti ka dang / danta dha ba na dang / de dag ni pu ka ranydza zhes bya ba srin sman me ru'i ming yin no //
translated: Ukirya, Kerimya, Mitrinandana, Cirvilabha, Putihasa, Putika, Dantadhavanana, these are the names of Pukarnika, the medicinal plant known as Meru.

original: pi pi ling dang / ma ga bha dang / krishna dang / bee de h'i dang / tsa pa la dang / ka na dang / aa pa gul lya dang / ma ga ti ka dang / shen tyi dang ka lo dang / ao na dang /
analyzed: pi pi ling dang / ma ga bha dang / krishna dang / bee de h'i dang / tsa pa la dang / ka na dang / aa pa gul lya dang / ma ga ti ka dang / shen tyi dang ka lo dang / ao na dang /
translated: Pippali, Magadha, Krishna, Vaidehi, Capala, Kana, Apagulya, Magatika, Shentya, Kala, Ona,

original: ka tu dang / de dag ni pi pi ling gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: ka tu dang / de dag ni pi pi ling gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Kata, these are the synonyms of Pippali.

original: ma la dang / pi pi ling m'ul dang / ka la mu pa dang / granthig dang / tsha pha la m'u la dang / krishna m'u la dang / sho di dza dang / de dag ni pi pi ling gi rtsa ba'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ma la dang / pi pi ling m'ul dang / ka la mu pa dang / granthig dang / tsha pha la m'u la dang / krishna m'u la dang / sho di dza dang / de dag ni pi pi ling gi rtsa ba'i ming yin no //
translated: Malati, Pippalimula, Kalimuga, Granthika, Tshaphala mula, Krishna mula, Shodhaja, these are the names of Pippali root.

original: sen da ba dang / mi ni bhan dang / na de ya dang ; ba la notta ba ma dang / sindu da tha dang / sindu da dza dang / shreshta la ba na dang / bam la dang / ba ra dang / de dag ni lan tshva'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: sen da ba dang / mi ni bhan dang / na de ya dang ; ba la notta ba ma dang / sindu da tha dang / sindu da dza dang / shreshta la ba na dang / bam la dang / ba ra dang / de dag ni lan tshva'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Sendhava, Minibhanda, Nadi, Valanottabhamana, Sindhuta, Sindhutaja, Shreshtalabhana, Bhamala, Vara, these are the synonyms of salt.

original: soo bar tshal dang / ru ra ka dang / su gnad byi dang / aandha ga da ka dang / aa ksha dang / ka la la ba na dang / krishna dang de dag ni kha ru tsha'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: soo bar tshal dang / ru ra ka dang / su gnad byi dang / aandha ga da ka dang / aa ksha dang / ka la la ba na dang / krishna dang de dag ni kha ru tsha'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Sauvarchala, Rucika, Sugandha, Andhagadhaka, Aksha, Kalalavana, Krishna, these are the synonyms of black salt.

original: bi ta bra dang / kri ti lam dang / mann+ya dang / gadi la ban dang / dra ba dam dang / khan da la ba na dang / kri ta ka dang / durta aa su ra dang / de dag ni rtsal ru tsha'i ming yin no //
analyzed: bi ta bra dang / kri ti lam dang / mann+ya dang / gadi la ban dang / dra ba dam dang / khan da la ba na dang / kri ta ka dang / durta aa su ra dang / de dag ni rtsal ru tsha'i ming yin no //
translated: Vītavra, Kṛtilāma, Mannya, Gidalava, Dravaṇa, Kṛtaka, Durta, Asura—these are the names of the salt-producing regions.

original: su mutta ba la na dang / tri ku sra dang / ca ri cam bha dang / sa muttra dza dang / sa ga ra dza dang / la ba no da dhi sam bha dang / de dag ni rgya mtsho'i tsha'i ming yin no //
analyzed: su mutta ba la na dang / tri ku sra dang / ca ri cam bha dang / sa muttra dza dang / sa ga ra dza dang / la ba no da dhi sam bha dang / de dag ni rgya mtsho'i tsha'i ming yin no //
translated: Sumuttabhaṇa, Trikusa, Caricambha, Samuttraja, Sagara, Lavaṇodadhi, Sambha—these are the names of the oceans.

original: au bhi da dang / phar this dang / coo mam dang / bhu myu ca dang / pra thi bi bha ma dang / de dag ni lan tshva khrol bu'i ming yin no //
analyzed: au bhi da dang / phar this dang / coo mam dang / bhu myu ca dang / pra thi bi bha ma dang / de dag ni lan tshva khrol bu'i ming yin no //
translated: Ubbida, Parthiva, Cōma, Bhūmyuja, Prativībha, Ma—these are the names of the salt-producing regions.

original: lan tshva rnam pa lnga po de dag ni lan tshva rnams kyi nang nas gtso gtsor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lan tshva rnam pa lnga po de dag ni lan tshva rnams kyi nang nas gtso gtsor bstan pa yin no //
translated: These five types of salt are taught as the principal ones among salts.

original: patu dang @15a * //
analyzed: patu dang @15a * //
translated: Patu,

original: la tsa ni zhes smos pa ni lan tshva spyi'i ming yin no //
analyzed: la tsa ni zhes smos pa ni lan tshva spyi'i ming yin no //
translated: and lacana are general terms for salt.

original: lan tshva thams cad kyi gor ni rgyam tsha gtang du rung ste /
analyzed: lan tshva thams cad kyi gor ni rgyam tsha gtang du rung ste /
translated: In all salt preparations, rock salt is suitable.

original: tsha gzhan med na yang de'i skyin par sbyor ba kun gyi nang du rgyam tsha gang gtang ngo //
analyzed: tsha gzhan med na yang de'i skyin par sbyor ba kun gyi nang du rgyam tsha gang gtang ngo //
translated: If there is no other salt, one should add one part of rock salt to all the ingredients.

original: ya pa sa ksha ra dang / ya ba shu ka dang / ya ba dza dang / ya ba dza shu ga dza dang / de dag ni nas tshig 'khus pa thal ba'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ya pa sa ksha ra dang / ya ba shu ka dang / ya ba dza dang / ya ba dza shu ga dza dang / de dag ni nas tshig 'khus pa thal ba'i ming yin no //
translated: Yavakshara, yavashuka, yavaja, yavajashugandha, these are the names of burnt barley husk ash.

original: sardzi ksha ra dang / shrog gh'i ni dang / p'a ki dang / sardzi ka dang / de dag ni sardzi ka'i thal ba'i ming yin no //
analyzed: sardzi ksha ra dang / shrog gh'i ni dang / p'a ki dang / sardzi ka dang / de dag ni sardzi ka'i thal ba'i ming yin no //
translated: Sardjokshara, shroghani, pakhi, sardjika, these are the names of sardjika ash.

original: ba tsa dang / bu gra gan dang / dza di la dang / shad granthi dang / he ma tsan ti dang / de dag ni shu dag gi ming yin no //
analyzed: ba tsa dang / bu gra gan dang / dza di la dang / shad granthi dang / he ma tsan ti dang / de dag ni shu dag gi ming yin no //
translated: Vacha, bhurja, jivanti, shandhanthi, hemachandrika, these are the names of shudaka.

original: shukla dang / tikk'a gandha dang / au gra dang / raksho gha dang / lo ma sha dang / dza ya dang / de dag ni shu dag dkar po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: shukla dang / tikk'a gandha dang / au gra dang / raksho gha dang / lo ma sha dang / dza ya dang / de dag ni shu dag dkar po'i ming yin no //
translated: Shukla, tikka, gandha, uggra, rakshogha, loma sha, jaya, these are the names of white shudaka.

original: tra pyi di dang / tu tsha dang / b'a le la dang / ba pu la dang / tu ti da dang / kshu tra'i la dang / ni kshu ti dang / tsantra dang / gha dra bi snga ba ni dang de dag ni sug smel gyi ming yin no //🔽pad tre la dang / bri had ae la dang / sthu le la dang / trag su gandhe ka dang / tri de ba dang / tri de co da bhutta dang / trid tha ga dang / kanu ka dang / pa tra dang / de dag ni sug smel pa tra ae la zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig gi ming ngo //
analyzed: tra pyi di dang / tu tsha dang / b'a le la dang / ba pu la dang / tu ti da dang / kshu tra'i la dang / ni kshu ti dang / tsantra dang / gha dra bi snga ba ni dang de dag ni sug smel gyi ming yin no // pad tre la dang / bri had ae la dang / sthu le la dang / trag su gandhe ka dang / tri de ba dang / tri de co da bhutta dang / trid tha ga dang / kanu ka dang / pa tra dang / de dag ni sug smel pa tra ae la zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig gi ming ngo //
translated: Trapudi, Tusha, Valila, Vupula, Tutida, Kshutrila, Nikshuti, Chandra, and Gadravi-sabana are the names of nutmeg.🔽Padtrela, Brihadae, Sthulela, Traksugandhaka, Trideva, Tridecobudhat, Triddhatagandha, Kanuka, and Patra are the names of one kind of nutmeg called Patre-ela.

original: ha ra n+ya dang / re nu ka dang / kon tir dang / pandu parni dang / bri haddu ti dang ; ka pi la dang / ra dza pu ti dang / gandi ni zhes kyang kha cig 'dod de de dag ni ha re nu ka'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ha ra n+ya dang / re nu ka dang / kon tir dang / pandu parni dang / bri haddu ti dang ; ka pi la dang / ra dza pu ti dang / gandi ni zhes kyang kha cig 'dod de de dag ni ha re nu ka'i ming yin no //
translated: Haranya, Renuka, Konti, Panduparni, Brihadati, Kapila, Rajaputi, and Gandina are the names of Renuka.

original: sa ra sha pa dang / dum du bha dang / ga 'u ra dang / siddha rtha dang / bhu ta n'a sha na dang / gra hagnan dang / ka tya ka dang / shveta dang / raksha na dang / byi dza ya ba ha dang /
analyzed: sa ra sha pa dang / dum du bha dang / ga 'u ra dang / siddha rtha dang / bhu ta n'a sha na dang / gra hagnan dang / ka tya ka dang / shveta dang / raksha na dang / byi dza ya ba ha dang /
translated: Sarashapa, Dumbubha, Gaura, Siddhartha, Bhumanashana, Grahagnan, Katyaka, Shveta, Rakshana, Vijaya-vaha,

original: de dag ni yungs kar gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de dag ni yungs kar gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are the synonyms of white mustard.🔽Asurī, Rājakā, Tishtikā, Raktasārashapa, Kyabyakā, Tishangandha, Sutibhashana, Kshavaka, Kshura,

original: aa su ri dang / r'a dza ka dang / trishti ka dang / rakta s'a ra sha ba dang / kya bya ka dang / tishna gandha dang / su ti bashna dang / ksha ba ka dang / kshu ra dang / de dag ni skye tshe'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: aa su ri dang / r'a dza ka dang / trishti ka dang / rakta s'a ra sha ba dang / kya bya ka dang / tishna gandha dang / su ti bashna dang / ksha ba ka dang / kshu ra dang / de dag ni skye tshe'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are the synonyms of birthwort.🔽Tricit, Tricittri, Tridita, Kumha, Kutarana, Sarvanubhutita, Tributta, Shama, Koshphala,

original: tri tsid dang / tri tsittri dang / tri ti ta dang / kumha dang / ku ta ra na dang / sarba nu bhu ti ta dang / tri bu ta dang / sh'a m'a dang / ko shapha la dang / de dag ni shing nye rong ste ru dur byid kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: tri tsid dang / tri tsittri dang / tri ti ta dang / kumha dang / ku ta ra na dang / sarba nu bhu ti ta dang / tri bu ta dang / sh'a m'a dang / ko shapha la dang / de dag ni shing nye rong ste ru dur byid kyi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the tree called rudraksha.

original: ma la byi ka dang / pa lindhi dang / ka la me shi dang / k'a l'a dang / ma tu ra ra byi da la dang / tammu pushpi dang / aarta tsantri ka dang / de dag ni ba la dur byid kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: ma la byi ka dang / pa lindhi dang / ka la me shi dang / k'a l'a dang / ma tu ra ra byi da la dang / tammu pushpi dang / aarta tsantri ka dang / de dag ni ba la dur byid kyi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the white thorn-apple.

original: 'bras bu gsum zhes bya ba @15b ni ;
analyzed: 'bras bu gsum zhes bya ba @15b ni ;
translated: The so-called three fruits are

original: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra rnams yin te /
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra rnams yin te /
translated: Haritaki, Vibhitaki, and Amalaki.

original: de'i ming ni /
analyzed: de'i ming ni /
translated: Their names are🔽Udaka, Varaka, Shreshtatva, Phalanrikta, Phalatrika,

original: au dha ma dang / bar ma dang / shreshta dang / pha la nri ka dang / pha la tri ya dang / de dag ni 'bras bu gsum gyi spyi'i ming yin no //
analyzed: au dha ma dang / bar ma dang / shreshta dang / pha la nri ka dang / pha la tri ya dang / de dag ni 'bras bu gsum gyi spyi'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the general names of the three fruits.

original: ha ri ta ka dang / aa bha ya dang / pad thya dang / sran ma datta dang / byi tsa dang / shi ba dang / aa bya tha dang / stu ta na dang / aa mo gha dang / tse ta ki dang / mri ta na dang /
analyzed: ha ri ta ka dang / aa bha ya dang / pad thya dang / sran ma datta dang / byi tsa dang / shi ba dang / aa bya tha dang / stu ta na dang / aa mo gha dang / tse ta ki dang / mri ta na dang /
translated: Haritaki, Abhaya, Padya, Dattat, Vichita, Shiva, Abhyatha, Stuta, Amogha, Chetaki, Mritana,🔽Amrita,

original: aa mri ta dang / de dag ni aa ru ra'i ming yin no //
analyzed: aa mri ta dang / de dag ni aa ru ra'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of Haritaki.

original: tra ti pha dang / aa ma la ka dang / dza tir sa pha la dang / shi ba dang / ko rang ka ka dang / aa mri ta dang / pha la dang / shr'i pha la dang / aa mri tongbha bra dang / de dag ni skyu ru ra'i ming gi bye brag go / bi ta sha dang /🔽kar sha pha la dang / ka li bhri ksha dang / ka lo tu ma dang / ba panta ka dang / bu ta tsa sa dang / ha ryaksho dang / ya man prir ya dang / de dag ni ba ru ra'i ming gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: tra ti pha dang / aa ma la ka dang / dza tir sa pha la dang / shi ba dang / ko rang ka ka dang / aa mri ta dang / pha la dang / shr'i pha la dang / aa mri tongbha bra dang / de dag ni skyu ru ra'i ming gi bye brag go / bi ta sha dang / kar sha pha la dang / ka li bhri ksha dang / ka lo tu ma dang / ba panta ka dang / bu ta tsa sa dang / ha ryaksho dang / ya man prir ya dang / de dag ni ba ru ra'i ming gi dbye ba'o //
translated: Tatipha, Amala, Jatirasa, Shipa, Koranga, Amrita, Phala, Shriphala, Amritotbhava, these are the different names of tamarind.🔽Vitash, Karshapala, Kalibriksha, Kalotuma, Vapantaka, Butchasaka, Haryaksha, Yamanpriya, these are the different names of cardamom.

original: su da dang / n+ya da dang / ma briksha dang / gan dri ba dang / badzra kar mu ka dang / snu ha dang / sa manta du gta dang / sbug dang / badzri ri dang / ni shri sha patta ka dang / de dag ni shi ri kha nda'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: su da dang / n+ya da dang / ma briksha dang / gan dri ba dang / badzra kar mu ka dang / snu ha dang / sa manta du gta dang / sbug dang / badzri ri dang / ni shri sha patta ka dang / de dag ni shi ri kha nda'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Suda, Nyada, Mabriksha, Gandrabha, Vajrakarmuka, Snubha, Samantadugtat, Bukka, Vajiri, Nisshrishapatika, these are the different names of shirikhanda.

original: sham khi ni dang / tig ta la dang / tsid tsa dang / ya pa tig ta dang / aa ksha p'i da ka dang / ba yu phe phab dang / ba yu ra sa dang / da da p'a da dang / ci sar pi ni dang /
analyzed: sham khi ni dang / tig ta la dang / tsid tsa dang / ya pa tig ta dang / aa ksha p'i da ka dang / ba yu phe phab dang / ba yu ra sa dang / da da p'a da dang / ci sar pi ni dang /
translated: vayurasas,🔽dadapada,🔽chirapinika,🔽and so on.

original: de dag ni sham khi ni'i ming yin no ;
analyzed: de dag ni sham khi ni'i ming yin no ;
translated: These are the names of shamkini.🔽kalika,🔽kala,🔽nila,🔽runivishonni,🔽grama,🔽tusha,🔽nilapushya,🔽chiravira,🔽vahibhi,🔽and so on. These are the names of nila.

original: / ka li ka dang / ka la dang / n'i la dang / ru ni bi shod ni dang / gr'a mya dang / tud tsha dang / n'i la pus shyi dang / tsi ra bi ra dang / b'a hi byi dang / de dag ni ni li'i ming yin no //
analyzed: / ka li ka dang / ka la dang / n'i la dang / ru ni bi shod ni dang / gr'a mya dang / tud tsha dang / n'i la pus shyi dang / tsi ra bi ra dang / b'a hi byi dang / de dag ni ni li'i ming yin no //
translated: rotra,🔽gatirita,🔽shiberi,🔽tipalbakapada,🔽shabara,🔽ghanatvagaka,🔽briharadhada,🔽patishvarapada,

original: ro tra dang / ga ti ri ta dang / shi be ri dang / ti palba ka pa dang / sh'a ba ra dang / gha na tvag ka dang / bri ha ra dha da dang / pa ti dang sha bar pa dang / de dag ni sha ba dang rig ser phrom gyi ming nga //
analyzed: ro tra dang / ga ti ri ta dang / shi be ri dang / ti palba ka pa dang / sh'a ba ra dang / gha na tvag ka dang / bri ha ra dha da dang / pa ti dang sha bar pa dang / de dag ni sha ba dang rig ser phrom gyi ming nga //
translated: and so on. These are the names of shabara and rikse.

original: sha ba ra ka dang / shve ta rodd'a dang / aa kshi be sha dza dang / dzir na buddha na dang / bri had pattra dang / kra mu ka dang / sthu la ba ka dang / de dag ni seng phrom dkar po'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: sha ba ra ka dang / shve ta rodd'a dang / aa kshi be sha dza dang / dzir na buddha na dang / bri had pattra dang / kra mu ka dang / sthu la ba ka dang / de dag ni seng phrom dkar po'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
translated: Aragvadha,🔽Raja-priksha,🔽Shamya-ka,🔽Charu-shanguli,🔽Karnika,🔽Bhidagati,🔽Grita-mala,🔽Reeta,

original: aa rag gva dang / r'a dza prigsha dang / sha mya ka dang / tsa rus aanggu li dang / karni ka dang / bya di ga ti dang / gri ta ma la dang / re'i ta dang / de dag ni dang ka'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: aa rag gva dang / r'a dza prigsha dang / sha mya ka dang / tsa rus aanggu li dang / karni ka dang / bya di ga ti dang / gri ta ma la dang / re'i ta dang / de dag ni dang ka'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are the synonyms of dhang.🔽Kamvi-lya,🔽Ruchana-ka,🔽Rakta-churna-ka,🔽Rakta-ga,

original: kam bi lya ka dang / r'u tsa na ka dang / rakta ts'ur na ka dang / rakta g'a dang / rakta sham dang / tsi re ki dang / bran shod na dang / de dag ni kam'i lya ga'i ming yin @16a * //
analyzed: kam bi lya ka dang / r'u tsa na ka dang / rakta ts'ur na ka dang / rakta g'a dang / rakta sham dang / tsi re ki dang / bran shod na dang / de dag ni kam'i lya ga'i ming yin @16a * //
translated: Rakta-sham,🔽Chireki,🔽Brana-shona,🔽These are the names of kamali-ga.

original: no // sva ra na kshi ri dang / he ma dug dha dang / he ma kshi ri dang / ka tsa ni dang / he m'a ba t'i dang / sarba sba na dug dha dang / ma he m'a h'a dang / tig tu dug ti ga dang de dag ni rtsang sman khrol bu'i ming ngo //
analyzed: no // sva ra na kshi ri dang / he ma dug dha dang / he ma kshi ri dang / ka tsa ni dang / he m'a ba t'i dang / sarba sba na dug dha dang / ma he m'a h'a dang / tig tu dug ti ga dang de dag ni rtsang sman khrol bu'i ming ngo //
translated: Saravana-dugdha, Hema-dugdha, Hema-kṣīri, Kacaṇī, Hemāvatī, Sarva-spandana-dugdha, Mahemahā, Tikta-dugdhi—these are the names of the medicinal plants.

original: kshi ra dang / dug dha dang / pa ya sa dang / de dag ni bud med kyi nu zho'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kshi ra dang / dug dha dang / pa ya sa dang / de dag ni bud med kyi nu zho'i ming ngo //
translated: Kṣīra, dugdha, pāyasas—these are the names of women’s milk.

original: 'o ma zhes bya ba gang du 'byung ba der ni ba'i 'o ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma zhes bya ba gang du 'byung ba der ni ba'i 'o ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Wherever it says “milk,” it should be understood to mean cow’s milk.

original: 'o ma gyur pa ni zho zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma gyur pa ni zho zhes bya'o //
translated: The transformation of milk is called “curds.”

original: brjod do // shar zhes bya ba ni zho'i sbris ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod do // shar zhes bya ba ni zho'i sbris ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Shar” should be understood as the cream of curds.

original: da dhi na na t'a zhes bya ba ni zho ga chu la zer ro //
analyzed: da dhi na na t'a zhes bya ba ni zho ga chu la zer ro //
translated: “Dadhi-nāna-tā” means the water of curds.

original: zho bsdus pa las mar byung ba ni mar sar zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zho bsdus pa las mar byung ba ni mar sar zhes brjod do //
translated: From the collection of curds, butter is produced, which is called “ghee.”

original: ming rnams gcig ha yang ga byin zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: ming rnams gcig ha yang ga byin zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The names are the same.

original: sar pi dang / aad dza dang / gri ta dang / ha byi dang / de dag ni mar gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: sar pi dang / aad dza dang / gri ta dang / ha byi dang / de dag ni mar gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of clarified butter.🔽Naudvi, Mathita, Takra, Krāśaya,🔽Vilīta, Dantahaṭa, Gorasa,

original: na aud shvi dang / ma thi tha dang / tag kra dang / kra la sha yam dang / bi li di ta dang / danta ha ta dang / go ras dang / de dag ni dar ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: na aud shvi dang / ma thi tha dang / tag kra dang / kra la sha yam dang / bi li di ta dang / danta ha ta dang / go ras dang / de dag ni dar ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: these are the synonyms for curd.

original: de bsdus pa'i dbu ba ni ka dha ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bsdus pa'i dbu ba ni ka dha ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The foam of that is called Kadamba.🔽Gomūtra, Gojala, Gambu,

original: go mudda tra dang / go dza la dang / gam bu dang / bra hma aambo dang / de dag ni ba gcin gyi ming gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: go mudda tra dang / go dza la dang / gam bu dang / bra hma aambo dang / de dag ni ba gcin gyi ming gi dbye ba'o //
translated: Brahmamūtra, these are the different names for urine.

original: gcin lhag ma bdun po ni so so'i bye brag gis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gcin lhag ma bdun po ni so so'i bye brag gis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The remaining seven urines should be understood by their individual specifics.🔽The names of the feces of the eight types such as cows are Śakṛt,

original: ba lang la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi rtug pa'i ming ni sha kri da dang / ka ri sha dang / tshag na dang / ba gi sha dang / de rnams yin no //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi rtug pa'i ming ni sha kri da dang / ka ri sha dang / tshag na dang / ba gi sha dang / de rnams yin no //
translated: Kariṣa, Śakuna, Vagiṣa,

original: ku sha dang / mud pa la ku na dang / pa ka la ka dang / pa ri ba kyang sya ka dang / aa ma ya dang / gha da dang / rog dang / tva ga to sha dang / bya di dang / de dag ni ru rta'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ku sha dang / mud pa la ku na dang / pa ka la ka dang / pa ri ba kyang sya ka dang / aa ma ya dang / gha da dang / rog dang / tva ga to sha dang / bya di dang / de dag ni ru rta'i ming yin no //
translated: Kusha, Mudha, Lakucha, Pakala, Parivakasa, Amaya, Gada, Rogha, Tagatoksha, and Bhidika. These are the names of the horse.

original: sh'al tu dang / shan tilkhyaka dang / pu ti ba ta dang / ma h'a ba la dang / shr'i pha la dang / shri aa h'a dang / gandha dang shri dang de las kyang bil ba gzhon nu ni cil pa kar ba ka ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sh'al tu dang / shan tilkhyaka dang / pu ti ba ta dang / ma h'a ba la dang / shr'i pha la dang / shri aa h'a dang / gandha dang shri dang de las kyang bil ba gzhon nu ni cil pa kar ba ka ti zhes bya ste /
translated: Shalatu, Shantilakhya, Putivata, Mahavala, Shriphala, Shriahana, Gandha, Shri, and the young Bilva is called Chilpakakarati.

original: de dag ni bil ba'i ming gi bye brag go / kasma ri dang / shri barni hi ra dang / karmi rya dang / kad pa la dang / ka hma ri dang / sarba ba to batra dang / kri sna mi ti ka dang / de dag ni tad pal gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de dag ni bil ba'i ming gi bye brag go / kasma ri dang / shri barni hi ra dang / karmi rya dang / kad pa la dang / ka hma ri dang / sarba ba to batra dang / kri sna mi ti ka dang / de dag ni tad pal gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are the different names of the Bilva. Kasmari, Shrivarnihira, Karmiriya, Kadphala, Kahamari, Sarvabatovata, Krisnamitika. These are the synonyms of the Tadapala.

original: aagni mantha dang / aaghi sa bha na dang / tad ka r'i dang / bi dza ya ti ka dang / bha ni mantha dang / aar ni dang / ke ta dang / dza ya dang / pa ba ka dang / mantha na dang / de dag ni aagni mantha'i ming gi bye brag yin no //🔽pee dza aanti dang / @16b bhanna nirma tha ni dang / dza ya dang / aa ra ni ka dang / dza yanti dang / bi dza ya dang / dza ya bha dang / de dag ni tad ka ri zhes bya ba aagni mantha'i ming gi rnam gcig go / p'a ta li dang /
analyzed: aagni mantha dang / aaghi sa bha na dang / tad ka r'i dang / bi dza ya ti ka dang / bha ni mantha dang / aar ni dang / ke ta dang / dza ya dang / pa ba ka dang / mantha na dang / de dag ni aagni mantha'i ming gi bye brag yin no // pee dza aanti dang / @16b bhanna nirma tha ni dang / dza ya dang / aa ra ni ka dang / dza yanti dang / bi dza ya dang / dza ya bha dang / de dag ni tad ka ri zhes bya ba aagni mantha'i ming gi rnam gcig go / p'a ta li dang /
translated: Agneya, Aghiṣa, Tvakkara, Vijaya, Bhanimanta, Arini, Ketu, Jaya, Pavaka, and Manthana. These are the different names of Agneya.🔽Paeja, Anirmanthana, Jaya, Aranika, Jayanti, Vijaya, Jaya-bha, these are the different names of Tvakkara.

original: krishna britta dang / sta li dang / aa mo ga dang / aambu pa san dang / t'ammra pu shi dang / kun byi ka dang / ku su ma aa ga ma du ti ka dang / de dag ni p'a ta li'i ming yin no //
analyzed: krishna britta dang / sta li dang / aa mo ga dang / aambu pa san dang / t'ammra pu shi dang / kun byi ka dang / ku su ma aa ga ma du ti ka dang / de dag ni p'a ta li'i ming yin no //
translated: Patali, Krishna-vritya, Stali, Amogha, Ambu-pashana, Tamra-pushya, Kunvaka, Kusuma-agamatidaka, these are the different names of Patali.

original: shve ta pra na dang / ka shta pa ta la dang / sha ta kub bi ka dang / ku be da ra ksha dang / pha le ru ha dang / de dag ni pa ta li dkar po rnam gcig gi ming yin no //🔽bhu ta briksha dang / tundu ka dang / dar ga brid da ka dang / ma yu ra dza ga dang / ba lu ka dang / ka dvang ka dang / ra lu ka dang / de dag ni so na ka'i ming yin no //
analyzed: shve ta pra na dang / ka shta pa ta la dang / sha ta kub bi ka dang / ku be da ra ksha dang / pha le ru ha dang / de dag ni pa ta li dkar po rnam gcig gi ming yin no // bhu ta briksha dang / tundu ka dang / dar ga brid da ka dang / ma yu ra dza ga dang / ba lu ka dang / ka dvang ka dang / ra lu ka dang / de dag ni so na ka'i ming yin no //
translated: Śvetaprāṇa, Kaṣṭapatra, Śatakubjika, Kuberadakṣa, Phaleruha, these are the names of the white patali.🔽Bhūtavrīhi, Tunduka, Darga, Bṛhadaka, Mayūra, Jāgara, Valuka, Kadvaṅka, Raluka, these are the names of the sonaka.

original: sti ra dang / sa phu mya dang / tri phu na dhu bha ba dang / bi da ri gandha dang / aang shu ma ti dang / dirgha m'u la dang / p'i ti ka dang / de dag ni s'a la parni'i ming yin no //
analyzed: sti ra dang / sa phu mya dang / tri phu na dhu bha ba dang / bi da ri gandha dang / aang shu ma ti dang / dirgha m'u la dang / p'i ti ka dang / de dag ni s'a la parni'i ming yin no //
translated: Sthira, Saphuma, Triphuna, Dhūbhava, Vidari, Gandha, Aṅśumatī, Dirgha-mūla, Pītikā, these are the names of the sālaparṇī.

original: pri thag parni dang / k'a la shi dang / dha ba na dang / gu ha dang / mri ga dang / cin na tu dang / gri ti li dang / parni dang / sha ka pud tshi ga dang / de dag ni krishna parni'i ming yin no //
analyzed: pri thag parni dang / k'a la shi dang / dha ba na dang / gu ha dang / mri ga dang / cin na tu dang / gri ti li dang / parni dang / sha ka pud tshi ga dang / de dag ni krishna parni'i ming yin no //
translated: Prithakparni, Kalaśī, Dāvana, Guhā, Mṛigā, Cinantī, Grītilikā, Parṇī, Śakapudacchīkā—these are the names of Kṛṣṇaparṇī.

original: pa ba pu pu tra dang / kantha ki dang / sthu la kanta ka dang / ma h'a barta ki ni dang / ma h'a ti dang / ho ti ka dang / kantha ka ri dang / kanta ki ni dang / dha ba ni dang /
analyzed: pa ba pu pu tra dang / kantha ki dang / sthu la kanta ka dang / ma h'a barta ki ni dang / ma h'a ti dang / ho ti ka dang / kantha ka ri dang / kanta ki ni dang / dha ba ni dang /
translated: Pavaputrā, Kanthaki, Sthulakantakā, Mahāvartakī, Mahāṭī, Hotīka, Kanthakarī, Kantakī, Dāvanī,

original: dhu pra bar shi ni dang / ni digdhi ka dang / kshu tra dang / b'arta gi dang / kshutra ka na ha ki dang / de dag ni shri ha ti'i ming du bshad do //
analyzed: dhu pra bar shi ni dang / ni digdhi ka dang / kshu tra dang / b'arta gi dang / kshutra ka na ha ki dang / de dag ni shri ha ti'i ming du bshad do //
translated: Dhūpavarṣiṇī, Nidhigadhika, Kṣuttra, Varttagī, Kṣutrakanahaki—these are explained as the names of Śrīhatī.

original: go kshu ra dang / go kshu ra ka dang / shvo dang / shta dang / kri kanta dang / gokanta ka dang / blag sha ta ka dang / go kandha dang / sv'a du kantha ka dang / de dag ni gze ma'i ming yin no //
analyzed: go kshu ra dang / go kshu ra ka dang / shvo dang / shta dang / kri kanta dang / gokanta ka dang / blag sha ta ka dang / go kandha dang / sv'a du kantha ka dang / de dag ni gze ma'i ming yin no //
translated: gokṣura, gokṣuraka, śveta, śigru, kṛkāṇaka, gokṣuraka, laśuna, gokṣanda, svādukantaka—these are the names of the radish.

original: de ltar rtsa ba chen po lnga dang / chung ngu lnga ste bcu po de dag ni rtsa ba bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba chen po lnga dang / chung ngu lnga ste bcu po de dag ni rtsa ba bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five great roots and the five small ones, these ten are called the ten roots.

original: gong du bshad pa'i rtsa ba lnga pa gnyis po ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i rtsa ba lnga pa gnyis po ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The two sets of five roots explained above are the general teaching.

original: rtsa ba lnga pa lhag ma ni so sor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba lnga pa lhag ma ni so sor bshad pa yin no //
translated: The remaining five roots are the specific explanation.

original: de ba da ru dang / bhad tra tra ru dang / su dang / ru dang / de b'a k'ashta dang / bha tr'a shva dang / su ra da ru dang / aindra da ru dang / de dag ni thang shing gi ming ngo //
analyzed: de ba da ru dang / bhad tra tra ru dang / su dang / ru dang / de b'a k'ashta dang / bha tr'a shva dang / su ra da ru dang / aindra da ru dang / de dag ni thang shing gi ming ngo //
translated: devadāru, bhadrātaru, su, ru, devāgraka, bhadrāśva, surātaru, indrataru—these are the names of the pine tree.

original: yugta dang / gan ta m'ul dang / su ba ha dang / ra sa dang / su gandha dang / aa ti ra sa dang / ra sa dang / ra sa ni dang / gandha na ku li dang / de dag ni ra sna'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yugta dang / gan ta m'ul dang / su ba ha dang / ra sa dang / su gandha dang / aa ti ra sa dang / ra sa dang / ra sa ni dang / gandha na ku li dang / de dag ni ra sna'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Yugata, Gandhamūla, Subaha, Rasa, Sugandha, Atirāsa, Rāsa, Rāsani, Gandhanakuli—these are the synonyms for Rāsnā.

original: sngo ba dang / @17a * //🔽trishna sh'u ka dang / ba byid tri dang / b'a dza nam pri ya dang / aa sha ksha ta dang / bha ru dza dang de dag ni nas kyi ming ste /🔽de brngos pa ni yos zhes bya'o //🔽sha ta pushpa dang / mi si dang / gho sha dang / sha t'a h'a dang / ka ra bi dang / sha pha dang / aa ba ma dushpa dang / ma dhu ra ga dang / chad tra dang / sim ha ta la pa tra dang /
analyzed: sngo ba dang / @17a * // trishna sh'u ka dang / ba byid tri dang / b'a dza nam pri ya dang / aa sha ksha ta dang / bha ru dza dang de dag ni nas kyi ming ste / de brngos pa ni yos zhes bya'o // sha ta pushpa dang / mi si dang / gho sha dang / sha t'a h'a dang / ka ra bi dang / sha pha dang / aa ba ma dushpa dang / ma dhu ra ga dang / chad tra dang / sim ha ta la pa tra dang /
translated: Śyāma,

original: de dag ni me tog brgya pa ste /🔽shu ti'i ming du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni me tog brgya pa ste /🔽shu ti'i ming du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅku, Triśaṅ

original: ku langtha dang / tamma barna dang / ka la britta dang / tsa la ba ka dang / kshota dang / bra bhra ma ra dang / ma du dza ti dang / de dag ni rgya sran gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: ku langtha dang / tamma barna dang / ka la britta dang / tsa la ba ka dang / kshota dang / bra bhra ma ra dang / ma du dza ti dang / de dag ni rgya sran gyi ming ngo //
translated: Kulattha, Tambula, Kalabrita, Chalavaka, Kshuta, Prabhramar, Madhujuti, these are the names of beans.

original: de las kyang ma kshika zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar gyi mdog lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las kyang ma kshika zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar gyi mdog lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, Makshika is like the color of sesame oil.

original: bhra mar zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi dkar po la bya'o //
analyzed: bhra mar zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi dkar po la bya'o //
translated: Bhramar is called white honey.

original: ksha tra zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi'i mdog ser skyar snang ba'o //
analyzed: ksha tra zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi'i mdog ser skyar snang ba'o //
translated: Kshudra appears to be the color of pale honey.

original: po ti zhes bya ba ni zhun mar gyi mdog lta bu'o //
analyzed: po ti zhes bya ba ni zhun mar gyi mdog lta bu'o //
translated: Boti is like the color of ghee.

original: de dag ni sbrang rtsi'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de dag ni sbrang rtsi'i bye brag go //
translated: These are the varieties of honey.

original: sid tha ka dang / bhi ga sa dang / sid tha dang / ma dhu tshishta dang ; madhu na shu ta dang / ma dha she sha sa dang / pa tsan ga na dang / madhu dz'a dang / makshi ka sa ya dang / de dag ni spra tshil gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: sid tha ka dang / bhi ga sa dang / sid tha dang / ma dhu tshishta dang ; madhu na shu ta dang / ma dha she sha sa dang / pa tsan ga na dang / madhu dz'a dang / makshi ka sa ya dang / de dag ni spra tshil gyi ming ngo //
translated: Siddhaka, Bhigasa, Siddha, Madhukshita, Madhunashuta, Madheshashasa, Pacanagana, Madhuja, Makshikasaya, these are the names of beeswax.

original: sharka ra dang / si ka ta dang / sh'u bhra dang ; shu la dang / shve te dang / po to ba la dang / de dag ni kha ra dkar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sharka ra dang / si ka ta dang / sh'u bhra dang ; shu la dang / shve te dang / po to ba la dang / de dag ni kha ra dkar po'i ming ngo //
translated: Śarkarā, sakatā, śubhrā, śulā, śvete, poṭavala—these are the names of white sugar.

original: mar tsharnga dhi ka dang / aa pa gal ba dang / de gnyis ni kha ra'i mdog ser po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: mar tsharnga dhi ka dang / aa pa gal ba dang / de gnyis ni kha ra'i mdog ser po'i ming ngo //
translated: Madhu, madhuka, and apāmārga—these two are the names of yellow sugar.

original: de las gzhan pa ni sbrang rtsi'i khar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni sbrang rtsi'i khar zhes bya'o //
translated: Other than that, it is called honey sugar.

original: sha khari dang / pra tag pu na sha dang / yu ta ka dang / kha ra mar dza ri dang / aad shal ba dang / kshu po dang / dha marga dang / de dag ni aa ba marga'i ming ngo //🔽pi pi ling dang ; bca' sga dang / na le sham dang / dra yu shan dang / byo sha dang / ka dya tra ya dang / de dag ni tshab gsum gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: sha khari dang / pra tag pu na sha dang / yu ta ka dang / kha ra mar dza ri dang / aad shal ba dang / kshu po dang / dha marga dang / de dag ni aa ba marga'i ming ngo // pi pi ling dang ; bca' sga dang / na le sham dang / dra yu shan dang / byo sha dang / ka dya tra ya dang / de dag ni tshab gsum gyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Śakhari, pratāpunaśa, yutaka, kharamardaja, aśvalābha, kṣupot, and dharmagā—these are the names of avamārga.🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, and cavya—these three are the synonyms of the three peppers.🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].

original: shing tsha dang / sug smel dang / gandha bha dra dang / de gsum spyi'i ming yin no //
analyzed: shing tsha dang / sug smel dang / gandha bha dra dang / de gsum spyi'i ming yin no //
translated: Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].🔽Pippalī, pippalīmūla, cavya, citraka, and śṛṅgaveraka—these five are the synonyms of the five pungent [herbs].

original: ni tri ka ta dang / tri dza ta dang / de gnyis ni dri gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ni tri ka ta dang / tri dza ta dang / de gnyis ni dri gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: and these two are called the three smells.

original: de'i steng du n'a ga ge sar gyis bsnan na dri sna bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du n'a ga ge sar gyis bsnan na dri sna bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: If nagakesara is added to them, it is called the four smells.🔽hosha,🔽nagar,🔽vishva-vishva-ja,🔽vishva,🔽shikvara,🔽rahu-tsatra,🔽kata-sha,

original: ho sha dang / na gar dang / bi shva be sha dza dang / bi shvo'u dang / shrig be ra dang / ra hud tsha tra dang / ka ta sha dang / de dag ni bca' sga'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ho sha dang / na gar dang / bi shva be sha dza dang / bi shvo'u dang / shrig be ra dang / ra hud tsha tra dang / ka ta sha dang / de dag ni bca' sga'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the spices.🔽mari-tsa,🔽balaja,🔽krishna,🔽ushana,

original: ma ri tsa dang / bal dza dang / krishna dang / au sha na dang / kunydzi ta dang / ka tu @17b dang ; yab ni sha dang / dharma par ta dang / tikshna dang / bi ba sha pri ya dang / ghan dang /
analyzed: ma ri tsa dang / bal dza dang / krishna dang / au sha na dang / kunydzi ta dang / ka tu @17b dang ; yab ni sha dang / dharma par ta dang / tikshna dang / bi ba sha pri ya dang / ghan dang /
translated: kunjita,🔽kata,🔽yavani,🔽dharmapala,🔽tikshna,🔽vivasha-priya,🔽gandha,

original: de dag ni na le sham gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni na le sham gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the cardamom.🔽devi,🔽daru-hariti,🔽sarjani,🔽pacama-pacha,🔽kata-katari,

original: de bi dang / da ru ha ri ta dang / sardza ni dang / pa tsa ma pa tsa dang / ka ta ka ta ri dang / ra dza ni dang / ra tri dang / ma ha dang / ni sha dang / ksha pa dang /
analyzed: de bi dang / da ru ha ri ta dang / sardza ni dang / pa tsa ma pa tsa dang / ka ta ka ta ri dang / ra dza ni dang / ra tri dang / ma ha dang / ni sha dang / ksha pa dang /
translated: rajani,🔽ratri,🔽maha,🔽nisha,🔽khashapa,

original: de dag ni skyer pa'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de dag ni skyer pa'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are synonyms for the plant called “kyerpa.”

original: pinda ha ri ta dang / ga pu ri dang / barna ba ti dang / ni sha dang / pi ti ka dang / ra dza ni dang / bi ta dang / ha ri ti dang / ba ra bad pha ni dang / de dag ni yung ba ste /
analyzed: pinda ha ri ta dang / ga pu ri dang / barna ba ti dang / ni sha dang / pi ti ka dang / ra dza ni dang / bi ta dang / ha ri ti dang / ba ra bad pha ni dang / de dag ni yung ba ste /
translated: Pinnahari, gupuri, varṇavati, niśa, pītikā, rājani, vita, haritī, varabhanī—these are the names of turmeric.

original: rtsi ser po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: rtsi ser po'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the yellow-colored plants.

original: sardza ra sa dang / de ba bhu pa dang / ba ru dhu pa dang / aag ni ba la bha dang / su ral dang / sa ra ni rdza sa pa dang / su dhu pa dang / yaksha du pa ka dang / sra rtsi bog gi ming ngo //
analyzed: sardza ra sa dang / de ba bhu pa dang / ba ru dhu pa dang / aag ni ba la bha dang / su ral dang / sa ra ni rdza sa pa dang / su dhu pa dang / yaksha du pa ka dang / sra rtsi bog gi ming ngo //
translated: Sarjarasa, devabhūpa, varudhūpa, agniballava, surala, sarani rjasapā, sudhūpa, yakṣadūpa, and sarjarasa—these are the names of the resin.

original: ma dhu pu sha dang / briddha pu sha dang / shu ka bri ya dang / bhan di dang / shu ka ba pu shya dang / mri du pu shva dang / bi sha ba dha dang / da dag ni shri sha'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma dhu pu sha dang / briddha pu sha dang / shu ka bri ya dang / bhan di dang / shu ka ba pu shya dang / mri du pu shva dang / bi sha ba dha dang / da dag ni shri sha'i ming ngo //
translated: Madhupushpa, bṛddhipushpa, śuklabrīyā, bandhu, śuklapuṣya, mṛdupuṣpa, viśa-vadha—these are the names of śrīśa.

original: shi kru dang / she ta ma ri tsa dang / mu kha bhanydza dang / aa dig shna ka dang / soo bhanydza na dang / krishna gandha dang / su ti ba shan dang / ghan phal ba dang / de dag ni na le sham dkar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: shi kru dang / she ta ma ri tsa dang / mu kha bhanydza dang / aa dig shna ka dang / soo bhanydza na dang / krishna gandha dang / su ti ba shan dang / ghan phal ba dang / de dag ni na le sham dkar po'i ming ngo //
translated: Shigru, shetamaricha, mukha-bhanja, adikshamaka, saubhanjana, krishnagandha, sutibashana, and ganapala. These are the names of white ajagandha.

original: shi kru dang / ha ring kra sha ka dang / m'u la ka battra ka dang / ghan tsha da dang / ti shan gandha dang / mu rung g'i dang / sa la na dang / ksha ma dang / de dag ni shi kru rnam gcig ha ri sha ka'i ming yin no //
analyzed: shi kru dang / ha ring kra sha ka dang / m'u la ka battra ka dang / ghan tsha da dang / ti shan gandha dang / mu rung g'i dang / sa la na dang / ksha ma dang / de dag ni shi kru rnam gcig ha ri sha ka'i ming yin no //
translated: Shigru, haringashaka, mulatakataka, ganchhada, tishangandha, murungakai, salana, and kshara. These are the names of shigru, also known as harishashka.

original: ma du shi kru dang / ma dhu ra dang / sim ha ke sa ri dang / shi kru dang / shi kruka dang / de dag ni shi kru dkar po'i ming ste /
analyzed: ma du shi kru dang / ma dhu ra dang / sim ha ke sa ri dang / shi kru dang / shi kruka dang / de dag ni shi kru dkar po'i ming ste /
translated: Madushigru, madhura, simhakhe sari, shigru, and shigruka. These are the names of white shigru.

original: shi kru gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: shi kru gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third chapter on shigru.

original: ma dhu ka dang / tishna sa ra dang / madhu pushpa dang / ma ha da du ma dang / do la pha la dang / ma dhushtal dang / ma dhu ra dang / ghu dang du sha ka dang / de dag ni shing tog ma du ka'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ma dhu ka dang / tishna sa ra dang / madhu pushpa dang / ma ha da du ma dang / do la pha la dang / ma dhushtal dang / ma dhu ra dang / ghu dang du sha ka dang / de dag ni shing tog ma du ka'i ming yin no //
translated: Madhuka, Tishanasara, Madhu Pushpa, Mahadadhuma, Dolapala, Madhushthala, Madhura, Ghu and Dushashaka. These are the names of the fruit Madhuka.

original: ma du ka'i rnam gcig ni gong ma bas shing chung la me tog kyang chung zhing /
analyzed: ma du ka'i rnam gcig ni gong ma bas shing chung la me tog kyang chung zhing /
translated: One type of Madhuka is smaller than the above, and its flowers are also smaller.

original: ro dang nus pa ni mnyam pa zhig yod de de yang ma du ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ro dang nus pa ni mnyam pa zhig yod de de yang ma du ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Its taste and potency are the same, and it is also called Madhuka.

original: ra sanydza na dang / ta ra ka she la dang / darbi kva tha su muddha ba dang / ti ra ksha dang / bal bee dang / bal bee dang / tir ksha dang / bal bee dang / mri ta la dang / de dag ni skyer khanda'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ra sanydza na dang / ta ra ka she la dang / darbi kva tha su muddha ba dang / ti ra ksha dang / bal bee dang / bal bee dang / tir ksha dang / bal bee dang / mri ta la dang / de dag ni skyer khanda'i ming ngo //
translated: Rasanya, Tarakshala, Darbhikatha, Sumudhava, Tikashanda, Valava, Valava, Tikashanda, Valava, and Mritala. These are the names of the fruit Kyera Khanda.

original: hi gu pattri dang / pring thvi ge dang / pir thul dang / pvi thu la dang / ka ba ri dang / dir ke ka dang / tanti dang / n'a d'a dang / tim gu shi @18a * //
analyzed: hi gu pattri dang / pring thvi ge dang / pir thul dang / pvi thu la dang / ka ba ri dang / dir ke ka dang / tanti dang / n'a d'a dang / tim gu shi @18a * //
translated: Hīgupaṭṭrī, Priṅgathīge, Piṛthu, Pabithula, Kabari, Dirgaka, Tanti, Nāda, Timguśi,

original: ba ka dang / de dag ni sibs kyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: ba ka dang / de dag ni sibs kyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Vaka. These are the names of the varieties.

original: ta ga ra dang / ku ta la dang / ba tra dang / na tra dang / ka la nus ri dang / dznyim hri dang / bar hi na dang / bam kad dang / shi tha dang / tsa na h'u na dang / de dag ni rgya spos kyi ming yin no //
analyzed: ta ga ra dang / ku ta la dang / ba tra dang / na tra dang / ka la nus ri dang / dznyim hri dang / bar hi na dang / bam kad dang / shi tha dang / tsa na h'u na dang / de dag ni rgya spos kyi ming yin no //
translated: Tagara, Kuta, Bāṭa, Nāṭa, Kalānurī, Jhinamṛi, Barhiṇa, Bamkaṭa, Śītha, Cāṇahūṇa. These are the names of the incense.

original: bhod dhod ni dang / krur dang ; sa man sa dang / shita kshur dang / yod na ha dang / prad ri shi dang / be da la dang / de dag ni ba la'i ming ngo //
analyzed: bhod dhod ni dang / krur dang ; sa man sa dang / shita kshur dang / yod na ha dang / prad ri shi dang / be da la dang / de dag ni ba la'i ming ngo //
translated: Bhoṭa, Kṛu, Samanas, Śiṭakṣu, Yodanaha, Pradriśi, Vedala. These are the names of the balsam.

original: ram sha srog ta dang / ba ra dva tsa dang / sva barni dang / bhallya gha ni dang / bhu rib la dang / pa li ni dang / pu sha ka dang / de dag ni aa ti ba la'i ming yin no /🔽shar dva la dang / n'i la d'ur ba dang / go lo mi dang / sha ta bar pa dang / ha ri ta dang / sarba byi rya dang / shi ta bal lim dang / au sita la ta dang / de dag ni d'ur ba sngon po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ram sha srog ta dang / ba ra dva tsa dang / sva barni dang / bhallya gha ni dang / bhu rib la dang / pa li ni dang / pu sha ka dang / de dag ni aa ti ba la'i ming yin no / shar dva la dang / n'i la d'ur ba dang / go lo mi dang / sha ta bar pa dang / ha ri ta dang / sarba byi rya dang / shi ta bal lim dang / au sita la ta dang / de dag ni d'ur ba sngon po'i ming ngo //
translated: Ramasha-rogata, Vara-dvatsa, Savarni, Bhalyagha-ni, Bhuripla, Palini, Pushpaka, these are the names of the Atibala.🔽Shar-dvala, Nila-durva, Golo-mi, Shata-varpa, Hari-ta, Sarva-virya, Shita-ballim, Usi-talata, these are the names of the blue durva.

original: she ta d'ur ba dang / go lo mi dang / shve gnad dang / so tal ta dang / sa ha sra bidy'a dang / aa nanta dang ; dur dhar dang / bar gha bi dang / ru ha dang / de dag ni d'ur ba dkar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: she ta d'ur ba dang / go lo mi dang / shve gnad dang / so tal ta dang / sa ha sra bidy'a dang / aa nanta dang ; dur dhar dang / bar gha bi dang / ru ha dang / de dag ni d'ur ba dkar po'i ming ngo //
translated: Sheta-durva, Golo-mi, Shave-gandha, Sota-lata, Saha-sra-vidya, Ananta, Dhur-dhar, Bar-ghavi, Ruha, these are the names of the white durva.

original: gan da d'ur ba dang / gan da la dang / ti bhra dang / ma tsha ksha dang / bi li dra dang / na di ka ta ya dang / da ra ni dang / sha ku la kshu dang / de dag ni d'ur ba'i sdong bu'i ming ngo //🔽ya ba sha ka dang / dirga m'u la dang / sa mu ttranta dang / ma rud bha ba dang / aa nanta dang / du ra chu la dang / ba la rad tre dang / tsi kanta ka dang / de dag ni byi tsher ma'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: gan da d'ur ba dang / gan da la dang / ti bhra dang / ma tsha ksha dang / bi li dra dang / na di ka ta ya dang / da ra ni dang / sha ku la kshu dang / de dag ni d'ur ba'i sdong bu'i ming ngo // ya ba sha ka dang / dirga m'u la dang / sa mu ttranta dang / ma rud bha ba dang / aa nanta dang / du ra chu la dang / ba la rad tre dang / tsi kanta ka dang / de dag ni byi tsher ma'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Gandhadura, Gandhala, Tibhra, Matsaksha, Vilidra, Nadikataya, Darani, Shakulasksha, these are the names of the Dhurba tree.🔽Yavashaka, Dirghamula, Samuttranta, Marudbhava, Ananta, Durachula, Valaratra, Cikantaka, these are the names of the Bhisha tree.

original: du ra la bha ba dang / da nva ya sho ddang / ya sha dang / dan nvo ya ba sha ka dang / kad tshur dang / tam mra mu li dang / dur shar sha dang / du rabi graha dang / de dag kyang byi tsher ba rnam gcig gi ming ngo //
analyzed: du ra la bha ba dang / da nva ya sho ddang / ya sha dang / dan nvo ya ba sha ka dang / kad tshur dang / tam mra mu li dang / dur shar sha dang / du rabi graha dang / de dag kyang byi tsher ba rnam gcig gi ming ngo //
translated: Durabhava, Danvaya-shoda, Yasha, Danvobashaka, Kadshura, Tamramuli, Durshashana, Durvikrama, these are also the names of the Bhisha tree.

original: ba shi dang / bri sha dang / sim ha mu khi dang / bhri sha ga ma ta dang / aa ta ru sha ka dang / sim hi ga dang / sim ha parni dang / rakta ping ta pra sa da ni dang / de dag ni ba sha ka'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ba shi dang / bri sha dang / sim ha mu khi dang / bhri sha ga ma ta dang / aa ta ru sha ka dang / sim hi ga dang / sim ha parni dang / rakta ping ta pra sa da ni dang / de dag ni ba sha ka'i ming ngo //
translated: bashi, brisha, simhamukhi, brishagamata, atarushaka, simhiga, simhaparni, raktapindaprasadani. These are the names of the bashaka.

original: kapi kad tshu dang / aad ma gubha dang / sva yang gubta dang / mar ka ti dang / kan dya ka ri dang / ja ha dang / gub ta dang / ka pi rom dang / pha la ri sha bi dang / gun tra dang /
analyzed: kapi kad tshu dang / aad ma gubha dang / sva yang gubta dang / mar ka ti dang / kan dya ka ri dang / ja ha dang / gub ta dang / ka pi rom dang / pha la ri sha bi dang / gun tra dang /
translated: kapikacchu, admagupha, svayambhuta, markati, kandhyakari, jaha, gupta, kapirorma, phalari shavi, gunthara,

original: si ri dang / gud tsha m'u la dang / pa ni ra pir thul kha ra dang / de dag ni kha sral gyi ming yin no //
analyzed: si ri dang / gud tsha m'u la dang / pa ni ra pir thul kha ra dang / de dag ni kha sral gyi ming yin no //
translated: siri, gudacchamula, panirapirthulkharara. These are the names of the kashmala.

original: shata ba ri dang / su sma pa tra dang / su ba ri dang / @18b aanti ba ri dang / bari dang / sha ta m'u la dang / rbi bi shad tru dang / ba hu m'u la dang / aa hi dza hi ka dang /
analyzed: shata ba ri dang / su sma pa tra dang / su ba ri dang / @18b aanti ba ri dang / bari dang / sha ta m'u la dang / rbi bi shad tru dang / ba hu m'u la dang / aa hi dza hi ka dang /
translated: shatavari, susmapatra, subari, antivari, vari, shatamula, vibhishatru, bahumula, ahijahhika,

original: cu da ma ni dang / shi ta pa pa ki dang / shi ka phardi dang / krishna la dang / aa ra ta dang / de dag ni nye'u shing gi ming yin no //
analyzed: cu da ma ni dang / shi ta pa pa ki dang / shi ka phardi dang / krishna la dang / aa ra ta dang / de dag ni nye'u shing gi ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the jujube tree.🔽Udvada,🔽Damṛgāgāḍha, Kuñja, Cātrasāra, Kakṣahāva,

original: aud dza da dang / dam mri ga ga dang / kun dza dang ; tsa tra sra dang / ka ka sa hva ka dang / m'u la ka dang / ha ri pa rni dang / su shi ka kshi ra me ti dang / krishna kambu dzi ka dang /
analyzed: aud dza da dang / dam mri ga ga dang / kun dza dang ; tsa tra sra dang / ka ka sa hva ka dang / m'u la ka dang / ha ri pa rni dang / su shi ka kshi ra me ti dang / krishna kambu dzi ka dang /
translated: Mūlaka, Harīparṇī, Śiśirakṣīramati, Kṛṣṇakambūjika,🔽Guñjā, Rītikī, Kakannantika,

original: gum dza dang / rig ti ki dang / ka ka nan ti ka dang / de dag ni 'ol ma se dmar po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: gum dza dang / rig ti ki dang / ka ka nan ti ka dang / de dag ni 'ol ma se dmar po'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the red oleander.🔽Śveta-kambūji, Durdāśa, Kalacilikā, Kakāni, Kakacindī, Śaṅkhasalya, Virandikā,

original: shve ta kambo dzi dang / dur da sha dang / ka la tsi lu ka dang / ka ka nga ni dang / ka ka tsindi dang / shag kra shallya dang / bi ri na di ka dang / de dag ni 'ol ma se dkar po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: shve ta kambo dzi dang / dur da sha dang / ka la tsi lu ka dang / ka ka nga ni dang / ka ka tsindi dang / shag kra shallya dang / bi ri na di ka dang / de dag ni 'ol ma se dkar po'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the white oleander.

original: pri yangku dang / pha li ni dang / sha ma dang / ba ni ta bal la bha dang / l'a ta dang / bhang gu ra dang / bel geng ri ka dang / pri ya ha dang / bar na bhe de ni dang / de dag ni gan dha pri yangku'i ming yin no //
analyzed: pri yangku dang / pha li ni dang / sha ma dang / ba ni ta bal la bha dang / l'a ta dang / bhang gu ra dang / bel geng ri ka dang / pri ya ha dang / bar na bhe de ni dang / de dag ni gan dha pri yangku'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the gandhapriyangu.🔽Padmashveta, Pundarika, Shatapatra, Saroruha, Tamarasas, Saroruja, Ambuja, Bhamkaja,

original: padma shve ta dang / punda r'i ka dang / shat patra dang / sa ro ru ha dang / ta ma ra sa dang / sa ro dza dang / aambu dza dang / bam ka dza dang / de dag ni padma dkar po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: padma shve ta dang / punda r'i ka dang / shat patra dang / sa ro ru ha dang / ta ma ra sa dang / sa ro dza dang / aambu dza dang / bam ka dza dang / de dag ni padma dkar po'i ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the white lotus.🔽Pushkara, Rakta, Ravrin, Kushiyeshaya, Kamala, Nilini, Shriniketan, Narom,

original: pushkar dang / rakta dang / ra brin dang / ku she she ya dang ; ka ma la dang / ni li ni dang / shri ni ke ta na dang / na ror ma dang / de dag ni padma dmar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pushkar dang / rakta dang / ra brin dang / ku she she ya dang ; ka ma la dang / ni li ni dang / shri ni ke ta na dang / na ror ma dang / de dag ni padma dmar po'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the red lotus.

original: n'i lotpa la dang / ku pa la ya dang / nalba badza dang / aa si to pa la dang / aindri ba dang / ka ka lo dang / kad dza la dang / ka ka kud mal dang / de dag ni autpa la sngon po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: n'i lotpa la dang / ku pa la ya dang / nalba badza dang / aa si to pa la dang / aindri ba dang / ka ka lo dang / kad dza la dang / ka ka kud mal dang / de dag ni autpa la sngon po'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the blue lotus.🔽Saudgandhika, rakta-nīlaka, karṇikāra, pariphaṭa, jatīpatra, godānanada, kalhara, gandhasomaka,

original: sa du gandi ka dang / rakta ni da ka dang / karna pu ra dang / pa rod pha la dang / dza tya pa la dang / go da na da dang / ka lhar dang / gandha so ma ka ka dang / de dag ni autpa la dmar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sa du gandi ka dang / rakta ni da ka dang / karna pu ra dang / pa rod pha la dang / dza tya pa la dang / go da na da dang / ka lhar dang / gandha so ma ka ka dang / de dag ni autpa la dmar po'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the red lotus.

original: ku mud dang / shve ta dza la dza dang / tsandra kanta dang / sha shi pir ya dang / si totpa la dang / gandha bha ga dang / sha ma britti dang / dza le ru ha dang / de dag ni autpa la dkar po ste /
analyzed: ku mud dang / shve ta dza la dza dang / tsandra kanta dang / sha shi pir ya dang / si totpa la dang / gandha bha ga dang / sha ma britti dang / dza le ru ha dang / de dag ni autpa la dkar po ste /
translated: Kumuda, śveta-jala-jala, candrakanta, śaśipriya, sitotpala, gandhabhāga, śamabṛtti, jaleruha,

original: ku mu ta'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ku mu ta'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the white lotus.

original: padma ni pud tra ki ni dang / na li ni dang / ku mad pa ti dang / bal sha ni dang / parna ba ti dang / ba na sha da dang / sa tsa ka ra dang / de dag ni padma'i thog ma'i sa bon @19a * //🔽gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: padma ni pud tra ki ni dang / na li ni dang / ku mad pa ti dang / bal sha ni dang / parna ba ti dang / ba na sha da dang / sa tsa ka ra dang / de dag ni padma'i thog ma'i sa bon @19a * // gyi ming ngo //
translated: Padma is puṣṭarakiṇī, nalini, kumudapatī, balāśani, parṇavati, vanāśinī, sacakra, and so on. These are the names of the seed syllables of the lotus.

original: ke sar da dang / padma kinydza la ka dang / aa pi ta dang / padma ke sar dang / ma ga ran da dang / par ga dang / rung ga dang / ga'u ra dang / gan tshan dang / de dag ni padma ge sar gyi ming ngo //🔽ka ra ni ka dang / bi sho ko sha dang / karka ti dang / padma karni /
analyzed: ke sar da dang / padma kinydza la ka dang / aa pi ta dang / padma ke sar dang / ma ga ran da dang / par ga dang / rung ga dang / ga'u ra dang / gan tshan dang / de dag ni padma ge sar gyi ming ngo // ka ra ni ka dang / bi sho ko sha dang / karka ti dang / padma karni /
translated: Keśara is padmakiniñjala, apita, padmakeśara, magrandha, parga, ruṅga, gaura, and ganchan. These are the names of the filaments of the lotus.

original: ka dang / padma bi tsha dang / padma ksha dang / de dag ni padma'i snying po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: ka dang / padma bi tsha dang / padma ksha dang / de dag ni padma'i snying po'i ming yin no //
translated: Karṇikā is viṣokā, karṇikā, padmakarṇikā, padmaviṣṭhā, padmakarṣa, and so on. These are the names of the pericarp of the lotus.

original: mri na la dang / tan tya la dang / bi sa dang / padma'i di m'u la dang / sha lu ka dang / de dag ni padma'i rtsa ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: mri na la dang / tan tya la dang / bi sa dang / padma'i di m'u la dang / sha lu ka dang / de dag ni padma'i rtsa ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Mṛṇāla is tantila, visā, padmadimūla, śaluka, and so on. These are the names of the root of the lotus.

original: dir ki ka dang / de dag ni padma'i skyes gnas gyi ming yin no //
analyzed: dir ki ka dang / de dag ni padma'i skyes gnas gyi ming yin no //
translated: Dirghika and Dirghasthā. These are the names of the lotus family.🔽Lotus: kamala, padma, rajanī, padmadruma, madhu,

original: padma ni kang dam dang ; pad ka dang / ra dza dang / padma di dza dang / ma dhe dang / de dag ni 'dam gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: padma ni kang dam dang ; pad ka dang / ra dza dang / padma di dza dang / ma dhe dang / de dag ni 'dam gyi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the mud.

original: ku dan na da dang / sla ma dang / dann+ya dang / shu k'a h'a dang / pa re be la la dang / dzirna bh'uda da na dang / da sha pu ra dang / bi runna dang / be la rtsi dang / pu ta dang /
analyzed: ku dan na da dang / sla ma dang / dann+ya dang / shu k'a h'a dang / pa re be la la dang / dzirna bh'uda da na dang / da sha pu ra dang / bi runna dang / be la rtsi dang / pu ta dang /
translated: Kundam, śāli, dhannya, śukāhva, paripelvala, jirṇabhūdana, daśapura, virūpa, belarasa, puṭa,

original: de dag ni sla ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni sla ba'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the rice.🔽Jivanti, jīvanī, jīva, śakṣeṣṭa, yaśakari, jīvanaphalā, magadha, śrīkariṭika,

original: dzi banti dang / dzi ba ni dang / dzi ba dang / sha kha sheshta dang / ya sha ka ri dang / dzo ba ni pha dang / ma ga lya dang / shri ka ri ti ka dang / de dag ni sman 'tsho byed kyi ming yin no //
analyzed: dzi banti dang / dzi ba ni dang / dzi ba dang / sha kha sheshta dang / ya sha ka ri dang / dzo ba ni pha dang / ma ga lya dang / shri ka ri ti ka dang / de dag ni sman 'tsho byed kyi ming yin no //
translated: These are the names of the herbs.

original: ka ko li dang / ka pa di dang / kan dang / dhvad ksha di dang / kshi ra shu ki ka dang / shu kla kshu ra dang / ba ya sa li dang bir dang / dha ra dang / pas svi ni dang / de dag ni ra mnye ba ser po ste /
analyzed: ka ko li dang / ka pa di dang / kan dang / dhvad ksha di dang / kshi ra shu ki ka dang / shu kla kshu ra dang / ba ya sa li dang bir dang / dha ra dang / pas svi ni dang / de dag ni ra mnye ba ser po ste /
translated: Kakoli, Kapardi, Kan, Dvādaśikā, Kṣīraśuktika, Śukla-kṣura, Vayasali, Vir, Dhāra, Pāsvanī, these are the names of the yellow Ramnye.

original: bung tshang rdo'i ming ngo //
analyzed: bung tshang rdo'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the stone beehives.

original: kshi ra ka ko li dang / ba ri dang / shu ra dang / bi krani ka dang / pa ya svi ni dang / kshi ri ni dang / shu kla dang / kshir bi ni ka dang / de dag ni ram nye ba'o ma can gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: kshi ra ka ko li dang / ba ri dang / shu ra dang / bi krani ka dang / pa ya svi ni dang / kshi ri ni dang / shu kla dang / kshir bi ni ka dang / de dag ni ram nye ba'o ma can gyi ming ngo //
translated: Kṣīra, Kakoli, Bari, Śura, Vikriṇikā, Pāyasvanī, Kṣirini, Śukla, Kṣirvanikā, these are the names of the Ramnye with the syllable ma.

original: me da dang / mo da sa mud bud ta dang / shal lya barni dang / ma aang ra dang / ma ni tshid tra dang / de bam na dang / sur med sa mud bha ba dang / de dag ni me da'i ming ngo //
analyzed: me da dang / mo da sa mud bud ta dang / shal lya barni dang / ma aang ra dang / ma ni tshid tra dang / de bam na dang / sur med sa mud bha ba dang / de dag ni me da'i ming ngo //
translated: Meda, Modasamudbudda, Śalya-varṇi, Māṅgāra, Manicchida, Devaṃna, Sūrya-samudbhava, these are the names of the Meda.

original: briksha sha ru ha dang / ma h'a pu ru sha da ni dang / bhi ba min pa dang / de dag ni mon sran sde'u'i ming ngo //
analyzed: briksha sha ru ha dang / ma h'a pu ru sha da ni dang / bhi ba min pa dang / de dag ni mon sran sde'u'i ming ngo //
translated: and bibhīmaka. These are the names of the mung bean.

original: ma h'a me da'i ming du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ma h'a me da'i ming du bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are explained as the names of the mahāmedaka.🔽muṅgaparṇī,🔽suparṇī,🔽mahāmarjaragandhikā,🔽kākamuṅgā,🔽kṣudrasaha,🔽vanajā,🔽and śimbiringi. These are the names of the mung bean leaf.

original: mungga parni dang / su pya parni dang / ma h'a mardzar gandhi ka dang / k'a ka mungga dang / kshu tra sa ha dang / ba na dza dang / shimbi ring gi ni dang / de dag ni mon sran sde'u'i 'dab ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: mungga parni dang / su pya parni dang / ma h'a mardzar gandhi ka dang / k'a ka mungga dang / kshu tra sa ha dang / ba na dza dang / shimbi ring gi ni dang / de dag ni mon sran sde'u'i 'dab ma'i ming ngo //
translated: maśaparnī,🔽siṃhabindu,🔽subyaparnī,🔽mahāsahā,🔽panjarā,🔽maśaparnī,🔽kambuja,

original: ma sha parni dang / sim ha bin ga dang / su bya parni dang / ma h'a sa ha dang / pan rya @19b la dang / ma sha parna dang / kambu dzi dang / kri shin bri ti ka dang / de dag ni mon sran gre'u'i 'dab ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma sha parni dang / sim ha bin ga dang / su bya parni dang / ma h'a sa ha dang / pan rya @19b la dang / ma sha parna dang / kambu dzi dang / kri shin bri ti ka dang / de dag ni mon sran gre'u'i 'dab ma'i ming ngo //
translated: and kṛṣṇabṛttika. These are the names of the black gram leaf.

original: ri sha ba dang / ka ku dang / shi man dang / ba sha ni dang / go ba ti dang / bri sha dang / bri sha na dang / dur da dang / di ra dang / bhan dur ba dang / bri sha ti pa ti dang /
analyzed: ri sha ba dang / ka ku dang / shi man dang / ba sha ni dang / go ba ti dang / bri sha dang / bri sha na dang / dur da dang / di ra dang / bhan dur ba dang / bri sha ti pa ti dang /
translated: Rishava, Kakuda, Shiman, Bashani, Govati, Brisha, Brishamana, Durda, Dira, Bhandurva, Brishatipati,

original: de bzhin zangs rtsi ba'i ming yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zangs rtsi ba'i ming yin no //
translated: and so on are the names of the Kukkuras.🔽Jivaka, Kurtsha, Shirsha, Dhighayu, Chirajivha, Mangalayanam, Prasaga, Virupa,

original: ja ba ka dang / kur tsa shir sha dang / dhi gha yu dang / tsi ra dzi ha dang / mang gallya na ma dang / pra sa ga dang / bir pa dang / de dag ni dzi ba ka'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ja ba ka dang / kur tsa shir sha dang / dhi gha yu dang / tsi ra dzi ha dang / mang gallya na ma dang / pra sa ga dang / bir pa dang / de dag ni dzi ba ka'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the Jivakas.

original: 'tsho byed sde bcur bshad pa de dag spyi'i ming ni /
analyzed: 'tsho byed sde bcur bshad pa de dag spyi'i ming ni /
translated: These ten divisions of Jivaka are explained in general as follows:🔽Kajivanti, Jivani, Jiva, Shakhasheshat, Yashashkari, Jovanapa, Manggya, Svadada, Mudra,

original: ka dzi banti dang / dzi ba ni dang dzi ba dang / sha kha sheshta dang / ya sha ka ri dang / dzo ba ni pha dang / mang gya sva da dang / mdu ra dang / de dag ni dzi ba ni zhes bya bar grags so //
analyzed: ka dzi banti dang / dzi ba ni dang dzi ba dang / sha kha sheshta dang / ya sha ka ri dang / dzo ba ni pha dang / mang gya sva da dang / mdu ra dang / de dag ni dzi ba ni zhes bya bar grags so //
translated: these are known as Jivani.

original: bi da ri dang / ai nu tsi ri dang / bri sha kanda dang / pa la sha kan dang / ghan dzi pa ti pri ya dang / pri shya dang / sva du gan dang / bi ganda rig dang / de dag ni bi di ra'i ming yin no //
