original: su barna dang / ka na ka dang / rug mam dang / ha ta ka dang / sha ta ka bha ka dang / tsa ni kang dang / dza ta r'u pa dang / he rann+ya dang / he ma dang / kanytsha na dang / de dag ni gser gyi ming yin no ;
analyzed: su barna dang / ka na ka dang / rug mam dang / ha ta ka dang / sha ta ka bha ka dang / tsa ni kang dang / dza ta r'u pa dang / he rann+ya dang / he ma dang / kanytsha na dang / de dag ni gser gyi ming yin no ;
translated: Subhadra, Kanaka, Rukma, Hatika, Śatakabhaka, Caṇika, Jātarūpa, Heranya, Hema, Kañcana, these are the names of Suvarṇa.

original: / r'u pya dang / r'a dza ta dang / ta ra dang / ru tsi ra dang / me ru pa ta dza dang / shu dan dang / ku pyam dang / bha su dang / shreshta ma dang / bi mal dang / she ta ka dang /
analyzed: / r'u pya dang / r'a dza ta dang / ta ra dang / ru tsi ra dang / me ru pa ta dza dang / shu dan dang / ku pyam dang / bha su dang / shreshta ma dang / bi mal dang / she ta ka dang /
translated: Rūpya, rāja-ta, tara, rucira, meru-pata-ja, śundana, kuñja, bhasu, śreṣṭha, vimala, śetaka,

original: sva ta ma dang / de dag ni dngul gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: sva ta ma dang / de dag ni dngul gyi ming ngo //
translated: svatama—these are the names of silver.

original: tammra dang / au dumb'a ra dang / sho bam dang / me hi ra dang / ra bi n'a ma ka dang / rakta dha du dang / mli tsha tsha mu kha dang / ma ru dang / tsarma da la pra ha dang / de dag ni zangs ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tammra dang / au dumb'a ra dang / sho bam dang / me hi ra dang / ra bi n'a ma ka dang / rakta dha du dang / mli tsha tsha mu kha dang / ma ru dang / tsarma da la pra ha dang / de dag ni zangs ma'i ming ngo //
translated: Tamra, udumbara, śobhana, mehīra, rabi-nāmaka, rakta-dhūta, liṣṭa-mukha, maru, carma-dalapraha—these are the names of copper.

original: tra pu dang / bangka dang / ru tsa dang / ru bi shattu dang / tsi tra ka dang / si ta dang / tra pu ka dang / sh'e ta ma ni la dang / kha ra ti dang / ni li ka dang / gha na dang /
analyzed: tra pu dang / bangka dang / ru tsa dang / ru bi shattu dang / tsi tra ka dang / si ta dang / tra pu ka dang / sh'e ta ma ni la dang / kha ra ti dang / ni li ka dang / gha na dang /
translated: Trapu, vaṅka, ruca, ruvi-śattṛ, citraka, sita, trapuka, śveta-manila, karatī, nilīka, ghana,

original: de dag ni zha nye dkar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni zha nye dkar po'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of white tin.

original: si sa dang / ba hu ma la dang / na gan dang / au ra gan dang / ghu ru dang / ya ba nishta dang / tsi na ba sha ta ma dang / par bha ta dang / dha'u sambha ba dang / de dag ni zha nye'i ming ngo //🔽riti dang / ka pi la lo hanta dang / sh'akyasa ra dang / su barka na dang / ka pi li ha dang / tri la ha dang / brta lo ha ka dang / de dag ni ra gan gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: si sa dang / ba hu ma la dang / na gan dang / au ra gan dang / ghu ru dang / ya ba nishta dang / tsi na ba sha ta ma dang / par bha ta dang / dha'u sambha ba dang / de dag ni zha nye'i ming ngo // riti dang / ka pi la lo hanta dang / sh'akyasa ra dang / su barka na dang / ka pi li ha dang / tri la ha dang / brta lo ha ka dang / de dag ni ra gan gyi ming ngo //
translated: Sisa, Bahumala, Nāga, Uragana, Guru, Yavanistha, Cinavatsama, Parvata, Dhūmrambha, these are the names of tin.🔽Rati, Kapilā, Lohantā, Śākyasāra, Subarakaṇa, Kapiliha, Trilaha, Vartalohaka, these are the names of bronze.

original: krishna lo ha dang / a'a y'a dang / shu shra dang / tad kyis ta dang / sad yo ma la dang / mandha ra dang / tsi mri ra dang / krishna dang / shatsu ran dang / aayu dza dang / de dag ni lcags nag po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: krishna lo ha dang / a'a y'a dang / shu shra dang / tad kyis ta dang / sad yo ma la dang / mandha ra dang / tsi mri ra dang / krishna dang / shatsu ran dang / aayu dza dang / de dag ni lcags nag po'i ming ngo //
translated: Kṛṣṇalohā, Āyā, Śuśra, Tadyista, Sayomalā, Mandhara, Cimira, Kṛṣṇa, Śuciran, Ayuj, these are the names of black iron.

original: ra dza ri ti dang / rag na dang / ra tsa pa ta ni dang / me hi shi ri dang / bra ha ni dang / ra hma hi ri di dang / ka pi la dang / pi ga la dang / de dag ni ra gan gyi rgyal po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ra dza ri ti dang / rag na dang / ra tsa pa ta ni dang / me hi shi ri dang / bra ha ni dang / ra hma hi ri di dang / ka pi la dang / pi ga la dang / de dag ni ra gan gyi rgyal po'i ming ngo //
translated: Rajarati, Rakana, Ratapatani, Mehishiri, Brahmana, Rahmahiridhi, Kapila, and Pigala—these are the names of the kings of brass.

original: kan sa dang / lo ha dang / na dzi na dang / gho sha dang / pra ka sha dang / kam sa ka dang / kam l'a ba dang / aanna lo ha @33a * //
analyzed: kan sa dang / lo ha dang / na dzi na dang / gho sha dang / pra ka sha dang / kam sa ka dang / kam l'a ba dang / aanna lo ha @33a * //
translated: Kansa, Lohita, Naji, Ghosha, Prakasa, Kamasaka, Kamalava, Annala,

original: dang ; ba ta lo ha dang / panytsa lo ha dang / ri ti ka dang / de dag ni khar ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dang ; ba ta lo ha dang / panytsa lo ha dang / ri ti ka dang / de dag ni khar ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Vatala, Pancala, and Ritikaka—these are the names of the kings of tin.

original: pra ba la dang / ba li tra gra dang / bi ru ma ra dang / rakta ba na ka dang / de dag ni byu ru'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pra ba la dang / ba li tra gra dang / bi ru ma ra dang / rakta ba na ka dang / de dag ni byu ru'i ming ngo //
translated: Prabhala, Balitragra, Virumarada, Raktavanaka—these are the names of coral.

original: dza ti dza ru dang / ba marda na dang / mugti ka dang / de dag ni mu tig gi ming ngo //
analyzed: dza ti dza ru dang / ba marda na dang / mugti ka dang / de dag ni mu tig gi ming ngo //
translated: Jati, Jaru, Vamardana, Mugtikaka—these are the names of pearls.

original: ha ri ta la dang / aa la dang / ta la dang / ko tanta dang / na ta mandha na dang / dzatar'u pa pra bha dang / lo bhya dang / binytsa ra dang / bha sra ganti ka dang / de dag ni ba bla'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ha ri ta la dang / aa la dang / ta la dang / ko tanta dang / na ta mandha na dang / dzatar'u pa pra bha dang / lo bhya dang / binytsa ra dang / bha sra ganti ka dang / de dag ni ba bla'i ming ngo //
translated: Hariṭa, ala, tala, koṭanṭa, natamanthana, jatrūpaprabha, lobhya, vincaya, bhasragantīka—these are the names of the orpiment.

original: man shi la dang / shi na smra ho dang / shi la aa smra dha dang / kunna di dang / ka ra b'i ri ka dang / ni ba la dang / gubta ba dang / ma no ha dang / n'a ga dzi hi dang /
analyzed: man shi la dang / shi na smra ho dang / shi la aa smra dha dang / kunna di dang / ka ra b'i ri ka dang / ni ba la dang / gubta ba dang / ma no ha dang / n'a ga dzi hi dang /
translated: Mañśila, śinasmṛha, śilaasmṛha, kunandi, karavīraka, nivāla, kubjaka, manoha, nāgajīva—

original: de dag ni ldong ros kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni ldong ros kyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the red arsenic.

original: gi ri mri ga dang / gam ri ku ta pa sha na dang / rakta da ru dang / sta smra da ru dang / lo ha ta dang / gci gu ku dang / de dag ni btsag gi ming ngo //
analyzed: gi ri mri ga dang / gam ri ku ta pa sha na dang / rakta da ru dang / sta smra da ru dang / lo ha ta dang / gci gu ku dang / de dag ni btsag gi ming ngo //
translated: Girīmṛga, gamarikūṭapasha, raktadaru, stambhadaru, lohartha, chigucu—these are the names of the minium.

original: su brna gee ri ka dang / soo nya dang / tsakshu sha dang / she la sambha ba dang / su rakta dang / rakta sha ma dang / kanna bhu shanna dang / de dag ni btsag yug snam gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: su brna gee ri ka dang / soo nya dang / tsakshu sha dang / she la sambha ba dang / su rakta dang / rakta sha ma dang / kanna bhu shanna dang / de dag ni btsag yug snam gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the red dye.🔽Jāti, Himgulaka, Rakta, Varabhata, Prabhātodbhava, Atimukta, Sikatam, Krūcalohitikā,

original: dz'a ti dang / him gu la ka dang / rakta dang / b'ar bha ta dang / parbha tod bha ba dang / aa ti mugta dang / si ka tam dang / kra'u tsa lo hi ta dang / de dag ni mtshal gyi ming ngo ;
analyzed: dz'a ti dang / him gu la ka dang / rakta dang / b'ar bha ta dang / parbha tod bha ba dang / aa ti mugta dang / si ka tam dang / kra'u tsa lo hi ta dang / de dag ni mtshal gyi ming ngo ;
translated: these are the names of the vermilion.

original: / mang go la dang / shi la dha ru dang / dha ba la dang / phan dha ra da ra dang / sti tha dang / go mi di ni ka dang / shve ta ni ka dang / su da pa sha na go pa ra dang /
analyzed: / mang go la dang / shi la dha ru dang / dha ba la dang / phan dha ra da ra dang / sti tha dang / go mi di ni ka dang / shve ta ni ka dang / su da pa sha na go pa ra dang /
translated: Mangola, Śīladhara, Dāvala, Pāṇḍaradara, Sītha, Gomidini, Śvetanika, Sudapāṣaṇagopara,

original: de dag ni sa dkar po'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni sa dkar po'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the white earth.

original: ki ri pa ka dang / soo rashti ta dang / hi ma shodda ni dang / mrid sa dang / tri sa dang / trid ka sna dang / mri da sa gha dang / ka tsa dva ka ksha dang / pra ra su dza dang /
analyzed: ki ri pa ka dang / soo rashti ta dang / hi ma shodda ni dang / mrid sa dang / tri sa dang / trid ka sna dang / mri da sa gha dang / ka tsa dva ka ksha dang / pra ra su dza dang /
translated: Kirīpa, Saurashtra, Himālaya, Mṛga, Triśa, Triśaṅka, Mṛgasphā, Kaca, Dvaṃśaka, and Prasūjaka.

original: de dag ni beg ban da tshur gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni beg ban da tshur gyi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the countries to the west of the Ganges.🔽Vāgandha, Ganapatha, Bhanasaugandhika, Saugandhika, Gandhaku, Gandhodaka, Gandhāmara, and Pidgandhaka.

original: ba gandha dang / gan pa sha na dang / bha na soo gandhi ga dang / soo gandhi dang / gandha ku dang / gandho dang / gandha aa mra dang / pi da gandha ka dang / de dag ni mu zi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ba gandha dang / gan pa sha na dang / bha na soo gandhi ga dang / soo gandhi dang / gandha ku dang / gandho dang / gandha aa mra dang / pi da gandha ka dang / de dag ni mu zi'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the countries of the people who wear earrings.🔽Avragra, Vimalā, Śubha, Varapita, Pitaka, Nirvāṇa, Varvatobhuta, and Avrapatala.

original: aa bra gra dang / bi ma la dang / shu bhu dang / ba ra pi ta dang / pi ta ka dang / nirma la dang / bar bha to bhu ta dang / aa bra pa ta la dang / de dag ni lang tsher ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: aa bra gra dang / bi ma la dang / shu bhu dang / ba ra pi ta dang / pi ta ka dang / nirma la dang / bar bha to bhu ta dang / aa bra pa ta la dang / de dag ni lang tsher ba'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the countries of the people who are in their prime.

original: ba lu ka dang / srid ta dang / sir dang / lo bha ma ta dang / pra lo bi ni dang / n'a n'a da tu ma dang / sug sma dang / so bar na sam bha ba dang / de dag ni gser la @33b sogs pa 'byung khung gi ming ngo //
analyzed: ba lu ka dang / srid ta dang / sir dang / lo bha ma ta dang / pra lo bi ni dang / n'a n'a da tu ma dang / sug sma dang / so bar na sam bha ba dang / de dag ni gser la @33b sogs pa 'byung khung gi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the sources of gold and so forth.🔽Tapya,🔽Makshika-dhatu,🔽Tabya-ja,🔽Tabhada-makhika,🔽Abarta,🔽Bhum-adhuraru,🔽Tivi-samudbhava,

original: ta pya dang / ma kshi ka dha tu dang / ta bya dza dang / ta bha da ma kshi ka dang / aa brta dang / bhu ma dhu da ru dang / ti bi sa mudbha dang / de dag ni bu len te dub mar rdzang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: ta pya dang / ma kshi ka dha tu dang / ta bya dza dang / ta bha da ma kshi ka dang / aa brta dang / bhu ma dhu da ru dang / ti bi sa mudbha dang / de dag ni bu len te dub mar rdzang gi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the salt mines.🔽Shamkha,🔽Bhiribha,🔽Kumbha,🔽Jala-jala,🔽Dhirana-sara,🔽Susara-roda,🔽Dhiragava,🔽Dhavala,🔽Sribhi-bhusana,

original: sham kha dang / bhi ri bha dang / kumbu dang / dza la dza la dang / dhi rga ni sa ra dang / su sra ro dang / dhirga ba dang / dha ba la dang / sri bhi bhu shan dang / de dag ni dung gi ming ngo //
analyzed: sham kha dang / bhi ri bha dang / kumbu dang / dza la dza la dang / dhi rga ni sa ra dang / su sra ro dang / dhirga ba dang / dha ba la dang / sri bhi bhu shan dang / de dag ni dung gi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the conch shells.

original: sa mu dra phe na dang / phe na dang / shuksha shu ksha dang / ba yu ti dza dang / so dha ni phe na dang / sa ga ra ma la dang / de dag ni rgya mtsho dbu ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sa mu dra phe na dang / phe na dang / shuksha shu ksha dang / ba yu ti dza dang / so dha ni phe na dang / sa ga ra ma la dang / de dag ni rgya mtsho dbu ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Samudra phena, phena, śukra śukra, vayuti ja, sodhani phena, sagara mala. These are the names of the foam of the ocean.

original: go ro tsanda dang / pig la dang / ru tsir dang / ru tsi dang / me da dang / goo ri dang / goo ta mi dang / banda ni ya dang / graha pha ha dang / de dag ni gi wang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: go ro tsanda dang / pig la dang / ru tsir dang / ru tsi dang / me da dang / goo ri dang / goo ta mi dang / banda ni ya dang / graha pha ha dang / de dag ni gi wang gi ming ngo //
translated: Goro cana, piṅgala, rucira, ruci, medha, gaurī, gautamī, bandhujīva, grahaphaha. These are the names of vermillion.

original: sindhu ra dang / rakta re na dang / n'a ga rakta dang / n'a ga dza dang / sri ga pu sha na dang / sri manta dang / ba santud pa tsa mandha dang / de dag ni li khri'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sindhu ra dang / rakta re na dang / n'a ga rakta dang / n'a ga dza dang / sri ga pu sha na dang / sri manta dang / ba santud pa tsa mandha dang / de dag ni li khri'i ming ngo //
translated: Sindūra, rakta reṇu, nāga rakta, nāga ja, śrī puṣpa, śrīmanta, vasundhara, pacamandala. These are the names of vermilion.

original: kam ku sha ta dang / b'i rang+ga dang / rang+gan ga dang / ro tsa na dang / m'u la ka dang / tra sa dang / sho dha dang / ka tsa pa la ka dang / de dag ni kar ku sha ta'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kam ku sha ta dang / b'i rang+ga dang / rang+gan ga dang / ro tsa na dang / m'u la ka dang / tra sa dang / sho dha dang / ka tsa pa la ka dang / de dag ni kar ku sha ta'i ming ngo //
translated: Kamkuśa, varuṅga, raṅgaṅga, rocana, mūlaka, trasā, śodhana, kaja palaka. These are the names of turmeric.

original: tunna dang / tunna ka dang / kad tsha ka dang / aa bi ta dang / tutna ka dang / ku be re ka dang / kanta la ka dang / nag ti bir kshu dang / nanti ka dang / de adg ni tu na'i ming ste /🔽ser tshos 'bras bu ser po'o //
analyzed: tunna dang / tunna ka dang / kad tsha ka dang / aa bi ta dang / tutna ka dang / ku be re ka dang / kanta la ka dang / nag ti bir kshu dang / nanti ka dang / de adg ni tu na'i ming ste / ser tshos 'bras bu ser po'o //
translated: These are the names of the tunna.

original: su ra mandha pu sa na sa dang / pa ri sru dang / ma di ra ra ba ra dang / ba ru ni dang / ma da ni dang / bi ra dang / de ba shreshta dang / mi trid bhu ba dang / ka tamba ri dang /
analyzed: su ra mandha pu sa na sa dang / pa ri sru dang / ma di ra ra ba ra dang / ba ru ni dang / ma da ni dang / bi ra dang / de ba shreshta dang / mi trid bhu ba dang / ka tamba ri dang /
translated: Suramanda, Pusana, Parisra, Madhiravaravara, Varuni, Madani, Vira, Devasrestha, Mitridbhuva, Katambari,

original: ghandha ru su ra dang / ta dang ru dza la dang / de dag ni chang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: ghandha ru su ra dang / ta dang ru dza la dang / de dag ni chang gi ming ngo //
translated: Gandharusara, Tara, and Rusala. These are the names of the wines.

original: marti ka dang / ma dhu dang / ma dhu shi shrishta dang / ma dh'u da ka dang / ma dya ta dang / de dag ni rgun chang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: marti ka dang / ma dhu dang / ma dhu shi shrishta dang / ma dh'u da ka dang / ma dya ta dang / de dag ni rgun chang gi ming ngo //
translated: Martika, Madhu, Madhusrestha, Madhuta, Madhuka, Madayati. These are the names of the grape wines.

original: rgun chang bskol ba ni dro 'jam zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgun chang bskol ba ni dro 'jam zhes bshad do //
translated: The boiled grape wine is called warm.

original: bu ram gyi khu ba ni ai shu ra sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bu ram gyi khu ba ni ai shu ra sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sugarcane juice is called ishurasa.

original: de bskol ba las byung ba ni bu ram chang zhes bya'o //🔽sman bskol ba'i khu ba dangs ma'i nang du bu ram la sogs pa bcug nas yun ring du gzhag pa'i btung ba ni aa @34a * //
analyzed: de bskol ba las byung ba ni bu ram chang zhes bya'o // sman bskol ba'i khu ba dangs ma'i nang du bu ram la sogs pa bcug nas yun ring du gzhag pa'i btung ba ni aa @34a * //
translated: The drink that results from boiling it is called molasses-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.

original: sa ba'i chang zhes bshad do //🔽de shin tu grang ba ni aa sa grang mo btung ba zhes bshad do //🔽da da ki cham chom brdungs pa bskol ba'i khu ba dangs ma'i nang du li khar btab nas gzhag pa'i btung ba ni li kha ra'i chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa ba'i chang zhes bshad do // de shin tu grang ba ni aa sa grang mo btung ba zhes bshad do // da da ki cham chom brdungs pa bskol ba'i khu ba dangs ma'i nang du li khar btab nas gzhag pa'i btung ba ni li kha ra'i chang zhes bya'o //
translated: The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.

original: da da ki dang / bu ram lhan cig bskol ba'i btung ba ni goo da'i chang zhes bshad do //🔽da da ki dang / sbrang rtsi dang chu gsum bskol ba ni mad pa zhes bya ba'i btung ba yin no //
analyzed: da da ki dang / bu ram lhan cig bskol ba'i btung ba ni goo da'i chang zhes bshad do // da da ki dang / sbrang rtsi dang chu gsum bskol ba ni mad pa zhes bya ba'i btung ba yin no //
translated: The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.🔽The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.

original: hvags dang / da da ki dang / chu lhan cig bskol ba ni khanda'i btung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: hvags dang / da da ki dang / chu lhan cig bskol ba ni khanda'i btung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The drink that results from putting molasses, etc. into the clear liquid of boiled medicine and letting it stand for a long time is called asafoetida-beer.

original: 'bras la sogs pa las byas pa'i chang ni 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa las byas pa'i chang ni 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Beer made from rice and so on is called rice beer.

original: ka tu la dang / ko la hi'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: ka tu la dang / ko la hi'i rnam grangs so //
translated: It is also called kataka and kolahi.

original: btags pa las byas pa'i chang ni 'bru'i chang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: btags pa las byas pa'i chang ni 'bru'i chang zhes bya ste /
translated: Beer made from a mixture is called rice beer.

original: de'i ming ni me dang / ka dang / dza la ka dang / dza ga ga la dang / ghan dang / ba ga pa dang de dag go //
analyzed: de'i ming ni me dang / ka dang / dza la ka dang / dza ga ga la dang / ghan dang / ba ga pa dang de dag go //
translated: Its names are me, ka, jalaka, jagagala, ghana, and bagapa.

original: chang ngo cog legs par smin pa spyi'i ming ni /
analyzed: chang ngo cog legs par smin pa spyi'i ming ni /
translated: The general name for all well-fermented beers is

original: ma dhu ma ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma dhu ma ga zhes bya'o //
translated: madhumāgaka.

original: chang shin tu skyur bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: chang shin tu skyur bar gyur pa ni /
translated: Beer that has become very sour

original: tsugta dang / tshandan dang / su ra sa su ta zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tsugta dang / tshandan dang / su ra sa su ta zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called tsukta, candana, and surasa-suta.

original: tsha'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsha'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names for sour.

original: kanytsi ka dang / aa ra na la dang / kanydza dang / de bya aa la ba dang / aa aan di su ma dang / si'u bi ra dang / de dag ni rtsabs skyur ba ste /
analyzed: kanytsi ka dang / aa ra na la dang / kanydza dang / de bya aa la ba dang / aa aan di su ma dang / si'u bi ra dang / de dag ni rtsabs skyur ba ste /
translated: Kañcīka, aranala, kañja, devyalava, ānandisumā, and siuvīra are sour roots.

original: rang skyur gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: rang skyur gyi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names for sour.

original: de'i snyigs ma ni ka ta ri zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i snyigs ma ni ka ta ri zhes bya ste /
translated: Its dregs are called katari.

original: nas khral khrol tsam du btags pa phub ma dang bcas par chur spangs pa'i nang du mungga'am /
analyzed: nas khral khrol tsam du btags pa phub ma dang bcas par chur spangs pa'i nang du mungga'am /
translated: The barley is tied in a loose knot with a piece of cloth and thrown into water.🔽It is then covered with mung beans or lentils and left in the sun.

original: sran chung la sogs pa'i chang bus bcu ste nyi ma la gzhag / skyur bar gyur pa'i btung ba ni /
analyzed: sran chung la sogs pa'i chang bus bcu ste nyi ma la gzhag / skyur bar gyur pa'i btung ba ni /
translated: The drinks that cause intoxication are

original: sandha na dang / aa bhi shinydza dang / aa su dang / au su bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sandha na dang / aa bhi shinydza dang / aa su dang / au su bo zhes bya ste /
translated: sandhana, abhisinya, asuva, and usuva.

original: de dag ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de dag ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are synonyms.

original: gzhan yang rgun 'brum dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / sbrang rtsi dang / 'bras dmar po dang / 'bras drug cu pa dang / de dag las chang byas pa yang chang gzhan dang nus pa mtshungs par blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgun 'brum dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / sbrang rtsi dang / 'bras dmar po dang / 'bras drug cu pa dang / de dag las chang byas pa yang chang gzhan dang nus pa mtshungs par blta'o //
translated: Moreover, grape juice, sugarcane juice, honey, red rice, and sixty-rice are considered to be equal in intoxicating power to other alcoholic drinks when they are made into alcohol.

original: 'bras dmar po la sogs pa ni gra ma can gyi 'bru zhes bya'o //🔽mungga la sogs pa ni gang bu can gyi 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras dmar po la sogs pa ni gra ma can gyi 'bru zhes bya'o // mungga la sogs pa ni gang bu can gyi 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: Red rice and so forth are called “grains with husks.”🔽Mung beans and so forth are called “grains with pods.”

original: khre dang ci tse la sogs pa ni rtsva'i 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khre dang ci tse la sogs pa ni rtsva'i 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: Barley, wheat, and so forth are called “grass grains.”

original: drug cu pa la sogs pa ni 'bras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drug cu pa la sogs pa ni 'bras zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixty-grain and so on are called the fruit.

original: 'bras bu dmar po ni 'bras kyi mchog yin @34b no ;
analyzed: 'bras bu dmar po ni 'bras kyi mchog yin @34b no ;
translated: The red rice is the best of the rice.

original: /'bru'i nang na drug cu pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: /'bru'i nang na drug cu pa mchog yin no //
translated: The sixty-grain is the best of the grains.

original: pri yangku dang / ka ta su gnyis dang / de dag ni khre'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pri yangku dang / ka ta su gnyis dang / de dag ni khre'i ming ngo //
translated: The priyaṅgu, the two kaṭaka, these are the names of the khara.

original: ko ra tu sha dang / ko ta ba ni dang / ci tse'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ko ra tu sha dang / ko ta ba ni dang / ci tse'i ming ngo //
translated: The koratuśa, the koṭavaṇa, the ciñciṇī, these are the names of the ciñciṇī.

original: gu ti dra na dang / nri ta ku ta ru dang / ma li tsi ka dang / stan tu dang / ni dzi dang / nridda kunda ka dang ; de dag ni 'bras ma du lung ga'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gu ti dra na dang / nri ta ku ta ru dang / ma li tsi ka dang / stan tu dang / ni dzi dang / nridda kunda ka dang ; de dag ni 'bras ma du lung ga'i ming ngo //
translated: The guḍīdraṇa, the nṛtakutarura, the mañjiṣṭhā, the stambana, the niṣidha, the nṛdakuṇḍaka, these are the names of the madhūka.

original: gha pa bhu ka dang / ghi bi tsva hva dang / ka shi ka dang / de dag ni 'bras ka tsa da ka'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gha pa bhu ka dang / ghi bi tsva hva dang / ka shi ka dang / de dag ni 'bras ka tsa da ka'i ming ngo //
translated: The ghaṇṭābhūka, the ghaṭīcavahā, the kaśika, these are the names of the kaṭaka.

original: dzurna hva dang / au da ni ka dang / shta ma ku dang / mu ni bi dzi na dang / sha ma ka dang / de dag ni khre rgod kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: dzurna hva dang / au da ni ka dang / shta ma ku dang / mu ni bi dzi na dang / sha ma ka dang / de dag ni khre rgod kyi ming ngo //
translated: The jūrṇahā, the udana, the śatāvarī, the munivṛṣaṇa, the śamīka, these are the names of the kharaguda.

original: ni ba ra dang / mu ni bag sha dang / de dag ni ni ba ra'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ni ba ra dang / mu ni bag sha dang / de dag ni ni ba ra'i ming ngo //
translated: Nivara and Munibhasha are the names of Nivara.

original: go dhu ma dang / ya ma la ni gro'i ming ngo //
analyzed: go dhu ma dang / ya ma la ni gro'i ming ngo //
translated: Godhuma and Yamalana are the names of wheat.

original: nagti ma khu dang / ka ya ni dang / shu ka dang / king sha ta ka dang / de dag ni nanti mu kha'i ming ste nas rgod yin no //
analyzed: nagti ma khu dang / ka ya ni dang / shu ka dang / king sha ta ka dang / de dag ni nanti mu kha'i ming ste nas rgod yin no //
translated: Nagatmikhu, Kayani, Shuk, and Kshantika are the names of Nantimukha, which is wild barley.

original: mang gha la dang / hi ri ta dang / mungga dang ; de dag ni mon sran snge'u'i ming ngo //
analyzed: mang gha la dang / hi ri ta dang / mungga dang ; de dag ni mon sran snge'u'i ming ngo //
translated: Mangala, Hirita, and Mungaka are the names of Mungaka, which is green gram.

original: tu pa ri dang / aarda ka dang / de dag ni tu pa ri'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tu pa ri dang / aarda ka dang / de dag ni tu pa ri'i ming ngo //
translated: Tupari and Ardhaka are the names of Tupari.

original: ha ri ni pa ri dang / tsa na dang / de ni bu 'o'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ha ri ni pa ri dang / tsa na dang / de ni bu 'o'i ming ngo //
translated: Harinipari and Chana are the names of Chana.

original: kri shan zhes bya ba ni mon sran tsa na'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kri shan zhes bya ba ni mon sran tsa na'i ming ngo //
translated: Krichana is the name of green gram.

original: she ta shimba dang / khanti ka dang / pri pu ta dang / de dag ni nis pa pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: she ta shimba dang / khanti ka dang / pri pu ta dang / de dag ni nis pa pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Shita, Shimba, Kantika, and Priputa are the names of Nishapa.

original: ra dza mi sha dang / tsa pa la dang / bha na mungga dang / ma yushta ta ka dang / de dag ni ra dza sha ste'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ra dza mi sha dang / tsa pa la dang / bha na mungga dang / ma yushta ta ka dang / de dag ni ra dza sha ste'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of rajasha.🔽danya,🔽puluk,🔽nisyanda,🔽prasagana,🔽prasati,🔽atitaka, pratika,

original: da n+ya dang / pu la ku dang / nis yan dang / pra sa ga na dang / pra sa ti dang / aa ti ta ka la pra ti ka dang / de dag ni 'bru spyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: da n+ya dang / pu la ku dang / nis yan dang / pra sa ga na dang / pra sa ti dang / aa ti ta ka la pra ti ka dang / de dag ni 'bru spyi'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of general grains.

original: shin tu sla bar byas pa'i thug pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu sla bar byas pa'i thug pa ni /
translated: Very easy to make porridge,

original: thug pa rkyang rkyang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thug pa rkyang rkyang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called just porridge.

original: de bas yid ska ba tsam du stong ste /
analyzed: de bas yid ska ba tsam du stong ste /
translated: Therefore, it is just a little bit sour.

original: phyar las gyur pa ni thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyar las gyur pa ni thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What is made from flour is called porridge.

original: de bas gar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas gar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is just a little bit sour.

original: kha gzar gyis bcu rung ba tsam du song ba ni /
analyzed: kha gzar gyis bcu rung ba tsam du song ba ni /
translated: What is suitable to be eaten with a spoon is

original: thug pa 'dag gu lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thug pa 'dag gu lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: called clean porridge.🔽odana,🔽andava,🔽boja,🔽ahara,🔽ashana,

original: ao da na dang / aanda bam dang / bo dza dang / aa ha ra dang / aa sha na dang / de dag ni 'bras chan gyi ming ste /
analyzed: ao da na dang / aanda bam dang / bo dza dang / aa ha ra dang / aa sha na dang / de dag ni 'bras chan gyi ming ste /
translated: these are the names of rice,

original: bza' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: which is called food.

original: snga dro bza' ba ni par ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snga dro bza' ba ni par ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Morning food is called parta.

original: phyi dro bza' ba ni sa pa sha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi dro bza' ba ni sa pa sha zhes bya'o //
translated: The evening meal is called sapāśa.

original: pri thu @35a * //
analyzed: pri thu @35a * //
translated: Prīthuka

original: ga dang / ru gu la dang / de dag ni gro dang nas la sogs pa'i snye ma smin pa la rag rog bsregs pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ga dang / ru gu la dang / de dag ni gro dang nas la sogs pa'i snye ma smin pa la rag rog bsregs pa'i ming ngo //
translated: and rugula are the names of roasted grain, such as wheat and barley, in the husk.

original: tsi pa ta dang / tandu la ni 'bru ma smin pa brdos shing btsos pa'i chang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: tsi pa ta dang / tandu la ni 'bru ma smin pa brdos shing btsos pa'i chang gi ming ngo //
translated: Cippati and tandula are the names of unhusked grain boiled in water.

original: gro zhib tu btags pa ni ka ni ka ta ste /
analyzed: gro zhib tu btags pa ni ka ni ka ta ste /
translated: Finely ground wheat is called kaṇikata.

original: bag phye zhes bya'o //🔽'bras dang / sgang bu can dang / gra ma can /
analyzed: bag phye zhes bya'o // 'bras dang / sgang bu can dang / gra ma can /
translated: It is called “flour.”

original: nas la sogs pa las ni skyo ma'i rgyu bya'o //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa las ni skyo ma'i rgyu bya'o //
translated: Rice, barley, and wheat are used to make beer.

original: til btags pa chu dang sbyar ba ni pa la la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: til btags pa chu dang sbyar ba ni pa la la zhes bya'o //
translated: Sesame seeds ground with water are called palala.

original: sha skam po ni ba lu ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sha skam po ni ba lu ra zhes bya'o //
translated: Dried meat is called valūra.

original: byi na ka dang / kha na dang / pi pi la dang / de dag ni til gyi tshigs ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: byi na ka dang / kha na dang / pi pi la dang / de dag ni til gyi tshigs ma'i ming ngo //
translated: Bīnaka, khaṇḍa, and pīpila are the names of sesame flour.

original: zho dang sbrang rtsir sbyar ba ni mardza ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zho dang sbrang rtsir sbyar ba ni mardza ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Yogurt mixed with honey is called madhu.

original: zho dang dri sna bzhir sbyar ba ni shing kha ri na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zho dang dri sna bzhir sbyar ba ni shing kha ri na zhes bya'o //
translated: The mixture of curd and the four spices is called khāriṇa.

original: sbyor ba de gsum re re'i nang du na le sham gyis bsres pa yang ming de ltar gdags so //
analyzed: sbyor ba de gsum re re'i nang du na le sham gyis bsres pa yang ming de ltar gdags so //
translated: Each of these three preparations may also contain śṛṅgavera.

original: au da gi rig dang / stu pa li ska dang / pu ba dang / baksha dang / de dag ni khur ba'i ming ngo //🔽gro dang 'bras la sogs pa btags pa'i snum khur ni /
analyzed: au da gi rig dang / stu pa li ska dang / pu ba dang / baksha dang / de dag ni khur ba'i ming ngo // gro dang 'bras la sogs pa btags pa'i snum khur ni /
translated: Udakī, stūpalī, puva, and bakṣa are names for cakes.

original: aa du pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa du pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Cakes made from wheat, rice, and so on, and fried in oil are called āḍuva.

original: snum khur skam po ni par ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snum khur skam po ni par ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Dry cakes are called parta.

original: gang zho dang bsres pa ni zho can zhes bya'o //🔽sman bskol ba'i rang gi khu ba'i nang du /
analyzed: gang zho dang bsres pa ni zho can zhes bya'o // sman bskol ba'i rang gi khu ba'i nang du /
translated: Those mixed with curd are called dadhika.

original: 'om dang bsres pa ni 'o ma can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'om dang bsres pa ni 'o ma can zhes bya'o //
translated: Cakes made from the liquid of boiled medicine mixed with milk are called kṣīrika.

original: lan tshva dang sbyar ba ni lan tshva can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan tshva dang sbyar ba ni lan tshva can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those mixed with salt are called lavaṇa.

original: mud dag dang sbyar ba ni mud dag can zhes bya'o //🔽thur ma la bsregs pa ni thur ma can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mud dag dang sbyar ba ni mud dag can zhes bya'o // thur ma la bsregs pa ni thur ma can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those mixed with mudga beans are called mudgika.🔽Those fried in ghee are called sarpiṣka.

original: dud pas bdugs pa ni ba si ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dud pas bdugs pa ni ba si ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Those smoked with incense are called vāstīka.

original: sman bskol ba'i rang gi khu ba'i nang du /
analyzed: sman bskol ba'i rang gi khu ba'i nang du /
translated: The juice of a decoction of medicine

original: sman de nyid dang bsres pa ni sman gzhan dang bsres pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sman de nyid dang bsres pa ni sman gzhan dang bsres pa yang rung ste /
translated: mixed with that very medicine, or mixed with another medicine,

original: de ni bha ba te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bha ba te zhes bya'o //
translated: is called bhavatī.

original: gang na 'o ma dang btsos pa'i chan ni pa ya sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang na 'o ma dang btsos pa'i chan ni pa ya sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Where there is milk and cooked rice, it is called payasa.

original: til dang 'bras lhan cig btsos pa'i zan ni kri sa ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: til dang 'bras lhan cig btsos pa'i zan ni kri sa ra zhes bya'o //
translated: Rice cooked together with sesame and rice is called krisara.

original: lha ma mchod pa'i zan ni ha bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma mchod pa'i zan ni ha bya zhes bya'o //
translated: Rice offered to the gods is called havya.

original: mtshun gtor la bsngos pa'i zas ni ka bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshun gtor la bsngos pa'i zas ni ka bya zhes bya'o //
translated: Food dedicated to the ancestors is called kavya.

original: gang 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i zan ni b'ar manna ma na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i zan ni b'ar manna ma na zhes bya'o //
translated: Rice mixed with milk is called vṛthāmantha.

original: zhes la la dag 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes la la dag 'chad do //
translated: Some explain it like this.

original: la du'i ming ni mo da ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la du'i ming ni mo da ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of lentils is modaka.

original: chu grang gi nang du mar nyung shas btab ste ha cang mi sla mi ska ba ni skyo ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu grang gi nang du mar nyung shas btab ste ha cang mi sla mi ska ba ni skyo ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Water mixed with a little ghee, neither too thin nor too thick, is called soup.

original: rgun 'brum dang / pa ru sha dang / 'bra go dang / li kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'i chu'i nang du /
analyzed: rgun 'brum dang / pa ru sha dang / 'bra go dang / li kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'i chu'i nang du /
translated: In water mixed with grapes, parusha, jujube, licorice, and honey,

original: 'bras @35b yos kyi phye dang / mar btab pa ni snying po lnga'i phye ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras @35b yos kyi phye dang / mar btab pa ni snying po lnga'i phye ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Rice flour, with ghee and honey, is called the five essence flour.

original: sha khu dang / lu su'i khu ba bsres pa'i nang du /
analyzed: sha khu dang / lu su'i khu ba bsres pa'i nang du /
translated: A soup of meat and lentils,

original: 'bras bu gsum dang / til gyi tshigs ma dang / la phug skam po dang / til btags pa dang / skyur gang yang rung ba mang du bsres pa ni kambi la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsum dang / til gyi tshigs ma dang / la phug skam po dang / til btags pa dang / skyur gang yang rung ba mang du bsres pa ni kambi la zhes bya'o //
translated: with a lot of the three fruits, sesame seeds, dried radish, sesame paste, and any sour thing, is called kambula.

original: nad kyi bye brag gis snum 'chos dang / rtsub 'chos gang rigs par byed par ni kri ta kra ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nad kyi bye brag gis snum 'chos dang / rtsub 'chos gang rigs par byed par ni kri ta kra ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Oil treatments and rough treatments, whatever is appropriate for the specific illness, is called kṛta-kṛta.

original: sha nyung shas dang / 'u su dang / se'u 'bru la sogs pa bskol ba'i dangs ma ni dha ka la dang / ba ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sha nyung shas dang / 'u su dang / se'u 'bru la sogs pa bskol ba'i dangs ma ni dha ka la dang / ba ni zhes bya'o //
translated: A broth boiled with a little meat, jujube, cherry, and so on, is called dhakala and vanī.

original: zhes drang srong dag 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes drang srong dag 'chad do //
translated: Thus the sages explain.

original: ha ti dang / ai pu dang / ba ra nu dang ; dunti dang / tri ra du dang / ma tang gdang / dva bi dang / ga la bha dang / pu ksha ri dang / n'a ga dang / kunydza ra dza dang / sha ghi ha yan dang /
analyzed: ha ti dang / ai pu dang / ba ra nu dang ; dunti dang / tri ra du dang / ma tang gdang / dva bi dang / ga la bha dang / pu ksha ri dang / n'a ga dang / kunydza ra dza dang / sha ghi ha yan dang /
translated: Hāti, Ipu, Varānu, Dundubhi, Trirad, Matanga, Dvaṃbi, Galava, Puṣkarī, Nāga, Kuñjararāja, Śaghihayan,

original: de dag ni glang po che'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni glang po che'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of elephants.

original: kee re nu ka dang / ha ti bu ga dang / de dag ni glang po che mo'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kee re nu ka dang / ha ti bu ga dang / de dag ni glang po che mo'i ming ngo //
translated: Keiṇuka, Hātibuga, these are the names of female elephants.

original: aa shva dang / bi dza dang / ha ya dang / sha sha li ru rdza dang / tu ram ga ma dang / go ta dang / ba hu dang / pa ri dang / sa ba ti dang / su ram ga dang / stu ram go dang /
analyzed: aa shva dang / bi dza dang / ha ya dang / sha sha li ru rdza dang / tu ram ga ma dang / go ta dang / ba hu dang / pa ri dang / sa ba ti dang / su ram ga dang / stu ram go dang /
translated: Aśva, Vijaya, Haya, Śaśali, Rudja, Turaṅgama, Gota, Bahu, Pari, Sabati, Suranga, Sturanga,

original: dza bi dang / de dag ni rta'i ming ngo //
analyzed: dza bi dang / de dag ni rta'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of horses.

original: ba tra ba dang / gho to ka dang / de dag ni rgod ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ba tra ba dang / gho to ka dang / de dag ni rgod ma'i ming ngo //
translated: Batrava, Goṭoka, these are the names of mares.

original: sim ha dang / mri ga ri dang / sha ru la dang / ke sa ri dang / she ta pa ka li dang ; ha re dang / panytshu mu ka kha dang / kra bya dang / mi ra ga ra dza dang / sra kri pra dza dang /
analyzed: sim ha dang / mri ga ri dang / sha ru la dang / ke sa ri dang / she ta pa ka li dang ; ha re dang / panytshu mu ka kha dang / kra bya dang / mi ra ga ra dza dang / sra kri pra dza dang /
translated: Simha, Mṛgāri, Śārula, Kesarī, Śeṭapākalī, Hare, Pañcaśīrṣa, Kṛpī, Mirāgara, Jā, and Krakara.

original: de dag ni seng ge'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni seng ge'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of lions.

original: bhya gha dang / sta ra si dang / mri ga ra dang / dashti dang / tsida tra dang / gu pa ka ya dang / bhya la dang / panytsha n'a ga dang / dvi bi dang / mri ga ta dang / bhi ma darsha na dang /
analyzed: bhya gha dang / sta ra si dang / mri ga ra dang / dashti dang / tsida tra dang / gu pa ka ya dang / bhya la dang / panytsha n'a ga dang / dvi bi dang / mri ga ta dang / bhi ma darsha na dang /
translated: Bhyāgha, Tarasi, Mṛgāra, Daṣṭi, Citra, Gupakāya, Bhyāla, Pañcāṅga, Dvivida, Mṛgāta, and Bhimādarsana.

original: de dag ni stag gi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni stag gi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of tigers.

original: au sho dang / bhu ri ga mo dang / bha ya dang / ka ra bu dang / dhirgha dang / margha dang / dva ka ku dang / sha ku sa ni dang / bag kra ghu la ba dang / su cig kra ma dang /
analyzed: au sho dang / bhu ri ga mo dang / bha ya dang / ka ra bu dang / dhirgha dang / margha dang / dva ka ku dang / sha ku sa ni dang / bag kra ghu la ba dang / su cig kra ma dang /
translated: Uṣa, Bhūrigamo, Bhaya, Karabhu, Dhiṛg, Marga, Dvaṅka, Kuśanī, Bakrakhulābha, and Sucīkrama.

original: de dag ni rnga mo'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni rnga mo'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of camels.

original: ghara dha pa dang / ra sa gu dang / ba sa hva dang / dve ra ta dang / dhu ra ka dang / kha ra dang / b'a li ya dang / sham ku karna dang / bhaga kra ba dang / gha li du sa ra dang /
analyzed: ghara dha pa dang / ra sa gu dang / ba sa hva dang / dve ra ta dang / dhu ra ka dang / kha ra dang / b'a li ya dang / sham ku karna dang / bhaga kra ba dang / gha li du sa ra dang /
translated: Garada, Rasaguda, Vashahava, Vedadha, Dhuraka, Kara, Valaya, Samkukarna, Bhagakrava, Galidusara,

original: de dag ni lung bong gi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni lung bong gi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the rabbits.

original: dandu dang / go pa ti dang / ka ku sman dang / bri sha bcu dang / au grub dang / dan myo dang / balli brdha dang / ga'u raksha sha dang / dhu pa ra ta dang / de dag ni glang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: dandu dang / go pa ti dang / ka ku sman dang / bri sha bcu dang / au grub dang / dan myo dang / balli brdha dang / ga'u raksha sha dang / dhu pa ra ta dang / de dag ni glang gi ming ngo //
translated: Dandhu, Govati, Kakusman, Brishat, Ugrabha, Danmya, Ballivardha, Gurukasha, Dhuparatha, these are the names of the elephants.

original: @36a * // ga pu dang / aa dhi dang / pu ra bi dang / dhi bu dang / bri sh'a ti dang / nanda ni dang / ba su dang / de dag ni ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: @36a * // ga pu dang / aa dhi dang / pu ra bi dang / dhi bu dang / bri sh'a ti dang / nanda ni dang / ba su dang / de dag ni ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Kapila, Adhi, Purva, Dibhu, Brishat, Nandi, Vasu, these are the names of the cows.

original: rgyun be'u skye ba'i ba'i ming ni ka ya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun be'u skye ba'i ba'i ming ni ka ya zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of the cow that gives birth to a calf is Kaya.

original: lan cig be'u skyes pa'i ming ni ghushta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan cig be'u skyes pa'i ming ni ghushta zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of the cow that gives birth to a calf once is Ghustha.

original: ma he shu dang / ga pa la dang / dan shi ni dang / dan sha bi ru ka dang / ka lu ka dang / shring gi dang / bra bu kanda dang / ra dza sa la dang / de dag ni ma he'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma he shu dang / ga pa la dang / dan shi ni dang / dan sha bi ru ka dang / ka lu ka dang / shring gi dang / bra bu kanda dang / ra dza sa la dang / de dag ni ma he'i ming ngo //
translated: Mahīśu, Gāpāla, Daṃśīni, Daṃśavīruka, Kaloka, Śṛṅgī, Trapukaṇṭha, Rājāsala, these are the names of the buffaloes.

original: mri gu dang / ta ra na dang / tya sh'a dang / sha ram ga dang / krishna shar ga dang / ye na dang / sha pa la brishta dang / pa sha ga dang / ra tsa lo tsa na dang / de dag ni ri dags kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: mri gu dang / ta ra na dang / tya sh'a dang / sha ram ga dang / krishna shar ga dang / ye na dang / sha pa la brishta dang / pa sha ga dang / ra tsa lo tsa na dang / de dag ni ri dags kyi ming ngo //
translated: Mṛga, Tarana, Tyaśa, Śaraṅga, Kṛṣṇaśaraga, Yena, Śaparabṛṣṭa, Paśugra, Rācalocana, these are the names of the deer.

original: b'a r'a ha dang / bhag kra dang / shu ka dang / s'u ka ra dang / ro ma sha dang / ki ti dang / dashta dang / danta yu ta dang / tsan tra dang / bi ra kandha dang / bha'u pra dza dang /
analyzed: b'a r'a ha dang / bhag kra dang / shu ka dang / s'u ka ra dang / ro ma sha dang / ki ti dang / dashta dang / danta yu ta dang / tsan tra dang / bi ra kandha dang / bha'u pra dza dang /
translated: Vārāha, Bhaṅgaka, Śuka, Sūkara, Romaśa, Kiti, Daśta, Dantayuṭa, Caṇḍra, Virakaṇṭha, Bhūpraja,

original: de dag ni phag gi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni phag gi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the pigs.

original: bi dang / lu dang / bri sha dan sha dang / mrar dza dang / dib da lo tsa na dang / ma ya bhi dang / kri sha sha ki dang / bug ka dang / tsindu ga dang / na ku la ri dang / de dag ni byi la'i ming ngo //
analyzed: bi dang / lu dang / bri sha dan sha dang / mrar dza dang / dib da lo tsa na dang / ma ya bhi dang / kri sha sha ki dang / bug ka dang / tsindu ga dang / na ku la ri dang / de dag ni byi la'i ming ngo //
translated: Bī, Lu, Bṛiśa-danśa, Mṛa-rdza, Dib-da-lo-tsa-na, Ma-ya-bhi, Kri-śa-śa-ki, Bug-ka, Cin-du-ga, Na-ku-la-ri—these are the names of cats.

original: mu sha ka dang / aindu ra pha la dang / bee to dang / aa khu dang / bi li sha ya dang / sarba pa ha ra dang / de dag ni byi ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: mu sha ka dang / aindu ra pha la dang / bee to dang / aa khu dang / bi li sha ya dang / sarba pa ha ra dang / de dag ni byi ba'i ming ngo //
translated: Mu-śa-ka, I-n-du-ra-pha-la, Bei-to, A-khu, Bi-li-śa-ya, Sar-ba-pa-ha-ra—these are the names of mice.

original: tshud tshun da ri dang / ra dza pu tra dang / pu ti mu shi ka dang / gandha mu shi ka dang / de dag ni byi ba'i rigs gandha mu shi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tshud tshun da ri dang / ra dza pu tra dang / pu ti mu shi ka dang / gandha mu shi ka dang / de dag ni byi ba'i rigs gandha mu shi'i ming ngo //
translated: Tshu-tshun-da-ri, Ra-dza-pu-tra, Pu-ti-mu-śi-ka, Gan-dha-mu-śi-ka—these are the names of the types of mice known as gandhamushtika.

original: pri ka lu dang / dzambu ka dang / krishta dang / go ma sa dang / shi pa dang / bag tsha ra dang / mri ga du rta dang / bha ru ga dang / go ra ba dang / de dag ni ce sbyang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: pri ka lu dang / dzambu ka dang / krishta dang / go ma sa dang / shi pa dang / bag tsha ra dang / mri ga du rta dang / bha ru ga dang / go ra ba dang / de dag ni ce sbyang gi ming ngo //
translated: Pri-ka-lu, Jam-bu-ka, Kri-ṣṭa, Go-ma-sa, Śi-pa, Ba-gtsha-ra, Mi-rga-du-rta, Bha-ru-ga, Go-ra-ba—these are the names of mongooses.

original: ku ku ra dang ; sva ra mi ya dang / bhanda dang / sha na kha dang / shu na dang / bha la lu ka dang / bhu ru ka dang / pu ka ra shi dang / kri tag sna dang / de dag ni khyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ku ku ra dang ; sva ra mi ya dang / bhanda dang / sha na kha dang / shu na dang / bha la lu ka dang / bhu ru ka dang / pu ka ra shi dang / kri tag sna dang / de dag ni khyi'i ming ngo //
translated: Kukkurā, Svaramīyā, Bhandā, Śanakhā, Śunā, Balulukā, Bhūruka, Pukkarṣī, Kṛtaghnā—these are the names of dogs.

original: mar ta ka dang / ban rdza dang / mu sa dang / ha re dang / sha kha mri ga dang / ka bi dang / sla mar gha mar dang / ba na tsa ra dang ; dur mu kha dang / ni ri gong tser dang /
analyzed: mar ta ka dang / ban rdza dang / mu sa dang / ha re dang / sha kha mri ga dang / ka bi dang / sla mar gha mar dang / ba na tsa ra dang ; dur mu kha dang / ni ri gong tser dang /
translated: Mṛttikā, Bandha, Musā, Hare, Śaṅkhamṛgā, Kabī, Sūmaraghāmarā, Vanacārā, Durmukha, Nirghoṅkṣa—

original: de dag ni spre'u'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni spre'u'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of monkeys.

original: tsha gu dang / aa dza dang / tsag la dang / ba sta dang / bhu ga dang / pa ya sa la dang / aa dzo dang / mu ga dang / tsha ga la ka dang / lampa karna dang / pa shu dang / de dag ni ra'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsha gu dang / aa dza dang / tsag la dang / ba sta dang / bhu ga dang / pa ya sa la dang / aa dzo dang / mu ga dang / tsha ga la ka dang / lampa karna dang / pa shu dang / de dag ni ra'i ming ngo //
translated: Tsaṅgu, Ajā, Cakra, Vastā, Bhūga, Pāyasalā, Ajoka, Mugaka, Tsaṅgalaka, Lampākarṇa, Paśu—these are the names of goats.

original: me sha dang / me dha dang / hu @36b ta dang / aura bra dang / aa bi dang / aa li lu dang / li lung dang / tsa ra ka dang / pri thur shri ga ka dang / de dag ni lug gi ming ngo //🔽p'a ksha ta ti dang / pigga dang / bi ha ga dang / sha ku ni da dang / pad tva ra thu dang / dvi dang / yan dhya tha dang / ba hang ga ma dang / de dag ni bya rnams kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: me sha dang / me dha dang / hu @36b ta dang / aura bra dang / aa bi dang / aa li lu dang / li lung dang / tsa ra ka dang / pri thur shri ga ka dang / de dag ni lug gi ming ngo // p'a ksha ta ti dang / pigga dang / bi ha ga dang / sha ku ni da dang / pad tva ra thu dang / dvi dang / yan dhya tha dang / ba hang ga ma dang / de dag ni bya rnams kyi ming ngo //
translated: Mesha, Medha, Huṭa, Urbha, Avi, Alilu, Lili, Caraka, Prithurśṛṅgaka—these are the names of sheep.🔽Pāṣaṭṭi, Piṅgala, Vibhāga, Śakuni, Padmatarṣu, Dvi, Yandhyātha, Vahaṅgama—these are the names of birds.

original: ma y'u ra dang / bhan ri na dang / shi khanti dang / n'i la kantha ka dang / shi khi dang / sha dang / pattra dang / me gar ba dang / ka li pi dang / pri tra pinytsa ka dang / de dag ni rma bya'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma y'u ra dang / bhan ri na dang / shi khanti dang / n'i la kantha ka dang / shi khi dang / sha dang / pattra dang / me gar ba dang / ka li pi dang / pri tra pinytsa ka dang / de dag ni rma bya'i ming ngo //
translated: Mayūra, Bhanriṇa, Śikhin, Nīlakaṇṭhaka, Śikhi, Śada, Patra, Meghavarṇa, Kalipa, Priyapatrāṅka—these are the names of peacocks.

original: kur ku ta dang / stam ma burda dang / bhi kshi ka ra dang / tsa ra na yu ta dang / kri ka ba ku dang / ba hu ba tu dang / da ksha dang / sha'u tri dang / shi hindri ka dang / de dag ni khyim bya ste /
analyzed: kur ku ta dang / stam ma burda dang / bhi kshi ka ra dang / tsa ra na yu ta dang / kri ka ba ku dang / ba hu ba tu dang / da ksha dang / sha'u tri dang / shi hindri ka dang / de dag ni khyim bya ste /
translated: Kurkuṭa, Stambamarda, Bhikṣakara, Caranayūtha, Kṛkavāku, Bahuvāku, Dākṣa, Śūtri, Śīhindrika, these are the names of the cock.

original: bya gag gi ming ngo //
analyzed: bya gag gi ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the fowl.

original: tsa kra ba ka dang / tsa kra hva dang / pa tra rla thu dang / ra thi dang / ra tha ga na ma dang / su shi ka dang / ka mu dang / ra ga ta dang / de dag ni dur pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsa kra ba ka dang / tsa kra hva dang / pa tra rla thu dang / ra thi dang / ra tha ga na ma dang / su shi ka dang / ka mu dang / ra ga ta dang / de dag ni dur pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Cakravāka, Cakrahava, Patralāṭha, Rathi, Rathaganama, Śuśika, Kamuda, Rāghava, these are the names of the crane.

original: hansa dang / shve ta dang / darda rashta dang / ra dza hansa dang / ma nu ra ma dang / ka la hansa dang / ba ra bi ta dang / b'a kra ga dang / dza la pa tra dang / de dag ni ngang pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: hansa dang / shve ta dang / darda rashta dang / ra dza hansa dang / ma nu ra ma dang / ka la hansa dang / ba ra bi ta dang / b'a kra ga dang / dza la pa tra dang / de dag ni ngang pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Hamsa, Śveta, Darśata, Rājahamsa, Manoharāma, Kalahansa, Varavīta, Vākraga, Jalapatra, these are the names of the goose.

original: ko ki la dang / pa ra pu she dang / ka la kanta dang / pa ra bri tha dang / ba santa tu ta dang / ta ma mra kshu dang / ghandarba dang ; ma du ra sva ra dang / de dag ni bya khu byug gi ming ngo //
analyzed: ko ki la dang / pa ra pu she dang / ka la kanta dang / pa ra bri tha dang / ba santa tu ta dang / ta ma mra kshu dang / ghandarba dang ; ma du ra sva ra dang / de dag ni bya khu byug gi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the cuckoo.

original: ka ka dang / drang sha dang / bha li bhug dang / du li dza ka dang / bha ya sa dang / ka na dang / rishta dang / aa pra ma ta dang / tsi ra dzi ba dang / ni bi ta krid dang /
analyzed: ka ka dang / drang sha dang / bha li bhug dang / du li dza ka dang / bha ya sa dang / ka na dang / rishta dang / aa pra ma ta dang / tsi ra dzi ba dang / ni bi ta krid dang /
translated: kaka, dṛṃśa, balibhuk, dūlijaka, bhayasa, kana, ṛṣṭa, apramata, cirājava, nivitakrida,

original: de dag ni bya rog gi ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni bya rog gi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the crow.

original: au lu ka dang / bha ya sa ri pu dang / koo shi ka dang / ri ta tsa ra dang / nagta tsa ri dang / ka kashta tya dang / de banda dang / aa mam ga lya pakshi dang / hi ra lo tsan dang /
analyzed: au lu ka dang / bha ya sa ri pu dang / koo shi ka dang / ri ta tsa ra dang / nagta tsa ri dang / ka kashta tya dang / de banda dang / aa mam ga lya pakshi dang / hi ra lo tsan dang /
translated: ulūka, bhayasarīpu, kauśika, ṛtacara, nagatacara, kakṣatyā, devabandhu, amāṅgalapākṣika, hiraloka,

original: de dag ni 'ug pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni 'ug pa'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the owl.

original: 'dang / gha ha paksha dang / gri ta ka po ta dang / ghri ha sha pu dang / barbu ha dang / rag tanta tsa ma ka na dang / de dag ni phug ron gyi ming ngo //🔽shu ka dang / ki ru dang / rakta runta dang / mi da byi dang / bri ya dar sha na dang / ma h'a r'a dza shu ka dang / sha ta pa tra dang / de dag ni ne tsho'i ming ngo //
analyzed: 'dang / gha ha paksha dang / gri ta ka po ta dang / ghri ha sha pu dang / barbu ha dang / rag tanta tsa ma ka na dang / de dag ni phug ron gyi ming ngo // shu ka dang / ki ru dang / rakta runta dang / mi da byi dang / bri ya dar sha na dang / ma h'a r'a dza shu ka dang / sha ta pa tra dang / de dag ni ne tsho'i ming ngo //
translated: 1. ghaṭa, 2. ghaṭapāka, 3. gṛtakapota, 4. gṛhāśapa, 5. varbhū, 6. raktaṃcamakana—these are the names of the pigeon.🔽1. śuka, 2. kiru, 3. rakta-runta, 4. midabhi, 5. bṛyādarśana, 6. mahārāja-śuka, 7. śatapatra—these are the names of the parrot.

original: bee da b'i ni dang / sha ri ka dang / go ri ka dang / ka la ha ku la dang / so ma dang / go ri tig dang / go ki ra ti dang / dhu @37a * //🔽ti ka dang / pri ya na di ni dang / de dag ni ri skegs kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: bee da b'i ni dang / sha ri ka dang / go ri ka dang / ka la ha ku la dang / so ma dang / go ri tig dang / go ki ra ti dang / dhu @37a * //🔽ti ka dang / pri ya na di ni dang / de dag ni ri skegs kyi ming ngo //
translated: 1. vaidavīṇi, 2. śārika, 3. gorika, 4. kalahākula, 5. soma, 6. gorittika, 7. gokarati, 8. dhūtika, 9. priyānandinī—these are the names of the myna bird.

original: so ma dang / bra ma ra dang / shad parda dang / bringga dang / bringga ra dzi dang / shi la mu kha dang / dvi ri pa dang / aa la dang / ma du ka ra dang / ma du li dang / bu shya lo lu pa dang /
analyzed: so ma dang / bra ma ra dang / shad parda dang / bringga dang / bringga ra dzi dang / shi la mu kha dang / dvi ri pa dang / aa la dang / ma du ka ra dang / ma du li dang / bu shya lo lu pa dang /
translated: Somasa, Pramara, Śyaparṇa, Bṛṅga, Bṛṅgarāja, Śilāmukha, Dviripā, Āla, Madhukara, Madhuli, and Būṣyalolupā.

original: de dag ni bung ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni bung ba'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of bees.

original: tsa ta ka dang / ka la bi ka dang / ku li ga dang / ku li dang / b'a ra dva dza dang / dza ti dang / bhu mi dang / de dag ni bye'u mchil pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsa ta ka dang / ka la bi ka dang / ku li ga dang / ku li dang / b'a ra dva dza dang / dza ti dang / bhu mi dang / de dag ni bye'u mchil pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Cātaka, Kalavika, Kūlajīva, Kūla, Vāraṇāśva, Jāti, Bhūmi—these are the names of the sparrow.

original: sva ra na dang / ma du dang / ma ksha ka dang / de dag ni sbrang ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sva ra na dang / ma du dang / ma ksha ka dang / de dag ni sbrang ma'i ming ngo //
translated: Svarṇa, Madhu, Makṣaka—these are the names of the bee.

original: aa ti dang / aa su bla ba ti dang / bla ba dang / na ra ta dang / bar li dang / hansi dang / ba la dang / ke sa ranydzi ka dang / sha ra r'i ra ta dang / kronytsa dang / pu ti ka dang /
analyzed: aa ti dang / aa su bla ba ti dang / bla ba dang / na ra ta dang / bar li dang / hansi dang / ba la dang / ke sa ranydzi ka dang / sha ra r'i ra ta dang / kronytsa dang / pu ti ka dang /
translated: Ati, Asubalabati, Laba, Narada, Barī, Hansi, Bāla, Kesaranyāka, Śarārarata, Kroñca, Putika,

original: de rnams ni chu la gnas pa'i bya rnams te aa ti ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni chu la gnas pa'i bya rnams te aa ti ka zhes bya'o //
translated: These are the water birds, called atika.

original: ku ru da zhes bya ba ni bya au gro sha yin no //
analyzed: ku ru da zhes bya ba ni bya au gro sha yin no //
translated: Kuruda means the bird uragas.

original: shu kunda dang / bha sa dang / ghidda dang / de dag ni bya rgod kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: shu kunda dang / bha sa dang / ghidda dang / de dag ni bya rgod kyi ming ngo //
translated: Śukunda, bhasa, gida, these are the names of vultures.

original: tsarma tsi kri ka dang / dza lu ka dang / dza la tsa ri ni dang / barma sva h'a dang / de dag ni srin bu pad pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsarma tsi kri ka dang / dza lu ka dang / dza la tsa ri ni dang / barma sva h'a dang / de dag ni srin bu pad pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Carma, cikrika, jaloka, jalacarin, varmasvaha, these are the names of worms.

original: gu dang / ga dang / kad tsha pa dang / kur ma dang / go sho lu dang / dza la su ka dang / de dag ni rus sbal gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: gu dang / ga dang / kad tsha pa dang / kur ma dang / go sho lu dang / dza la su ka dang / de dag ni rus sbal gyi ming ngo //
translated: Gu, ga, kadacchapa, kurma, goshola, jalusuka, these are the names of tortoises.

original: ku ra bil pa dang / ka lir dang / ba ri la shi ta dang / de dag ni srin bu karka ta'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ku ra bil pa dang / ka lir dang / ba ri la shi ta dang / de dag ni srin bu karka ta'i ming ngo //
translated: Kurubila, kalir, varilasita, these are the names of crabs.

original: kambu dang / britta dang / sham kha dang / nad dang / dza la dza dang / aambu dza dang / de dag ni dung gi ming ngo //
analyzed: kambu dang / britta dang / sham kha dang / nad dang / dza la dza dang / aambu dza dang / de dag ni dung gi ming ngo //
translated: Kambu, bhritta, shamka, nada, jalaja, ambuja, these are the names of conches.

original: med tsha dang / mi na dang / dzha sha dang / kanthi dang / sha pharya dang / ksho tra ma tshi ka dang / de dag ni nya'i ming ngo //🔽mandya ka dang ; dha du ra dang / ba ka dang / ka ka hi dang / to ya sarba dang / b'arsha bu dang / ra dza ma na rya ya ka dang / dva man rya bya dang / pi ta barna ba dang / de dag ni sbal pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: med tsha dang / mi na dang / dzha sha dang / kanthi dang / sha pharya dang / ksho tra ma tshi ka dang / de dag ni nya'i ming ngo // mandya ka dang ; dha du ra dang / ba ka dang / ka ka hi dang / to ya sarba dang / b'arsha bu dang / ra dza ma na rya ya ka dang / dva man rya bya dang / pi ta barna ba dang / de dag ni sbal pa'i ming ngo //
translated: [There are also] the names of fish:🔽[There are also] the names of frogs:

original: sarba dang / dashte dang / dri dzi hva dang / aa hi dang / bho dza ga dang / ma ru ta shan dang / ao ra ga dang / panna ga dang ; bi gi dang / pha ni dang / n'a ga dang / bru ma dza ma dang /🔽de dag ni sbrul gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: sarba dang / dashte dang / dri dzi hva dang / aa hi dang / bho dza ga dang / ma ru ta shan dang / ao ra ga dang / panna ga dang ; bi gi dang / pha ni dang / n'a ga dang / bru ma dza ma dang /🔽de dag ni sbrul gyi ming ngo //
translated: [There are also] the names of snakes:

original: kri ki las dang / ma ru ra ri dang / ku ta dza la dang / tri barna ka dang / sa tsar dang / bhig ge dha dang / ba ru pa dang / sar ru dang / de dag ni rtsangs pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kri ki las dang / ma ru ra ri dang / ku ta dza la dang / tri barna ka dang / sa tsar dang / bhig ge dha dang / ba ru pa dang / sar ru dang / de dag ni rtsangs pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Kṛkila, Marurari, Kutaja, Trivarṇa, Sacara, Bhikgeṭha, Varūpa, Sarūpa—these are the names of lizards.

original: ka linda dang / khandha le hi ka @37b dang ; ta la tra dang / stu la danti ka dang / garu ti ka dang / di madsa dang / tsi ka ku dang / gri ha gu li ku dang / de dag ni bhi da ti manytsha zhes bya ba'i srin bu'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ka linda dang / khandha le hi ka @37b dang ; ta la tra dang / stu la danti ka dang / garu ti ka dang / di madsa dang / tsi ka ku dang / gri ha gu li ku dang / de dag ni bhi da ti manytsha zhes bya ba'i srin bu'i ming ngo //
translated: Kalinda, Khaṇḍalehi, Talatara, Stūladantika, Garutika, Dimda, Cika, Kuka, Grihagulika—these are the names of the worms called bhidati mñatsa.

original: ga bi bu gang zhes bya ba'i 'bud pa 'dra ba'i srin bu yod de /
analyzed: ga bi bu gang zhes bya ba'i 'bud pa 'dra ba'i srin bu yod de /
translated: There is a worm called Gabhibuga, which is like a grain of sesame.

original: de'i dbye ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Its divisions have been taught above.

original: ga byin ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ga byin ka zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called Gabhiṅka.

original: au te ta ka dang / au pa dzembi ka dang / dee la pi li ka dang / de dag ni grog mo'i ming ngo //
analyzed: au te ta ka dang / au pa dzembi ka dang / dee la pi li ka dang / de dag ni grog mo'i ming ngo //
translated: Uṭṭeṭaka, Upajembhika, Deilapiṭika—these are the names of ants.

original: kshu ta ka dang / ma ksha ka dang / nan ni lam ksha ka dang / ban ya khrid ka dang / de dag ni sbrang rtsi byed kyi sbrang ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kshu ta ka dang / ma ksha ka dang / nan ni lam ksha ka dang / ban ya khrid ka dang / de dag ni sbrang rtsi byed kyi sbrang ma'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the bees that make honey.🔽Patanga,🔽Shalabha,

original: pa tam ga dang / sha la ba dang / de dag ni chag pa ste bye ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pa tam ga dang / sha la ba dang / de dag ni chag pa ste bye ma'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the locusts.🔽Khadhuha,🔽Rinjika,

original: kha du he dang / ranydzi ka dang / de dag ni srin bu me khyer gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: kha du he dang / ranydzi ka dang / de dag ni srin bu me khyer gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the fireflies.🔽Vanika,🔽Kika,🔽Shikha,🔽Chuda,🔽Chanda-kuda,🔽Michika,🔽Shikhandi,🔽Kalupuka,🔽Vahrapakasha,

original: ba ni dang / ki ka dang / shi kha dang / tsu da dang / tsanda ku dang / mi tsi ka dang / shi khanda dang / ka lu pu dang / b'a hra pa ksha dang / de dag ni rma bya'i cod pan gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: ba ni dang / ki ka dang / shi kha dang / tsu da dang / tsanda ku dang / mi tsi ka dang / shi khanda dang / ka lu pu dang / b'a hra pa ksha dang / de dag ni rma bya'i cod pan gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the peacock's crest.🔽Pudchata,🔽Talamkula,🔽Valabhi,🔽Khubarashi,

original: pud tsha dang / ta lam ku la dang / b'a la bi dang / khu bar shi ba dang / de dag ni byugs pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pud tsha dang / ta lam ku la dang / b'a la bi dang / khu bar shi ba dang / de dag ni byugs pa'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of the ointments.

original: briksha dang / sta ru dang / sha ka ha dang / sha khi dang / du ma dang / p'a ra pa dang / ghan ba na dang / de dag ni shing zhes bya ste /
analyzed: briksha dang / sta ru dang / sha ka ha dang / sha khi dang / du ma dang / p'a ra pa dang / ghan ba na dang / de dag ni shing zhes bya ste /
translated: the bṛkṣa, the tāru, the śakaha, the śaki, the dūma, the pārapa, the ghanavana.

original: de las kyang shing chen po 'bras bu can ni ba ni ya ti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang shing chen po 'bras bu can ni ba ni ya ti zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the tree with fruit is called vanīyati.

original: 'bras bu dang me tog tu ldan pa ni ban ya ti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog tu ldan pa ni ban ya ti zhes bya'o //
translated: The one with flowers and fruit is called vanīyāti.

original: lo ma dang shun par ldan pa ni btu ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang shun par ldan pa ni btu ta zhes bya'o //
translated: The one with leaves and bark is called bāṭu.

original: 'bras bu smin pa'i dus kyi rtsa ba ni dza ta shi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu smin pa'i dus kyi rtsa ba ni dza ta shi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The root of the tree at the time of ripe fruit is called jātiśi.

original: de ltar sman gyi dbye ba bzhir byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sman gyi dbye ba bzhir byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the division of medicine is made into four.

original: gang rtsa ba dang / lo ma dang ldan pa ni pra kante zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtsa ba dang / lo ma dang ldan pa ni pra kante zhes bya'o //
translated: The one with root and leaves is called prakaṇṭe.

original: gang rgya chen por 'phros pa de ni bi ta bashta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rgya chen por 'phros pa de ni bi ta bashta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that spreads widely is called vitabhastha.

original: yal ga dang lo ma dang ldan pa de ni sa la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yal ga dang lo ma dang ldan pa de ni sa la zhes bya'o //
translated: The one with branches and leaves is called śāla.

original: myu gu dang / snye ma dang / thor to dang ldan pa de ni bang la pa dang / ke sa la ya dang / aa ku ra dang / aa ba ya ba dang / na ya dang / de dag ni yal ga phre'u'i ming ngo //
analyzed: myu gu dang / snye ma dang / thor to dang ldan pa de ni bang la pa dang / ke sa la ya dang / aa ku ra dang / aa ba ya ba dang / na ya dang / de dag ni yal ga phre'u'i ming ngo //
translated: The one with a sprout, a tassel, and a bud is called a branch, a kesara, an akura, an avaya, and a naya. These are the names of the twigs.

original: pad tra dang / bharna dang / pa la sha dang / tsha da na dang / tshan dman dang / tsha man dang / de dag ni lo ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pad tra dang / bharna dang / pa la sha dang / tsha da na dang / tshan dman dang / tsha man dang / de dag ni lo ma'i ming ngo //
translated: The padtra, the bharna, the palasha, the chandana, the chandana, the chandana, and the chandana are the names of the leaves.

original: mu gu la dang / ka li ka dang / aa su na dang / kud ma lu dang / dza la ka dang / ksha ra ka dang / de dag ni me tog kha 'bus pa'i ming ngo //🔽aa tri phrar pu li ta dang / ai bu pi ti dang / pra su ta dang / pra sa ma ma dang / pu @38a * //
analyzed: mu gu la dang / ka li ka dang / aa su na dang / kud ma lu dang / dza la ka dang / ksha ra ka dang / de dag ni me tog kha 'bus pa'i ming ngo // aa tri phrar pu li ta dang / ai bu pi ti dang / pra su ta dang / pra sa ma ma dang / pu @38a * //
translated: The mugula, the kalika, the asuna, the kudmalu, the jalaka, and the ksharakas are the names of the blooming flowers.

original: shya dang / ku su ma dang / phulla dang / de dag ni me tog gi ming ngo //
analyzed: shya dang / ku su ma dang / phulla dang / de dag ni me tog gi ming ngo //
translated: The atripharpula, the ibupiti, the prasuta, the prasamama, the pushya, the kusuma, and the phulla are the names of the flowers.

original: gu lu dang / gud tsha dang / sta ba ka dang / pu sha sa ma ha ri dang / de dag ni me tog rgyas pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gu lu dang / gud tsha dang / sta ba ka dang / pu sha sa ma ha ri dang / de dag ni me tog rgyas pa'i ming ngo //
translated: gulū, guccha, stavakā, puṣpasaṃharī. These are the names of the flowers in full bloom.

original: ma ka ran do ra sa dang / pu sha ra ka dang / ra dzo dang / ma dha dang / de dag ni ge sar te ze ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ma ka ran do ra sa dang / pu sha ra ka dang / ra dzo dang / ma dha dang / de dag ni ge sar te ze ba'i ming ngo //
translated: makaranḍavās, puṣkarājas, rajas, madhu. These are the names of the stamens.

original: su gandha zhes bya ba ni dri zhim pa yin no //
analyzed: su gandha zhes bya ba ni dri zhim pa yin no //
translated: sugandha means “good smell.”

original: durgandha zhes bya ba ni dri nga ba yin no //
analyzed: durgandha zhes bya ba ni dri nga ba yin no //
translated: dur-gandha means “bad smell.”

original: ga ru la pa'i dri ni sar gandha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ga ru la pa'i dri ni sar gandha zhes bya'o //
translated: The smell of camphor is called saragandha.

original: shing stug por mdzes pa ni la tanta ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing stug por mdzes pa ni la tanta ra zhes bya'o //
translated: Beautiful in a dense forest is called lantan-tara.

original: 'bras bu skam pa'i ming ni dha ru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skam pa'i ming ni dha ru zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of a dried fruit is dhāru.

original: durthi ta zhes bya ba ni ru pa yin no //
analyzed: durthi ta zhes bya ba ni ru pa yin no //
translated: Durthita means “form.”

original: gang 'grigs pa'i ming ni barti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'grigs pa'i ming ni barti zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of what is arranged is vṛtti.

original: gran gyi dang / sba tu dang / parpa dang / de dag ni 'bus pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: gran gyi dang / sba tu dang / parpa dang / de dag ni 'bus pa'i ming ngo //
translated: granthi, bāṭu, parpaṭa. These are the names of the sprouts.

original: shin tu dang / shri sha masta ka dang / shi ka ra dang / de dag ni shing gi thor to'i ming ngo //
analyzed: shin tu dang / shri sha masta ka dang / shi ka ra dang / de dag ni shing gi thor to'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of tree-fruits.🔽draca, valkala, tavi,

original: dra tsa dang / b'alka la dang / tsha bi dang / de dag ni shing shun gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: dra tsa dang / b'alka la dang / tsha bi dang / de dag ni shing shun gyi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of tree-barks.🔽sara, tatanu,

original: sa ra dang / ta tu na dang / de dag ni shing gi snying po'am rkang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: sa ra dang / ta tu na dang / de dag ni shing gi snying po'am rkang gi ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of tree-hearts or trunks.

original: da ru zhes bya ba ni shun pa dang / rkang gi bar na 'dug pa ste shing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ru zhes bya ba ni shun pa dang / rkang gi bar na 'dug pa ste shing zhes bya'o //
translated: daru is that which is between the bark and the trunk, and is called a tree.

original: sha ya zhes bya ba ni rtsva gzhon nu ma'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sha ya zhes bya ba ni rtsva gzhon nu ma'i ming ngo //
translated: śaya is the name of a young grass.🔽trina, kṣaka, trinopala,

original: tri na dang / ksha ka dang / tri no phal dang / de dag ni rtsva'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tri na dang / ksha ka dang / tri no phal dang / de dag ni rtsva'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of grasses.

original: lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pa britta bhan dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog la sogs pa britta bhan dang zhes bya'o //
translated: Leaves, fruits, flowers, etc. are called bṛttivana.🔽prāraha, kani, akarā,

original: pra ra ha dang / ka ni dang / aa ku ra dang / de dag ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa shing gi myu gu'i ming ngo //
analyzed: pra ra ha dang / ka ni dang / aa ku ra dang / de dag ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa shing gi myu gu'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of sprouts of trees such as nyagrodha.

original: shing gi yal ga'am /
analyzed: shing gi yal ga'am /
translated: A tree branch or

original: lcug ma'am / lo ma gzhon nu ni dbyar ram dpyid btu dus yin no //
analyzed: lcug ma'am / lo ma gzhon nu ni dbyar ram dpyid btu dus yin no //
translated: The young shoots and leaves are gathered in the summer or spring.

original: rtsva btu ba'i dus ni sos ka'am ston yin no //
analyzed: rtsva btu ba'i dus ni sos ka'am ston yin no //
translated: The grass is gathered in the spring or autumn.

original: shing gi shun pa dang / 'o ma dang / rtsa ba rnams ni ston btu ba yin no //
analyzed: shing gi shun pa dang / 'o ma dang / rtsa ba rnams ni ston btu ba yin no //
translated: The bark, milk and roots of trees are gathered in the autumn.

original: shing gi snying po ni dgun btu ba yin no //
analyzed: shing gi snying po ni dgun btu ba yin no //
translated: The heartwood of trees is gathered in the winter.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu ya sa smin pa'i dus su btu ba yin no //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu ya sa smin pa'i dus su btu ba yin no //
translated: Flowers and fruits are gathered when they are ripe.

original: de ltar so so'i dus su btus pa ni nus pa shin tu che ba yin no //🔽shing mngar ba dang / bsil ba ni dpyid kyi dus su btu'o //
analyzed: de ltar so so'i dus su btus pa ni nus pa shin tu che ba yin no // shing mngar ba dang / bsil ba ni dpyid kyi dus su btu'o //
translated: Thus, when gathered at the right time, they have great potency.🔽Sweet and cooling herbs are gathered in the spring.

original: sman rno ba ni sos ka tsha ba'i dus su btu'o //
analyzed: sman rno ba ni sos ka tsha ba'i dus su btu'o //
translated: Sharp herbs are gathered in the spring, the hot season.

original: de ltar dus legs pa'i sman nad pa la sbyar na bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dus legs pa'i sman nad pa la sbyar na bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When such well-timed medicines are applied to the sick, they are like nectar.

original: n+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / plaksha dang / lcang ma dang / lnga po de dag la cha snyoms te gcig tu byas pa @38b ni shing 'o ma can shun pa lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / plaksha dang / lcang ma dang / lnga po de dag la cha snyoms te gcig tu byas pa @38b ni shing 'o ma can shun pa lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: Nyagrodha, udumbara, ashvattha, plaksha, and bamboo—these five are equalized and made into one, which is called the five-barked milky tree.

original: ba'i lci ba dang / gcin dang / zho dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang / de rnams snyoms pa ni ba'i rnam lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i lci ba dang / gcin dang / zho dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang / de rnams snyoms pa ni ba'i rnam lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: Cow dung, urine, curd, ghee, and milk—these are equalized and called the five products of the cow.

original: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / shun lpags dang / de rnams ni yan lag lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / shun lpags dang / de rnams ni yan lag lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: Leaves, flowers, fruits, roots, and bark—these are called the five branches.

original: mngar ba ni madhu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngar ba ni madhu zhes bya'o //
translated: Sweet is called madhu.

original: skyur ba ni tsu kra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyur ba ni tsu kra zhes bya'o //
translated: Sour is called chukra.

original: lan tshva ni pa tu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan tshva ni pa tu zhes bya'o //
translated: Salt is called patu.

original: tsha ba ni ka tu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsha ba ni ka tu zhes bya'o //
translated: Hot is called kattu.

original: kha ba ni tig ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha ba ni tig ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Pungent is called tikta.

original: de ltar so so'i ro rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar so so'i ro rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the individual tastes should be known.

original: aa'u sha dang / bee sha tsa dang / tra bya dang / hi ta dang / pa thya dang / ba sha tsa ha dang ; de dag ni sman zhes bya ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: aa'u sha dang / bee sha tsa dang / tra bya dang / hi ta dang / pa thya dang / ba sha tsa ha dang ; de dag ni sman zhes bya ba'i ming ngo //
translated: these are the names of medicine.

original: dag pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa ni gso ba ste dza gitstsha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa ni gso ba ste dza gitstsha zhes bya'o //
translated: Purifying, pacifying, and so on are treatment (cikitsā).

original: snum chos kyis stags par byed pa ni yi ge zhes bya'o //🔽sman 'jam pos ni dag par bya'o //
analyzed: snum chos kyis stags par byed pa ni yi ge zhes bya'o // sman 'jam pos ni dag par bya'o //
translated: Anointing with oil is called unctuous (snigdha).🔽With mild medicine, one should purify (śodhana).

original: sman rnon pos ni bsku sman bya'o //
analyzed: sman rnon pos ni bsku sman bya'o //
translated: With sharp medicine, one should eject (āsthāpana).

original: bsku ba dang gdab par bya ba'i ni nir bha na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsku ba dang gdab par bya ba'i ni nir bha na zhes bya'o //
translated: Ejection and insertion are called nirbhāna (nirbhāna).

original: gcad pa dang dag pa ni don gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: gcad pa dang dag pa ni don gcig pa yin no //
translated: Cutting and purifying have the same meaning.

original: sman mas gtong ba'i ming ni /
analyzed: sman mas gtong ba'i ming ni /
translated: The names of the female physicians are:

original: aa ta pa na dang / aa nu bas na dang gnyis so //
analyzed: aa ta pa na dang / aa nu bas na dang gnyis so //
translated: ātreyī and anuvāsanyā.

original: de la aa ta pa na zhes bya ba ni ni ru ha yin te bkru sman drag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la aa ta pa na zhes bya ba ni ni ru ha yin te bkru sman drag po zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, ātreyī means nirūha, which is called strong purgative (tiksna-nirūha).

original: pitstsha ba sti dang / nyams brta ba'i mas gtong ba dang / de dag byed pa'i ni byed kyi mas gtong ba dang / nad slong zhing bsdu ba'i mas gtong ba dang / le kha na dang / ro tsa bar byed pa'i mas gtong ba dang /
analyzed: pitstsha ba sti dang / nyams brta ba'i mas gtong ba dang / de dag byed pa'i ni byed kyi mas gtong ba dang / nad slong zhing bsdu ba'i mas gtong ba dang / le kha na dang / ro tsa bar byed pa'i mas gtong ba dang /
translated: Piccha-basti, Anuvasana-basti, Asthapana-basti, Niruha-basti, Lekhana-basti, Ropana-basti,

original: sbrang rtsi dang / til mar gyi sbyor ba dang / de dag ni mas gtong bar grags pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang / til mar gyi sbyor ba dang / de dag ni mas gtong bar grags pa'i ming ngo //
translated: Madhu-taila-yoga, these are the well-known names of basti.
