original: aa nu bas na ni 'jam rtsi yin te /
analyzed: aa nu bas na ni 'jam rtsi yin te /
translated: Anuvasana is unctuous enema.

original: de'i ming ni nyes pa 'joms byed dang / yugti ra tha dang / mtshan na sams gtong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i ming ni nyes pa 'joms byed dang / yugti ra tha dang / mtshan na sams gtong ba ste /
translated: Its names are doṣa-ghna, yugatira, and nidāna-basti.

original: sa de dag ni snun gyi 'jam rtsi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de dag ni snun gyi 'jam rtsi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called unctuous enema.

original: stod kyi nyes pa la ni skyug sman zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stod kyi nyes pa la ni skyug sman zhes bya ste /
translated: For upper disorders, emetic medicine is used.

original: de'i ming ni tsa ra ti dang / ba ma ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming ni tsa ra ti dang / ba ma ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Its names are carati and vamana.

original: smad kyi nyes pa la ni bkru sman gyis bsal te /
analyzed: smad kyi nyes pa la ni bkru sman gyis bsal te /
translated: For lower disorders, purgative medicine is used.

original: de'i ming ni shvan tra sa na bi ri tsan dang / be ra na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming ni shvan tra sa na bi ri tsan dang / be ra na zhes bya'o //
translated: Its names are śvetanāsanaviricyana and verana.

analyzed: nyes pa la sogs pa ni dag rang gi gnas las nyams shing log par song ba ni nad gzhi dang mi mthun pa dang / lugs su mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o //

original: bil ba dang / aagni mantha dang / 'o na na ka dang / ta pa la dang / pa ta la dang / de dag ni rtsa ba chen po lnga zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: bil ba dang / aagni mantha dang / 'o na na ka dang / ta pa la dang / pa ta la dang / de dag ni rtsa ba chen po lnga zhes bya ste ;
translated: These are called the five great roots.

original: de'i ming ni ma h'a dang / aad dam pa dang / ba da ni dang / bri ha dang / de dag ni spyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de'i ming ni ma h'a dang / aad dam pa dang / ba da ni dang / bri ha dang / de dag ni spyi'i ming ngo //
translated: Their names are mahat, adhamapada, vadanī, brihat, and brihatī. These are the general names.

original: sa la parni dang / krishna parni dang / bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / gze ma dang / de dag ni rtsa ba chung ngu lnga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa la parni dang / krishna parni dang / bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / gze ma dang / de dag ni rtsa ba chung ngu lnga zhes bya ste /
translated: Salaparni, kṛṣṇaparni, brihati, kaṇḍakari, and asa. These are called the five small roots.

original: de'i ming ni /
analyzed: de'i ming ni /
translated: Their names are

original: ka ni ya sa dang / ha sva dang ; aalpa dang / la gu'o //
analyzed: ka ni ya sa dang / ha sva dang ; aalpa dang / la gu'o //
translated: kanikārasa, hasva, alpa, and laghu.

original: pi pi ling dang / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / dbyi mo dang / kru trug tres dang / bca' sga lnga ni tsha ba lnga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pi pi ling dang / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / dbyi mo dang / kru trug tres dang / bca' sga lnga ni tsha ba lnga zhes bya ste /
translated: Pippali, pippalimūla, cīṇaka, ciraṭī, and śṛṅgavera. These five are called the five hot spices.

original: de'i ming ni panytsa ka ko la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ming ni panytsa ka ko la zhes bya'o //
translated: Their name is pañcaka kola.

original: dngul dang / zangs ma dang / lcags nag po dang / zha nye nag po dang / zha nye dkar po dang / de rnams lcags lnga zhes bya ste /🔽panytsa lo ha yin no //
analyzed: dngul dang / zangs ma dang / lcags nag po dang / zha nye nag po dang / zha nye dkar po dang / de rnams lcags lnga zhes bya ste / panytsa lo ha yin no //
translated: These are the five metals.

original: aa shvangtha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / plag sha dang / bil ba dang / phal gu dang / de dag ni shing 'o ma can lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa shvangtha dang / au dumb'a ra dang / plag sha dang / bil ba dang / phal gu dang / de dag ni shing 'o ma can lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: The five milky trees are the aśvattha, udumbara, plakṣa, bilva, and phalgub.

original: 'phel ba'i gnas ni 'bri dha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i gnas ni 'bri dha zhes bya'o //
translated: The place of increase is called “adridha.”

original: khang ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi gnas ni /
analyzed: khang ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi gnas ni /
translated: The external places such as houses are

original: tri ku na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tri ku na zhes bya'o //
translated: called “trikuṇa.”

original: grong gi phyi rol lha stengs ni mod ces bya'o //
analyzed: grong gi phyi rol lha stengs ni mod ces bya'o //
translated: The place outside the village is called “moḍa.”

original: tsu li dang / ba ka sha ka ra dang / de dag ni kha ra tshos pa'am smin pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: tsu li dang / ba ka sha ka ra dang / de dag ni kha ra tshos pa'am smin pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The two kinds of sugar are called “cūla” and “bakṣaka.”

original: kha cig na re ba li dang / be kru sam gha tri dang / aa gha ta dang / shar ba ni dang / sru ta dang / de yang kha ra'i ming ngo //
analyzed: kha cig na re ba li dang / be kru sam gha tri dang / aa gha ta dang / shar ba ni dang / sru ta dang / de yang kha ra'i ming ngo //
translated: Some say that the names of sugar are “bali,” “vetra,” “saṃgati,” “aghata,” “śarvaṇa,” and “sūta.”

original: ka ku ba dang / kashta dang / de dag ni phyogs kyi ming ste /
analyzed: ka ku ba dang / kashta dang / de dag ni phyogs kyi ming ste /
translated: These are the names of the directions.

original: kha cig ni bzhir 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig ni bzhir 'dod /
translated: Some consider them to be four in number.

original: kha cig ni brgyad du 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig ni brgyad du 'dod /
translated: Others consider them to be eight in number.

original: de las kyang shar phyogs dbang po //
analyzed: de las kyang shar phyogs dbang po //
translated: Among them, the east is Indra,

original: lho gshin rje /🔽nub chu lha /
analyzed: lho gshin rje / nub chu lha /
translated: the south is Yama,🔽the west is Varuna,

original: byang rnam thos kyi bu /
analyzed: byang rnam thos kyi bu /
translated: the north is Kubera,

original: shar lho me lha /🔽lho nub srin @39b po ;
analyzed: shar lho me lha / lho nub srin @39b po ;
translated: the southeast is Agni,🔽the southwest is Rakshasa,

original: / nub byang rlung lha /
analyzed: / nub byang rlung lha /
translated: the northwest is Vayu,

original: byang shar mtshams dbang ldan te /
analyzed: byang shar mtshams dbang ldan te /
translated: and the northeast is Ishana.

original: de ltar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas so //
translated: They are located in this way.🔽Maheshvara,

original: dbang phyug dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: free from attachment,

original: snyan par grags pa dang / dpal dang ldan pa dang / ye shes dang ldan pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyan par grags pa dang / dpal dang ldan pa dang / ye shes dang ldan pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: famous, glorious, and wise, is called the Blessed One.

original: bdag dang / blo dang / nga rgyal dang ; yid rtsal la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yon tan dang bslabs pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / blo dang / nga rgyal dang ; yid rtsal la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yon tan dang bslabs pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: The five objects such as self, mind, pride, and dexterity, the five great elements such as space, the five sense faculties, the five action faculties, and the person endowed with qualities and training,

original: de ltar bdag gi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa lnga po de dag go //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa lnga po de dag go //
translated: Thus, these are the twenty-five natures of the self.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba'i rang bzhin ni mi gsal ba dang / gtso bo dang / snying stobs dang / dbang phyug dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / gang zag dang / sems pa dang / skyes bu dang / bdag po dang /
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba'i rang bzhin ni mi gsal ba dang / gtso bo dang / snying stobs dang / dbang phyug dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / gang zag dang / sems pa dang / skyes bu dang / bdag po dang /
translated: Among them, the natures of the self are: the unclear, the primary, courage, the almighty, life, the knower, the person, the mind, the human being, the master,

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / de dag ni bdag gi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / de dag ni bdag gi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: and the fearless. These are the synonyms of the self.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni yid gzhungs pa dang / dmigs pa dang / blo dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / blo gros chen po dang / yid kyi sems dang / dbugs kyi 'byung rngub dang / mthong ba dang / lta ba dang /
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni yid gzhungs pa dang / dmigs pa dang / blo dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / blo gros chen po dang / yid kyi sems dang / dbugs kyi 'byung rngub dang / mthong ba dang / lta ba dang /
translated: The mind is: the intellect, the object, the mind, wisdom, knowledge, great intelligence, the mental consciousness, the inhalation and exhalation of breath, seeing, and viewing.

original: de dag ni blo'i ming gi bye brag go //
analyzed: de dag ni blo'i ming gi bye brag go //
translated: These are the different names of the mind.

original: de la ngar sems pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi bdag nyid dang / bdag dpa'o snyam pa'i bdag nyid can dang / bdag nyid nor dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa dang / de dag ni rang sems pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: de la ngar sems pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi bdag nyid dang / bdag dpa'o snyam pa'i bdag nyid can dang / bdag nyid nor dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa dang / de dag ni rang sems pa'i ming ngo //
translated: These are the names of the mind that thinks “I.”

original: de la yid ces bya ba ni sems dang / yid la sems dang / sems pa dang / snying stobs dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / thogs pa med pa dang / snying la gnas pa dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa zur gyis go bar byed pa de yin no //
analyzed: de la yid ces bya ba ni sems dang / yid la sems dang / sems pa dang / snying stobs dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / thogs pa med pa dang / snying la gnas pa dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa zur gyis go bar byed pa de yin no //
translated: The mind is the mind, the mental faculty, the thinking, the courage, the nature of movement, the universal, the unobstructed, the one that abides in the heart, and the one that indirectly causes understanding of the aspects of others.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i don ni sgra la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i don ni sgra la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The objects of the ear and so on are sound and so forth.

original: spyod yul gyi yon tan nam mkha' la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: spyod yul gyi yon tan nam mkha' la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The qualities of the objects are space and so forth.

original: sgra dang / reg pa dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / de rnams kyi yon tan ni 'byung ba chen po yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra dang / reg pa dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / de rnams kyi yon tan ni 'byung ba chen po yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The elements of sound, touch, form, taste, and smell should be understood as the great elements.

original: sgra'i de tsam ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: sgra'i de tsam ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The mere sound is space.

original: reg pa'i de tsam ni sa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i de tsam ni sa'o //
translated: The element of touch is earth.

original: gzugs kyi de tsam ni me'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de tsam ni me'o //
translated: The element of form is fire.

original: ro'i de tsam ni chu'o //
analyzed: ro'i de tsam ni chu'o //
translated: The element of taste is water.

original: dri'i de tsam ni rlung yin te /🔽de ltar rnam par dbye @40a * //
analyzed: dri'i de tsam ni rlung yin te / de ltar rnam par dbye @40a * //
translated: The element of smell is wind.

original: ba lngar brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lngar brtags pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the fivefold division is imagined.

original: de ltar sman la sogs pa'i rim pa gong du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sman la sogs pa'i rim pa gong du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the sequence of medicine and so forth above,

original: 'di nas mar sman gyi ming don gcig pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nas mar sman gyi ming don gcig pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: from here on the names of the medicines will be taught.

original: sha ta ku su mi bya zhes bya ba ni sha ta pushpa yin no //
analyzed: sha ta ku su mi bya zhes bya ba ni sha ta pushpa yin no //
translated: Shatakusuma is called Shatapushpa.

original: tanta ha ti zhes bya ba ni tsan ji tsam mo //
analyzed: tanta ha ti zhes bya ba ni tsan ji tsam mo //
translated: Tandulahati is called Tandula.

original: sarba ra sa ni sardza ra sa yin no //
analyzed: sarba ra sa ni sardza ra sa yin no //
translated: Sarvarasani is called Sarjarasa.

original: ba hu sra ba ni sa la ki'o //
analyzed: ba hu sra ba ni sa la ki'o //
translated: Bahusrava is called Sallaki.

original: kumdha ma kha la go ni gu gul lo //
analyzed: kumdha ma kha la go ni gu gul lo //
translated: Kumdhamukhalaguna is called Guggulu.

original: bra bri shi ni ka bi ka tsu'o //
analyzed: bra bri shi ni ka bi ka tsu'o //
translated: Brahmashira is called Vikakachu.

original: aanni dza la ni dva ta ki ni'o //
analyzed: aanni dza la ni dva ta ki ni'o //
translated: Aninjala is called Vataki.

original: ku ra ni thu ni ya ka'o //
analyzed: ku ra ni thu ni ya ka'o //
translated: Kurunthika is called Yaka.

original: ka ti parsha ni pri ka'o //
analyzed: ka ti parsha ni pri ka'o //
translated: Katipersha is called Prikka.

original: aa ba da nti ni au sha ra'o //
analyzed: aa ba da nti ni au sha ra'o //
translated: Avadanati is called Ushara.

original: tsandan ni kambi la'o //
analyzed: tsandan ni kambi la'o //
translated: Candana is called Kambali.

original: go su ni ba la ka'o //
analyzed: go su ni ba la ka'o //
translated: Goshu is called Valaka.

original: pri had tvag nan ni sa ba ta ba ra ni'o //
analyzed: pri had tvag nan ni sa ba ta ba ra ni'o //
translated: Prithadvagganinivasa-varani.

original: ma du da ru ni aasma kshi'o //
analyzed: ma du da ru ni aasma kshi'o //
translated: Madhurani asmakashi.

original: b'i thi ra ni musta'o //
analyzed: b'i thi ra ni musta'o //
translated: Vitharana musta.

original: aasma la khya ni sha ta ba ri'o //
analyzed: aasma la khya ni sha ta ba ri'o //
translated: Asmalakhya shatavari.

original: aushta da ki ni mutstsha ba sha na ki'o //
analyzed: aushta da ki ni mutstsha ba sha na ki'o //
translated: Ushtakini mutra-vasana-kini.

original: ha ta bi sha si ni na kha'o //
analyzed: ha ta bi sha si ni na kha'o //
translated: Hatavishashi nala.

original: aanydza ke shi ni ni li ka'o //
analyzed: aanydza ke shi ni ni li ka'o //
translated: Anjakeshini nilika.

original: ai shu ba ti ni ba tsa'o //
analyzed: ai shu ba ti ni ba tsa'o //
translated: Ishupati vacha.

original: shardu la ni kam tha ka ri'o //
analyzed: shardu la ni kam tha ka ri'o //
translated: Shudhulikam thakarim.

original: hing gu la ni briha ta'o //
analyzed: hing gu la ni briha ta'o //
translated: Hingula brihati.

original: bha ni shring gi ni go kshu ra ka'o //
analyzed: bha ni shring gi ni go kshu ra ka'o //
translated: Bhanishringi gokshuraka.

original: mandu ka ra na ni syon ka'o //
analyzed: mandu ka ra na ni syon ka'o //
translated: Mandukaranasya onka.

original: go blar na ni gle ta ka ni ma du yashti'o //
analyzed: go blar na ni gle ta ka ni ma du yashti'o //
translated: Govaranaglettakam madhu-yashti.

original: ma h'a gle ta ni sa na bar ti'o //
analyzed: ma h'a gle ta ni sa na bar ti'o //
translated: Mahaglettanasavarti.

original: ku mu ti ka ni kad pa la'o //
analyzed: ku mu ti ka ni kad pa la'o //
translated: Kumutika kadali.

original: ma h'a ku mu ti ka ni ka sma ra'o //🔽sru ba briksha ni bi kang ga ta'o //
analyzed: ma h'a ku mu ti ka ni ka sma ra'o // sru ba briksha ni bi kang ga ta'o //
translated: Maha-kumutika kashmari.🔽Suva-vriksha vikangata.

original: ta ba sa briksha ni aung gu ta'o //
analyzed: ta ba sa briksha ni aung gu ta'o //
translated: Taba-vriksha anguta.

original: tsarma kshu ni bur dza'o //
analyzed: tsarma kshu ni bur dza'o //
translated: Charmakhushi burja.

original: kshi ra pu ru spri ni kang shang ka pu yi'o //
analyzed: kshi ra pu ru spri ni kang shang ka pu yi'o //
translated: Kshira-purushpriya kashangaka-puyi.

original: ma aarkang pu shyi ni pa ya sa'o //
analyzed: ma aarkang pu shyi ni pa ya sa'o //
translated: Mārkāṇḍapusya is the foot.

original: ma du pu shi ni pu tra dzi pa ka'o //🔽kan da na la ni sla ksha'o //
analyzed: ma du pu shi ni pu tra dzi pa ka'o // kan da na la ni sla ksha'o //
translated: Mādhu pusya is the son of Jiva.🔽Kṛttikā is the foot of the elephant.

original: sha pa rgya ni aasma ta ka'o //
analyzed: sha pa rgya ni aasma ta ka'o //
translated: Śravaṇa is the foot of the elephant.

original: ti la ku su ya ni tsan dang pur ti'o //
analyzed: ti la ku su ya ni tsan dang pur ti'o //
translated: Tiṣya is the foot of the elephant.

original: ba na ta bu sa ni tsi bi ta'o //🔽kamba ra ni tan tu li ya ka'o //🔽kshu ta bi dza ni ksha pa ka'o //
analyzed: ba na ta bu sa ni tsi bi ta'o // kamba ra ni tan tu li ya ka'o // kshu ta bi dza ni ksha pa ka'o //
translated: Bharaṇī is the foot of the elephant.🔽Aśvayuj is the foot of the elephant.

original: aa dza srim gi ni kra ga na ta shri ga'o //
analyzed: aa dza srim gi ni kra ga na ta shri ga'o //
translated: Bṛhaspatī is the foot of the elephant.🔽Śravaṇa is the foot of the elephant.

original: sa dan ni aa ti mukta ka'o //
analyzed: sa dan ni aa ti mukta ka'o //
translated: Śatabhiṣā is the foot of the elephant.🔽Pūrvabhādrapadā is the foot of the elephant.🔽Uttarabhādrapadā is the foot of the elephant.

original: ae la pra ni ni ra sna'o //
analyzed: ae la pra ni ni ra sna'o //
translated: Revatī is the foot of the elephant.

original: aa sa pra ni ni tsa dan yin no //🔽tsi ta prarni ni pris barni ka'o //
analyzed: aa sa pra ni ni tsa dan yin no // tsi ta prarni ni pris barni ka'o //
translated: Aśvinī is the foot of the elephant.🔽Bharaṇī is the foot of the elephant.

original: ka ka parna ni mungga parni'o //
analyzed: ka ka parna ni mungga parni'o //
translated: Kṛttikā is the foot of the elephant.

original: pan tya ro ni ma sha parni'o //
analyzed: pan tya ro ni ma sha parni'o //
translated: Rohiṇī is the foot of the elephant.🔽Mṛgaśirā is the foot of the elephant.

original: sha ra da ni kra ba sa'o //
analyzed: sha ra da ni kra ba sa'o //
translated: Ārdrā is the foot of the elephant.

original: ba ra dva dza ni pad tra ka pa sa'o //🔽bi ra ru ta ru ni ba ru na'o //🔽sho lam ni she ba la'o //
analyzed: ba ra dva dza ni pad tra ka pa sa'o // bi ra ru ta ru ni ba ru na'o // sho lam ni she ba la'o //
translated: Punarvasū is the foot of the elephant.🔽Puṣya is the foot of the elephant.

original: dan tri ka ni pad kri ri ka'o //🔽aa bi ru ba tri ni kashta pha la'o //
analyzed: dan tri ka ni pad kri ri ka'o //🔽aa bi ru ba tri ni kashta pha la'o //
translated: Āśleṣā is the foot of the elephant.

original: pantu ra ka ni ra bil la'o //
analyzed: pantu ra ka ni ra bil la'o //
translated: Pandurā is Nālandā.

original: ka k'a li ni ka k'a dampa'o //
analyzed: ka k'a li ni ka k'a dampa'o //
translated: Kākalī is Kākadam.

original: da bya dampa ra ni ae randa'o //
analyzed: da bya dampa ra ni ae randa'o //
translated: Dāvadamparā is Eranḍa.

original: ka la dza ni ka ranydza'o //

analyzed: dha ru ra'o //

original: ma du la ni ba ga'o //
analyzed: ma du la ni ba ga'o //

original: pa tya lya ni pa ta li ka'o //
analyzed: pa tya lya ni pa ta li ka'o //
translated: The pattya is called patalika.

original: aeka shi ka ni tri bi ta'o //
analyzed: aeka shi ka ni tri bi ta'o //
translated: The ekaśika is called trivita.

original: ba ru dza ni bha dhi ni ka'o //

original: pri thu la ni brishta dan du la'o //
analyzed: pri thu la ni brishta dan du la'o //

original: de dag ni sman gcig gi ming gnyis par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de dag ni sman gcig gi ming gnyis par bshad pa'o /

original: // / de nas sman gyi dngos po gcig la sman gyi ming 'dom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sman gyi dngos po gcig la sman gyi ming 'dom pa bshad par bya ste /

original: pa ya zhes bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma gnyis la zer ro //
analyzed: pa ya zhes bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma gnyis la zer ro //
translated: The word pāya is said to refer to both water and milk.

original: pin ka zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pin ka zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word piṅka

original: til gyi tshogs dang / du ru ka gnyis la zer ro //
analyzed: til gyi tshogs dang / du ru ka gnyis la zer ro //
translated: is said to refer to both sesame seeds and duruka.

original: de dag ni sha ta tva zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: de dag ni sha ta tva zhes 'dogs so //
translated: They are called śatadhu.

original: shing 'o ma can zangs ma gnyis la ni /
analyzed: shing 'o ma can zangs ma gnyis la ni /
translated: The two types of milky wood are called

original: au dumb'a ra @41a * //
analyzed: au dumb'a ra @41a * //
translated: udumbara.

original: zhes smra'o // bong nga dkar po dang / bca' sga gnyis la ba shva zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra'o // bong nga dkar po dang / bca' sga gnyis la ba shva zhes bya'o //
translated: White aconite and ginger are called bhasva.

original: aam pu dang / ba la ka gnyis la ni chu'i ming yod do //
analyzed: aam pu dang / ba la ka gnyis la ni chu'i ming yod do //
translated: Ampa and valaka have the name of water.

original: bri ha ti dang / ba sha ka gnyis la ni grub pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bri ha ti dang / ba sha ka gnyis la ni grub pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhrhati and vatsaka are said to be siddha.

original: yungs kar dang / na li ga gnyis la ni ka dampa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar dang / na li ga gnyis la ni ka dampa zhes bya'o //
translated: White mustard and nalika are called kadamba.

original: ka sha smrar ta dang / bi la ga gnyis la ni dar ka sha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ka sha smrar ta dang / bi la ga gnyis la ni dar ka sha zhes bya'o //
translated: Kashmarata and bilva are called daraksha.

original: aa ba marka dang / ko sha ta ki gnyis la ni aa ba marna zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa ba marka dang / ko sha ta ki gnyis la ni aa ba marna zhes bya'o //
translated: Avamarka and koshataki are called avamarna.

original: brag zhun dang / skyer khanda gnyis la ni ksha ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brag zhun dang / skyer khanda gnyis la ni ksha ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Brag shhun and kyer khan are called kshaka.

original: na da m'u la dang / mi shta gnyis la ni shee le ya zhes zer ro //
analyzed: na da m'u la dang / mi shta gnyis la ni shee le ya zhes zer ro //
translated: Nadamula and mishta are called sheliya.

original: ro hi dang / sa ta la la tsar ma ksha zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ro hi dang / sa ta la la tsar ma ksha zhes zer ro //
translated: Rohita and satala are called charmakha.

original: kshi ri ka dang / pi ya la la ra dza da ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kshi ri ka dang / pi ya la la ra dza da ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Kshirika and piyala are called rajadanika.

original: byi tsher ba dang / kha sral la dur la bha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byi tsher ba dang / kha sral la dur la bha zhes bya'o //
translated: Bishti and khasral are called durlabha.

original: ka da ka ri dang / aaru bar la dza ya zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ka da ka ri dang / aaru bar la dza ya zhes zer ro //
translated: Kadali and Karavira are called Aruvaraja.

original: n'a ga ge sar dang / tsam pa ka la kanytsan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: n'a ga ge sar dang / tsam pa ka la kanytsan zhes bya'o //
translated: Naga-pushpa and Champakam are called Kanchana.

original: masma dza ka dang / pu shel tsi la byi kunda zhes bya'o //
analyzed: masma dza ka dang / pu shel tsi la byi kunda zhes bya'o //
translated: Masha-pushpa and Pushpa are called Kunkuma.

original: sle tres dang / ko bid ra la kunda li zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sle tres dang / ko bid ra la kunda li zhes bya'o //
translated: Lajjalu and Kovidara are called Kundali.

original: tu la ni ka dang / ba tri ka ro da la gu mu ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tu la ni ka dang / ba tri ka ro da la gu mu ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Tulasi and Vata are called Gumuguma.

original: pu n'a ga dang / padma ge sar la ltung ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pu n'a ga dang / padma ge sar la ltung ga zhes bya'o //
translated: Punnaga and Padma-keshara are called Tungaka.

original: zer sna dang / hi ta pi pi li la sri ya se zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zer sna dang / hi ta pi pi li la sri ya se zhes bya'o //
translated: Surasana and Hitapippali are called Sriyasa.

original: shalma li dang / shi sha pa li pad tsha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shalma li dang / shi sha pa li pad tsha zhes bya'o //
translated: Shalmali and Shisha-palivarda are called Padma.

original: padma'i sa bon dang / ri'u bu phulla aa ti sha ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i sa bon dang / ri'u bu phulla aa ti sha ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Padma-bija and Riksha-phulla are called Ati-shyama.

original: masma dza ka dang / pu shel tsi la mri na la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: masma dza ka dang / pu shel tsi la mri na la zhes bya'o //
translated: Masha-pushpa and Pushpa are called Mrinala.

original: da trig dang / aa ma bi li ka la briksha aam bla zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da trig dang / aa ma bi li ka la briksha aam bla zhes bya'o //
translated: Datrig and Ama-vilikhya are called Vriksha-amla.

original: tsi ti ka dang / go bye la dha ha nu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsi ti ka dang / go bye la dha ha nu zhes bya'o //
translated: Citraka and Goji are called Dahanu.

original: grag bu'i rtsa ba dang / k'antu ranydza la aa ga ra bal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grag bu'i rtsa ba dang / k'antu ranydza la aa ga ra bal zhes bya'o //
translated: The root of the fragrant poon is called kanta-nāla-agaru.

original: padma'i sa bon dang / 'od ma'i 'bras bu la ku lu da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i sa bon dang / 'od ma'i 'bras bu la ku lu da zhes bya'o //
translated: The seed of the lotus and the fruit of bamboo are called kuṭu.

original: 'bu su ga hang dang / mur ba la de bi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bu su ga hang dang / mur ba la de bi zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, bamboo manna and betel nut, are called devī.

original: la la phud dang / timu sa la di bya ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la la phud dang / timu sa la di bya ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, the fruit of the tinduka tree and the fruit of the tilimusa tree, are called dīvakas.

original: la manydza ka dang / pu shel tsi la la se bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la manydza ka dang / pu shel tsi la la se bya zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, the fruit of the tinduka tree and the fruit of the puṣhel tree, are called lasya.

original: ting mu sa dang / shu ti la ka ra pi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting mu sa dang / shu ti la ka ra pi zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, the fruit of the tinduka tree and the fruit of the śüti tree, are called karapī.

original: hing ha mi tri ka dang / aa tsa gandha la ka ra tsi zhes bya'o //🔽gze ma dang / bi kang ka ta la sva du gandha @41b ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: hing ha mi tri ka dang / aa tsa gandha la ka ra tsi zhes bya'o // gze ma dang / bi kang ka ta la sva du gandha @41b ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, the fruit of the tinduka tree and the fruit of the acchigandha tree, are called karacī.🔽The two, the fruit of the tinduka tree and the fruit of the vikankata tree, are called svadugandha.

original: 'bu sug hang dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba gnyis la 'bri mi zhes bya'o //🔽chu las skyes pa'i shing mngar dang / mur ba la ru li zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bu sug hang dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba gnyis la 'bri mi zhes bya'o // chu las skyes pa'i shing mngar dang / mur ba la ru li zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, bamboo manna and the root of the cardamom, are called brimhi.🔽The two, the sweet water-born plant and betel nut, are called rulu.

original: mur pa dang / tsim bi la pid lu par ti ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mur pa dang / tsim bi la pid lu par ti ni zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, betel nut and the fruit of the cimbi tree, are called pidalupartinī.

original: go bye dang / langga li la aagni mu kshi zhes bya'o //🔽gur gum dang / le brgan rtsil aagni mu khi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: go bye dang / langga li la aagni mu kshi zhes bya'o // gur gum dang / le brgan rtsil aagni mu khi zhes bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of turmeric are called agnimukhi.🔽Saffron and madder are called agnimukhi.

original: dur byid dang / rgya sran la aa lad ti ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dur byid dang / rgya sran la aa lad ti ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Nutmeg and beans are called alati.

original: btsag yug snam dang / thal tres la aa sbu ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsag yug snam dang / thal tres la aa sbu ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Red ochre and salt are called asphuta.

original: mu sa li dang / mi sra la ta ma la'i lo ma zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mu sa li dang / mi sra la ta ma la'i lo ma zhes zer ro //
translated: Musali and bamboo manna are called tamalapatra.

original: pa tha dang ; byi tang ga la ma nu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa tha dang ; byi tang ga la ma nu zhes bya'o //
translated: Patha and bhitanga are called manah.

original: mi sri dang / tsa na ka mu ni la gha la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi sri dang / tsa na ka mu ni la gha la zhes bya'o //
translated: Bamboo manna and chandana are called ghanala.

original: sti ni sha dang / banydza la yan da na zhes so //🔽ya ba sha ka dang / seng ldeng la sa'i lo ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sti ni sha dang / banydza la yan da na zhes so // ya ba sha ka dang / seng ldeng la sa'i lo ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Sitinisha and vanjula are called yandana.🔽Yavashaka and kashmari are called salapatra.

original: lo mi ni dang / sug smel la ta hma zhes so //
analyzed: lo mi ni dang / sug smel la ta hma zhes so //
translated: Lomikini and dry ginger are called taham.

original: shu dag dang / la la phud la aa gran dam zhes so //
analyzed: shu dag dang / la la phud la aa gran dam zhes so //
translated: Shudaka and some kinds of long pepper are called agrandha.

original: zangs rtsi ba dang / chu'i pi pi ling la ga ra da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zangs rtsi ba dang / chu'i pi pi ling la ga ra da zhes bya'o //
translated: Copper sulphate and water pipiling are called garada.

original: pi pi ling dang / ti la mu pa la ka na zhes so //
analyzed: pi pi ling dang / ti la mu pa la ka na zhes so //
translated: Pipiling and til are called kanaka.

original: langga li dang / aindra ba ru la aindra zhes so //
analyzed: langga li dang / aindra ba ru la aindra zhes so //
translated: Langali and Indravāruṇī are called Indrā.

original: d'ur ba dang / mansa ri hi la gu ha la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: d'ur ba dang / mansa ri hi la gu ha la zhes bya'o //
translated: Dūrva and menasrihi are called guhala.

original: dud pa dang / shu dag la go li mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dud pa dang / shu dag la go li mi zhes bya'o //
translated: Smoke and śigru are called golomi.

original: pri yang ku dang / tsam pa ka la gandha phal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pri yang ku dang / tsam pa ka la gandha phal zhes bya'o //
translated: Priyangu and campaka are called gandhaplu.

original: dz'a ti pha ti ka dang / dz'a ti pha la la so ma na shu na ka zhes so //
analyzed: dz'a ti pha ti ka dang / dz'a ti pha la la so ma na shu na ka zhes so //
translated: Jātiphāṭikā and jātiphala are called somanaśaṅka.

original: gandha pa la shi ka dang / ga bur la shi shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gandha pa la shi ka dang / ga bur la shi shi zhes bya'o //
translated: Gandhapalāśika and camphor are called śiśa.

original: ain ba ru ni dang ; chang gnyis la ba ru ni zhes gdags so //
analyzed: ain ba ru ni dang ; chang gnyis la ba ru ni zhes gdags so //
translated: The two, inabāruṇī and wine, are called bāruṇī.

original: spang spos dang / ma da ga manydza ri la ta pa sri ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spang spos dang / ma da ga manydza ri la ta pa sri ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Spikenard and madagajamari are called taprasrīṇi.

original: ku ranta ka dang / sa ha tsa ra gnyis la aa mra la ni ku ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ku ranta ka dang / sa ha tsa ra gnyis la aa mra la ni ku ra zhes bya'o //
translated: The two, kuruntaka and sahācara, are called amralāninikurā.

original: yung dang / gi wang la gi ri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yung dang / gi wang la gi ri zhes bya'o //
translated: Yellow and realgar are called giri.

original: dung tsang rdo dang / 'tsho byed gnyis la ma du ra zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: dung tsang rdo dang / 'tsho byed gnyis la ma du ra zhes 'dogs so //
translated: Conch shell and life-giving are called madhu.

original: shing tsha dang / tsa li pa ta la tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing tsha dang / tsa li pa ta la tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Śirīṣa and calīpata are called śobhā.

original: ni rgun thi dang / sin du ba dang / shar la she pha li zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: ni rgun thi dang / sin du ba dang / shar la she pha li zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) grapes, Sindhuva, and Sharalashephali.

original: ku sumba dang / padma ge sar la padmo dir zhes smra'o //
analyzed: ku sumba dang / padma ge sar la padmo dir zhes smra'o //
translated: (They are called) Kusumbha and lotus filaments padma-keshara.

original: lyam tsha dang / mi sra tsa ni @42a * //
analyzed: lyam tsha dang / mi sra tsa ni @42a * //
translated: (They are called) lyamtsa and misracana.

original: la shi ta pa zhes bya'o //🔽rgya shug dang / ka ko la la ka ko la zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: la shi ta pa zhes bya'o // rgya shug dang / ka ko la la ka ko la zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) lashipa.🔽(They are called) jujube and kakola.

original: ka ka dza ga dang / nag tshur la ma la ma sa zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: ka ka dza ga dang / nag tshur la ma la ma sa zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) kakajaka and malamasu.

original: mo ra ta dang / bir ta ru la dhirga m'u la zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: mo ra ta dang / bir ta ru la dhirga m'u la zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) morata and viratarula.

original: hing gu ba tri ka dang ; au pa kun zin dang / zir nag po dang / sug smel dang / de dag ni pri to ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: hing gu ba tri ka dang ; au pa kun zin dang / zir nag po dang / sug smel dang / de dag ni pri to ka zhes bya'o //
translated: (They are called) hingugapatrika, upakunthita, ziran, and dry ginger.

original: 'ol ma si dang / mon sran sne'u dang / dme ru la dang / ka k'a ha zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'ol ma si dang / mon sran sne'u dang / dme ru la dang / ka k'a ha zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) olmashi, mung beans, cumin, and kakahva.

original: sa la parni dang / byi tsher ba gnyis la dirga m'u la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa la parni dang / byi tsher ba gnyis la dirga m'u la zhes bya'o //
translated: (They are called) salaparni and the two kinds of bishvabeshala.

original: dzambi ri dang / ba ma ga gnyis la ni mar pa ko zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: dzambi ri dang / ba ma ga gnyis la ni mar pa ko zhes 'dogs so //
translated: (They are called) jambu and bamaga.

original: ba la ka dang / lcang ma ni dza la ste chu'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ba la ka dang / lcang ma ni dza la ste chu'i ming ngo //
translated: Balaka and Changma are the names of water.

original: bi sha ni ka dang / me sha shri gyi la zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: bi sha ni ka dang / me sha shri gyi la zhes 'dogs so //
translated: Vishakha and Meshashrigvi are the names of the constellations.

original: dan ti dang / dran can ti la bra takshi ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dan ti dang / dran can ti la bra takshi ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Danta and Dranchanta are the names of the teeth.

original: shi ta la dang ; ba ta ku dang / cag dang / de dag ni aa ba ra bi ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shi ta la dang ; ba ta ku dang / cag dang / de dag ni aa ba ra bi ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Shitila, Vata, and Chag are the names of the Avadavit.

original: ka ka dzad na dang / dzo ti sman ti la la ta parti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ka ka dzad na dang / dzo ti sman ti la la ta parti zhes bya'o //
translated: Kakajadana and Zhotismanti are the names of the latapatis.

original: 'od ma dang / dug mo nyung la ba ya hpa la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od ma dang / dug mo nyung la ba ya hpa la zhes bya'o //
translated: Odma and Dugmo Nung are the names of the Vayahapalas.

original: kanda ka ri dang / byi tsher ba dhu yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kanda ka ri dang / byi tsher ba dhu yang zhes bya'o //
translated: Kandakari and Tsherwa are the names of the Vadhus.

original: ras bal dang ; bimbi la tundi ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ras bal dang ; bimbi la tundi ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Cotton and Bimbi are the names of the Tundikas.

original: rgya spos dang / syi na ka la na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya spos dang / syi na ka la na zhes bya'o //
translated: Sandalwood and Sinyaka are the names of the Kalanas.

original: bha ta dang / tsi tra dang / ra ni la bed na ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bha ta dang / tsi tra dang / ra ni la bed na ha zhes bya'o //
translated: Bhata, Citra, and Rani are the names of the Vedanas.

original: ka ku ba dang / dzal pi pi ling la sha ku ta ni ng gsum la aa mri ta zhes bya'o /
analyzed: ka ku ba dang / dzal pi pi ling la sha ku ta ni ng gsum la aa mri ta zhes bya'o /
translated: Kakubha, Jalpi, and Pippali are the names of the Shakutanis.

original: pa ri pella pa dang // ka ka ka la ba dang / ku ta nanta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ri pella pa dang // ka ka ka la ba dang / ku ta nanta zhes bya'o //
translated: Kakakalapa, and Kutantan.

original: btsod dang / tu ta na tu li ri la bhandhi ri ka zhes bya'o //🔽shre ba sa dang / kshi ri ka ru dang / gnyis la ni zho'i ming ni da dhi da zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsod dang / tu ta na tu li ri la bhandhi ri ka zhes bya'o // shre ba sa dang / kshi ri ka ru dang / gnyis la ni zho'i ming ni da dhi da zhes bya'o //
translated: Bile is called Tutana, Tuleriri, and Bhandhirika.🔽Pus is called Srava,🔽Kshirika, and Rudhi.🔽The two kinds of milk are called Dadhi and Dadhi.

original: nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / sardzi ka'i thal ba gnyis ni thal ba ste /🔽ksha ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / sardzi ka'i thal ba gnyis ni thal ba ste / ksha ra zhes bya'o //
translated: The two kinds of ashes are called Kshara.

original: te dzo ba ti dang / d'ur ba la te dzi ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: te dzo ba ti dang / d'ur ba la te dzi ni zhes bya'o //
translated: Tejovati and Durbalatej are called Teja.

original: 'dam bu dang / ldong ros la te dza na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dam bu dang / ldong ros la te dza na zhes bya'o //
translated: Mud and red arsenic are called Tejana.

original: sha kha na li ka dang / yungs kar sha kha na li ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sha kha na li ka dang / yungs kar sha kha na li ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Black mustard and white mustard are called Shakhanika.

original: pa to la to dang / ku la ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa to la to dang / ku la ka zhes bya'o //
translated: Pattola and kulaka are called Pattola.

original: aa pa marga dang / ko sha da ki la dang / dha mar la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa pa marga dang / ko sha da ki la dang / dha mar la zhes bya'o //
translated: Apamarga, koshadhika, and dhamala are called Apamarga.

original: ae @42b randa dang / ga gon la hang sto parni zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ae @42b randa dang / ga gon la hang sto parni zhes zer ro //
translated: Eranda and gonasa are called Hangastopa.

original: nye'u shing dang / mur ba la sha da birya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye'u shing dang / mur ba la sha da birya zhes bya'o //
translated: Neem and murva are called Shadaviya.

original: nye'u shing dang / d'ur ba dkar po la sa sra d'ur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye'u shing dang / d'ur ba dkar po la sa sra d'ur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Nyagrodha and Ficus religiosa are called srapadurva.

original: dzambi ra dang / ka pi ra dang / ka pid la la dantha sha tha zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dzambi ra dang / ka pi ra dang / ka pid la la dantha sha tha zhes zer ro //
translated: Jambu, Kapitha, and Kabeli are called danthashtha.

original: tsang gi ri dang / aam byi la danda sha thi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsang gi ri dang / aam byi la danda sha thi zhes bya'o //
translated: Tsangiri and ambila are called danashthi.

original: tsa ki ri dang / da trig la aa ma li ka zhes 'dogs so //🔽n'i la padma dang / rgya shug la ku la ba zhes so //
analyzed: tsa ki ri dang / da trig la aa ma li ka zhes 'dogs so // n'i la padma dang / rgya shug la ku la ba zhes so //
translated: Chakiri and datrig are called amalika.🔽Nilapadma and jujube are called kulava.

original: ka dan pa dang / ku ra ku ti la n'i la pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ka dan pa dang / ku ra ku ti la n'i la pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Kadamba and kurkuti are called nilapa.

original: chu'i shing dang / aa sa ma dza ta la ma du ku la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i shing dang / aa sa ma dza ta la ma du ku la zhes bya'o //
translated: Water-chestnut and asamajata are called madhuka.

original: ba li dang / ge ri pushpa la ba la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba li dang / ge ri pushpa la ba la zhes bya'o //
translated: Bili and geru flower are called bala.

original: ku sman da dang / ka pid th'a la pu sha pha la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ku sman da dang / ka pid th'a la pu sha pha la zhes bya'o //
translated: Kusmanda and kapeeta are called pushpaphala.

original: 'dab bu dang / bring ga ra la bring ga dza ru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab bu dang / bring ga ra la bring ga dza ru zhes bya'o //
translated: Duckweed and brihgal are called brihgaja.

original: danta dang / dra tsandi la tsa tra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: danta dang / dra tsandi la tsa tra zhes bya'o //
translated: Dhanta and dracandrika are called chatra.

original: da trig dang / pri yangku la au pha bhitstsha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da trig dang / pri yangku la au pha bhitstsha zhes bya'o //
translated: Datrig and priyangku are called upabhiksha.

original: aagni mantha dang / tang pa la dang / padma bdu dang gsum la shi parni zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: aagni mantha dang / tang pa la dang / padma bdu dang gsum la shi parni zhes 'dogs so //
translated: Agnika, Mantha, and Tangpala are called Shiparna.

original: tunti ka ra ka dang / tang pa la dang / gnyis la ni nan tri briksha zhes bya'o /
analyzed: tunti ka ra ka dang / tang pa la dang / gnyis la ni nan tri briksha zhes bya'o /
translated: Tundika, Kara, and Tangpala, these two, are called Nantivriksha.

original: // / da ni sman gyi don gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sman gyi don gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the third meaning of medicine should be explained.

original: rtsab mo dang ; stang zil dang / rgya shug dang gsum po ni aanydza na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsab mo dang ; stang zil dang / rgya shug dang gsum po ni aanydza na zhes bya'o //
translated: Rasa, Sthauhinya, and Badara, these three, are called Anjana.

original: nim pa dang / sgog skya dang / aa sa ba'i chang dang gsum la ni aa ri ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nim pa dang / sgog skya dang / aa sa ba'i chang dang gsum la ni aa ri ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Nimva, garlic, and asafoetida, these three, are called Arita.

original: byi tsher ba dang / kanda ka ri dang / ka pi kan tshu gsum la dhung yarsha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byi tsher ba dang / kanda ka ri dang / ka pi kan tshu gsum la dhung yarsha zhes bya'o //
translated: Bhisha, kandali, and kapikacchu, these three, are called Dhanyarsha.

original: pri mangku dang dur byid dang / pi pi ling gsum la ni sha ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pri mangku dang dur byid dang / pi pi ling gsum la ni sha ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Priyangu, durva, and pippali, these three, are called Shama.

original: pi pi ling dang / au pa kunydza ka dang / ni li ni gsum la ni krishna zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pi pi ling dang / au pa kunydza ka dang / ni li ni gsum la ni krishna zhes bya'o //
translated: Pippali, upakunchaka, and nilini, these three, are called Krishna.

original: pa tha dang / mu tsi ka dang / tsam gi ri gsum la ni aa ma shta zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: pa tha dang / mu tsi ka dang / tsam gi ri gsum la ni aa ma shta zhes 'dogs so //
translated: Patha, mustaka, and chamgiri are called amashta.

original: pinta ka ra dang / spra tshil dang / lang tang tshe gsum la ma dam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pinta ka ra dang / spra tshil dang / lang tang tshe gsum la ma dam zhes bya'o //
translated: Pindakara, beeswax, and langali are called madam.

original: sle tres dang / skyu ru ra dang / aa ru ra dang gsum la aa mri ta zhes bya ste bdud rtsi yin no //
analyzed: sle tres dang / skyu ru ra dang / aa ru ra dang gsum la aa mri ta zhes bya ste bdud rtsi yin no //
translated: Nitrida, tamarind, and haritaki are called amrita, which is nectar.

original: yung ba dang / 'bra go dang / ting gu bkri ka la byin ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yung ba dang / 'bra go dang / ting gu bkri ka la byin ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Indigo, sesame, and tinguk are called bindu.

original: ba kurtsi dang / bra hmi dang / @43a * //
analyzed: ba kurtsi dang / bra hmi dang / @43a * //
translated: Bakurji, brahmi,

original: sle tres la so ma ba li zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sle tres la so ma ba li zhes bya'o //
translated: and nitrida are called somavati.

original: shri sha dang / thu ni ya ka dab /
analyzed: shri sha dang / thu ni ya ka dab /
translated: Shrisha, thunika,

original: ba lu'i lo ma la shu ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba lu'i lo ma la shu ka zhes bya'o //
translated: and barley leaves are called shuka.

original: au pa kunydzi ka dang / btsod dang / ni li ka la ka la zhes bya'o //🔽bong nga dang / dur byad dang / bku tsi la ka la mi shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: au pa kunydzi ka dang / btsod dang / ni li ka la ka la zhes bya'o // bong nga dang / dur byad dang / bku tsi la ka la mi shi zhes bya'o //
translated: Upacunjika, madder, and nilika are called kala.🔽Asafoetida, turmeric, and kutsita are called kalamisha.

original: rgya spos dang / pri mang ku dang / thal tres la ka la na sa ri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya spos dang / pri mang ku dang / thal tres la ka la na sa ri zhes bya'o //
translated: Sandalwood, priyangu, and taltris are called kalanasha.

original: rgya skyegs shing dang / zur ba dang / bre'u sul ba la sha na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya skyegs shing dang / zur ba dang / bre'u sul ba la sha na zhes bya'o //
translated: The trees called “red lac” and “corner” and “pot-shaped” are called śaṇa.

original: chu shing dang / shal ma li ka dang / sa bon la son ka zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: chu shing dang / shal ma li ka dang / sa bon la son ka zhes 'dogs so //
translated: The trees called “banana” and “śālmali” and “seed-holder” are called sonaka.

original: hi gu la tri ka dang / au pa kunydzi ka dang / sug sems la pri thi ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: hi gu la tri ka dang / au pa kunydzi ka dang / sug sems la pri thi ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The trees called “higulika” and “upakuñjaka” and “sukha” are called prīthikā.

original: sug smel dang / thal tres dang / dzo tisma ti la pa ta zhes bya'o //🔽sa la go dang / mu ra dang / ai la ba lu ka la sur byi zhes 'dogs so /
analyzed: sug smel dang / thal tres dang / dzo tisma ti la pa ta zhes bya'o // sa la go dang / mu ra dang / ai la ba lu ka la sur byi zhes 'dogs so /
translated: The plants called “fennel” and “fennel-flower” and “zostra” are called pāṭhā.🔽The plants called “salge” and “mūra” and “ilavaka” are called surbhi.

original: shrib sa dang / bil ba dang ; li shi la sti y'a h'a zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shrib sa dang / bil ba dang ; li shi la sti y'a h'a zhes bya'o //
translated: The plants called “śṛṃgāṭaka” and “bilva” and “lichavi” are called styāhana.

original: brag zhun dang / rdo dreg dang / ldong ros la li la ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brag zhun dang / rdo dreg dang / ldong ros la li la ha zhes bya'o //
translated: The plants called “orpiment” and “realgar” and “red arsenic” are called līlāha.

original: tsa panka dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / padma ki na ja la ka la tsa pa l'i ya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsa panka dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / padma ki na ja la ka la tsa pa l'i ya zhes bya'o //
translated: The plants called “capakam” and “naga-kesara” and “lotus-stalk” are called capalī.

original: aa pa marga dang / ti mus dang / spangs pa ma lam y'u ra ka zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: aa pa marga dang / ti mus dang / spangs pa ma lam y'u ra ka zhes 'dogs so //
translated: The plants called “apāmārga” and “timusa” and “abandoned” are called yūrakam.

original: rtsa la ru tsha dang / ya bksha ra dang / mching bu la ba kya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa la ru tsha dang / ya bksha ra dang / mching bu la ba kya zhes bya'o //
translated: The roots are called ruca, yavakṣāra, and mṛttikā.

original: sle tres dang / tang pa la dang / ni li kal ma du parna zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sle tres dang / tang pa la dang / ni li kal ma du parna zhes bya'o //
translated: The fruits are called śleṣmātaka, kapittha, and nilī.

original: pa ri pel ba dang / aa shva khur dang / pashsha bi she shal brta ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ri pel ba dang / aa shva khur dang / pashsha bi she shal brta ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The leaves are called paripelava, aśvakarṇa, and paśupāśa.

original: lcim rtsa dang ; sha mi sha dang / ring di dang gsum la shi mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lcim rtsa dang ; sha mi sha dang / ring di dang gsum la shi mi zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, śimśapā, śirīṣa, and śālmali, are called śimśapā.

original: rgya shug dang / sla ba dang / ma dha na la ghonta zhes bya'o //🔽au pa kunydzi ka dang / ka ra bil la dang / punda r'i ka la su sha di zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya shug dang / sla ba dang / ma dha na la ghonta zhes bya'o // au pa kunydzi ka dang / ka ra bil la dang / punda r'i ka la su sha di zhes bya'o //
translated: The fruits are called badara, śleṣmātaka, and madhuka.🔽The fruits are called upakūñjaka, karavīra, and puṇḍarīka.

original: dung dang / ba la ka dang / la shil ba rinydza zhes bya'o //🔽kha san dang / aa pa marga dang / pu ti ka ranydza la ma ra ka ti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dung dang / ba la ka dang / la shil ba rinydza zhes bya'o // kha san dang / aa pa marga dang / pu ti ka ranydza la ma ra ka ti zhes bya'o //
translated: The fruits are called śaṅkha, valkala, and laśuna.🔽The fruits are called khaśa, apāmārga, and putika.

original: kha aa shva shan da dang / ba ra hi ba ra ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha aa shva shan da dang / ba ra hi ba ra ra zhes bya'o //
translated: The fruits are called kāśmaryaphalaka, varāhī, and varārakṣa.

original: sla ksha dang / aam ba dang / shri shi dang gsum la ni aa mra ta ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sla ksha dang / aam ba dang / shri shi dang gsum la ni aa mra ta ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, ślakṣṇa, ambha, and śrīśi, are called amṛta.

original: seng ldeng dkar po dang / kad pa la dang / @43b karnydza la so mang bang ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: seng ldeng dkar po dang / kad pa la dang / @43b karnydza la so mang bang ka zhes bya'o //
translated: White teak, kadamba, and karṇaja are called somaṃga.

original: star bu dang / shing kun dang / gla rtsi la he sa sra bi do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: star bu dang / shing kun dang / gla rtsi la he sa sra bi do zhes bya'o //
translated: Vetiver, costus, and musk are called heṣa-srava.

original: ma nu dang / gur gum dang / bu shar la ka mir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma nu dang / gur gum dang / bu shar la ka mir zhes bya'o //
translated: Mānuṣa, saffron, and bhusāra are called kamira.

original: lcang ma dang / sapndha ra dang / aa sho la la bhadzul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lcang ma dang / sapndha ra dang / aa sho la la bhadzul zhes bya'o //
translated: Bamboo, spandhara, and aśoka are called bhañjula.

original: aa sa na dang ; pri yangku dang / ku ram pa la bri yangku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa sa na dang ; pri yangku dang / ku ram pa la bri yangku zhes bya'o //
translated: Āsana, priyaṅgu, and kurāmba are called priyaṅgu.

original: manda ra dang / bir dza ta dang / thang shing la pa ri bha tra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: manda ra dang / bir dza ta dang / thang shing la pa ri bha tra zhes bya'o //
translated: Mandāra, virāṭa, and pine are called paribhadra.

original: sle tres dang / ri ka ru ha dang / shak bi she sha la dzi banti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sle tres dang / ri ka ru ha dang / shak bi she sha la dzi banti zhes bya'o //
translated: Lentil, rikaru, and śakaviseṣa are called jīvantī.

original: bimbi dang / du yar sha dang / pi ta yu ti dang gsum la he ma pu shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bimbi dang / du yar sha dang / pi ta yu ti dang gsum la he ma pu shi zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, bimbi, dūrvā, and pitāyuti, are called hemapuṣpa.

original: lcim rtsa dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba dang / padma na ti ka la padma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lcim rtsa dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba dang / padma na ti ka la padma zhes bya'o //
translated: The roots of turmeric and of the plant called ga-bra are called padma.

original: kunta ka dang / ras bal dang / yab ka ka la su manta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kunta ka dang / ras bal dang / yab ka ka la su manta zhes bya'o //
translated: The kun-ta-ka, cotton, and the plant called yab-ka are called su-man-ta.

original: tsha dang / skyur dang / tsang gar la prig ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tsha dang / skyur dang / tsang gar la prig ga zhes bya'o //
translated: The hot, sour, and pungent are called prik-ga.

original: ta trig dang / tshva dang star bu la tsu tri ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ta trig dang / tshva dang star bu la tsu tri ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The salt and the plant called ta-trik are called cu-trik.

original: bu tri na dang / bu ni ba la ni bhu ni ti ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bu tri na dang / bu ni ba la ni bhu ni ti ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The plant called bu-tri-na and the plant called bu-ni-ba-la are called bhu-ni-ti-ka.

original: ra sna dang / sa la ka dang / pa tha la ni ra sa zhes 'dogs so //🔽yab sha ka dang / pi pi ling dang / d'ur ba la ni ran tra zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: ra sna dang / sa la ka dang / pa tha la ni ra sa zhes 'dogs so // yab sha ka dang / pi pi ling dang / d'ur ba la ni ran tra zhes 'dogs so //
translated: The plant called ra-na, the plant called sa-la-ka, and the plant called pa-tha-la are called ra-sa.🔽The plant called yab-sha-ka, the plant called pi-pi-ling, and the plant called dur-ba are called ran-tra.

original: pa ta la dang / ta pa la dang ma sha parni kri sha mri ti ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ta la dang / ta pa la dang ma sha parni kri sha mri ti ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The plant called pa-ta-la, the plant called ta-pa-la, and the plant called ma-sha-par-ni-kri-sha-mrti-ka are called ran-tra.

original: chu lcang dang / star bu dang / tad ka ri la na de ya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu lcang dang / star bu dang / tad ka ri la na de ya zhes bya'o //
translated: The plant called chu-lchang, the plant called ta-trik, and the plant called ta-ka-ri are called na-de-ya.

original: karka ta dang / ranna zhes bya ba rin po che'i bye brag dang / de dag ni be ta ka zhes bya'o //
analyzed: karka ta dang / ranna zhes bya ba rin po che'i bye brag dang / de dag ni be ta ka zhes bya'o //
translated: The plant called kar-ka-ta and the plant called ran-na are called rin-po-che-byi-drak, and they are called be-ta-ka.

original: n'i la chus pa dang / gandha ba shal dang / so gandhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: n'i la chus pa dang / gandha ba shal dang / so gandhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Nīla, chāpala, and gandhabhāṣa are called sogandhika.

original: rasna dang / she pha li dang / ga dan ku li dang gsum la ni su ba ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rasna dang / she pha li dang / ga dan ku li dang gsum la ni su ba ha zhes bya'o //
translated: Rasna, śephālikā, and gadan kuli are called subaha.

original: rgya skyegs dang / gu gul dang / gze ma la ni pa lam sha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya skyegs dang / gu gul dang / gze ma la ni pa lam sha zhes bya'o //
translated: Lākṣā, guggula, and ajamoda are called palāśa.

original: he ma ba ti dang / aa ru ra dang / shu dag dkar po la ni he mam ba ti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: he ma ba ti dang / aa ru ra dang / shu dag dkar po la ni he mam ba ti zhes bya'o //
translated: Hemāvati, harītakī, and white śigru are called hemāvati.

original: aa ru ra dang / ma h'a sra ba ni dang / lcim rtsal ni aa pa tha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / ma h'a sra ba ni dang / lcim rtsal ni aa pa tha zhes bya'o //
translated: Harītakī, mahāsauvarcala, and cintā are called apatā.

original: da da ki dang / dur byid dang / pa tal gsum la ni aa pra pu sho zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da da ki dang / dur byid dang / pa tal gsum la ni aa pra pu sho zhes bya'o //
translated: Dadhi, uśīra, and patra are called aprāpuṣa.

original: shu dag dang / shu ti dang / gi wang dang gsum la ni shambi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shu dag dang / shu ti dang / gi wang dang gsum la ni shambi zhes bya'o //
translated: Śigru, śigru, and gorocanā are called śambī.

original: langga li dang / nan nyi dang / sle tres la bi sha pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: langga li dang / nan nyi dang / sle tres la bi sha pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Laṅgali, nandi, and parpaṭaka are called viśa.

original: @44a * // rma shing dang / seng ldeng dang / tsandan dmar po gsum la ni rakta sa tar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @44a * // rma shing dang / seng ldeng dang / tsandan dmar po gsum la ni rakta sa tar zhes bya'o //
translated: Rāma, khadira, and rakta-candana are called rakta-sāra.

original: bong nga dkar po dang / kar sha shring gi dang / mi sha bi shin ka gsum la ni shing gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bong nga dkar po dang / kar sha shring gi dang / mi sha bi shin ka gsum la ni shing gi zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, white aconite, karsha shringi, and human flesh, are called wood.

original: ya sho dang / d'ur ba dang / ka tsi dan tshu dang gsum la ni kang tshu ra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ya sho dang / d'ur ba dang / ka tsi dan tshu dang gsum la ni kang tshu ra zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, yasha, durva, and kachidantshu, are called kangtsha.

original: bhushma dang / bcod dang / aarya lang ke la mandu ka parni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bhushma dang / bcod dang / aarya lang ke la mandu ka parni zhes bya'o //
translated: Bhushma, choed, and aryalangke are called manduka.

original: tintu la dang / seng ldeng smug po dang / tam la gsum la ni ka la skanda zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tintu la dang / seng ldeng smug po dang / tam la gsum la ni ka la skanda zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, tindula, brown ebony, and tamala, are called kalaskanda.

original: kha sral phre'u dang / krishna parni dang / sa mang ga la sva yang gul ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha sral phre'u dang / krishna parni dang / sa mang ga la sva yang gul ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Khashar phreu, krishnaparni, and samanga are called yanggul.

original: tri ka dang / soo manydza na dang / rgya mtsho'i tsha gsum la ni aa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tri ka dang / soo manydza na dang / rgya mtsho'i tsha gsum la ni aa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, trika, somaraja, and ocean salt, are called ashpa.

original: til dang / ko k'i laksha dang / gze ma gsum la ni kur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: til dang / ko k'i laksha dang / gze ma gsum la ni kur zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, sesame, kokilaksha, and cumin, are called kur.

original: rgun 'bru dang / mur ba dang / tang ba la gsum la ni ma du ras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgun 'bru dang / mur ba dang / tang ba la gsum la ni ma du ras zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, grapes, plums, and tamarind, are called madhura.

original: mi tri ka dang / nye'u shing dang / pu gtsang sto dang gsum la ni sa du sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi tri ka dang / nye'u shing dang / pu gtsang sto dang gsum la ni sa du sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Mitraka, Nyagrodha, and Putika, are called Sata.

original: aa sa pa marga dang / rgya mtsho'i cha dang / dha ti pi pi ling gsum la ni ba sir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa sa pa marga dang / rgya mtsho'i cha dang / dha ti pi pi ling gsum la ni ba sir zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Asafetida, part of the ocean, and Dhataki Pippali, are called Vasira.

original: mungga parni bha la dang / de dag ni sa ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mungga parni bha la dang / de dag ni sa ha zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Mungaparna, Vibha, and Parna, are called Saha.

original: ma sha parna dang / ma h'a ba la dang / be ta ra ni gsum la ni ma h'a sa h'a zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma sha parna dang / ma h'a ba la dang / be ta ra ni gsum la ni ma h'a sa h'a zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Mashaparna, Mahavala, and Vetara, are called Mahasah.

original: cha bu chang stong dang / bye'u rug pa'i dang / aa ru ra dang gsum la ni ka pa ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cha bu chang stong dang / bye'u rug pa'i dang / aa ru ra dang gsum la ni ka pa ta zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Chabu, Changtong, and Byurugpa, are called Kapata.

original: ksha yang shdi ki zhes bya'o //🔽pa dang / sle tres dang / skyu ru ra gsum la ni arka dang / kun dang / bil ba la ni dpushpa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ksha yang shdi ki zhes bya'o // pa dang / sle tres dang / skyu ru ra gsum la ni arka dang / kun dang / bil ba la ni dpushpa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ksha is also called Shidiki.🔽The three, Pa, Letra, and Kyurura, are called Arka, Kun, and Vilva.

original: ksha ra ka ko li dang / aardzun dang / dharba byi she sha dang gsum la ni bi ra na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ksha ra ka ko li dang / aardzun dang / dharba byi she sha dang gsum la ni bi ra na zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, Kshara, Kola, and Arjunda, are called Virana.

original: aa sha ra ka ra na dang / aa sa na dang / sa la dang / sum la ni rsar dza zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa sha ra ka ra na dang / aa sa na dang / sa la dang / sum la ni rsar dza zhes bya'o //
translated: sumula, and rasajha are called three.🔽ari,

original: aa ri ka dang / shri sha dang gsum la ni aa ra tra zhes bya'o /
analyzed: aa ri ka dang / shri sha dang gsum la ni aa ra tra zhes bya'o /
translated: and śṛṅga are called three.

original: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa mdzad pa'i slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sman gyi ming gi rnam grangs mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i 'grel pa mdzad pa'i slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sman gyi ming gi rnam grangs mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The master Candrakīrti, who composed the commentary on the Essence of the Eight Branches of Medical Science, has completed the compilation of the synonyms of medical terms such as the eight branches.
